89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: I am indeed the plain Wagner

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Like as We sent down on them who took oaths

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who divided the Qur’an into parts

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So, by thy Lord! We shall question them all

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As to what they did

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therefore declare openly what thou art commanded, and turn away from he polytheists

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We are sufficient for thee against the scoffers -

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who set up another god with Allah; so they will come to know

97.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We know indeed that thy breast straitens at what they say

98.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So celebrate the praise of thy Lord, and be of those who make obeisance

99.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And serve thy Lord, until there comes to thee that which is certain

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah’s commandment will come to pass, so seek not to hasten it. Glory be to Him, and highly exalted be He above what they associate (with Him)

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He sends down angels with revelation by His command on whom He pleases of His servants saying: Give the warning that there is no God but Me, so keep your duty to Me

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He created the heavens and the earth with truth. Highly exalted be He above what they associate (with Him)

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He created man from a small life-germ, and lo! he is an open contender

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the cattle, He has created them for you. You have in them warm clothing and (other) advantages, and of them you eat

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And therein is beauty for you, when you drive them back (home) and when you send them out (to pasture)

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they carry your heavy loads to regions which you could not reach but with distress to yourselves. Surely your Lord is Compassionate, Merciful

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And (He made) horses and mules and asses that you might ride upon them and as an ornament. And He creates what you know not

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And upon Allah it rests to show the right way, and there are some deviating (ways). And if He pleases, He would guide you all aright

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is who sends down water from the clouds for you; it gives drink, and by it (grow) the trees on which you feed

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He causes to grow for you thereby herbage, and the olives, and the date-palms, and the grapes, and all the fruits. Surely there is a sign in this for a people who reflect

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He has made subservient for you the night and the day and the sun and the moon. And the stars are made subservient by His command. Surely there are signs in this for a people who understand

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And what He has created for you in the earth is of varied hues. Surely there is a sign in this for a people who are mindful

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He it is Who has made the sea subservient that you may eat fresh flesh from it and bring forth from it ornaments which you wear. And thou seest the ships cleaving through it, so that you seek of His bounty and that you may give thanks

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He has cast firm mountains in the earth lest it quake with you, and rivers and roads that you may go aright

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And landmarks. And by the stars they find the right way

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is He then Who creates like him who creates not? Do you not then mind

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if you would count Allah’s favours, you would not be able to number them. Surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you do openly

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those whom they call on besides Allah created naught, while they are themselves created

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Dead (are they), not living. And they know not when they will be raised

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your God is one God: so those who believe not in the Hereafter, their hearts refuse to know and they are proud

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Undoubtedly Allah knows what they hide and what they manifest. Surely He loves not the proud

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when it is said to them, What is it that your Lord has revealed? they say, Stories of the ancients

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That they may bear their burdens in full on the day of Resurrection, and also of the burdens of those whom they lead astray without knowledge. Ah! evil is what they bear

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those before them plotted, so Allah demolished their building from the foundations, so the roof fell down on them from above them, and the chastisement came to them from whence they perceived not

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then on the Resurrection day he will bring them to disgrace and say: Where are My partners, for whose sake you became hostile? Those who are given the knowledge will say: Surely disgrace this day and evil are upon the disbelievers

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whom the angels cause to die, while they are unjust to themselves. Then would they offer submission: We did not do any evil. Nay! Surely Allah knows what you did

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So enter the gates of hell, to abide therein. Evil indeed is the dwelling-place of the proud

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is said to those who guard against evil: What has your Lord revealed? They say, Good. For those who do good in this world is good. And certainly the abode of the Hereafter is better. And excellent indeed is the abode of those who keep their duty -

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Gardens of perpetuity which they enter, wherein flow rivers: they have therein what they please. Thus does Allah reward those who keep their duty

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whom the angels cause to die in purity, saying: Peace be to you! enter the Garden for what you did

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Await they aught but that the angels should come to them or that thy Lord’s command should come to pass. Thus did those before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they wronged themselves

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So the evil of what they did afflicted them, and that which they mocked encompassed them

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the idolaters say: Had Allah pleased, we had not served aught but Him, (neither) we nor our fathers, nor had we prohibited aught without (order from) Him. Thus did those before them. But have the messengers any duty except a plain delivery (of the message)

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We raised in every nation a messenger, saying: Serve Allah and shun the devil. Then of them was he whom Allah guided, and of them was he whose remaining in error was justly due. So travel in the land, then see what was the end of the rejectors

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If thou desirest their guidance, yet Allah will not guide him who leads astray, or have they any helpers

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they swear by Allah their most energetic oaths: Allah will not raise up him who dies. Yea! it is a promise binding on Him, quite true, but most people know not

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So that He might make manifest to them that about which they differ, and that those who disbelieve might know that they were liars

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Our word for a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say to it, Be; and it is

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who flee for Allah’s sake after they are oppressed, We shall certainly give them a good abode in the world; and the reward of the Hereafter is much greater. Did they but know

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who are steadfast and on their Lord they rely

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We sent not before thee any but men to whom We sent revelation -- so ask the followers of the Reminder if you know not -

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: With clear arguments and Scriptures. And We have revealed to thee the Reminder that thou mayest make clear to men that which has been revealed to them, and that haply they may reflect

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Are they, then, who plan evil (plans), secure that Allah will not abase them in the earth, or that chastisement will not overtake them from whence they perceive not

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or that He will not seize them in their going to and fro, then they will not be able to escape

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or that He will not seize them with a gradual diminution? Your Lord is surely Compassionate, Merciful

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not everything that Allah has created? Its (very) shadows return from right and left, making obeisance to Allah, while they are in utter abasement

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to Allah makes obeisance every living creature that is in the heavens and that is in the earth, and the angels (too) and they are not proud

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They fear their Lord above them and do what they are commanded

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has said: Take not two gods. He is only one God: So Me alone should you fear

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whatever is in the heavens and the earth is His, and to Him is obedience due always. Will you then fear other than Allah

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whatever good you have, it is from Allah; then, when evil afflicts you, to Him do you cry for aid

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then when He removes the evil from you, lo! some of you associate others with their Lord

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So as to deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for soon will you know

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they set apart for what they know not, a portion of what we have given them. By Allah! you shall certainly be questioned about that which you forged

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they ascribe daughters to Allah. Glory be to Him! And for themselves is what they desire

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when the birth of a daughter is announced to one of them, his face becomes black and he is full of wrath

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He hides himself from the people because of the evil of what is announced to him. Shall he keep it with disgrace or bury it (alive) in the dust. Now surely evil is what they judge

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For those who believe not in the Hereafter are evil attributes and Allah’s are the sublime attributes. And He is the Mighty, the Wise

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if Allah were to destroy men for their iniquity, He would not leave therein a single creature, but He respites them till an appointed time. So when their doom comes, they are not able to delay (it) an hour, nor can they advance (it)

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they ascribe to Allah what they (themselves) hate, and their tongues related the lie that for them is good. Assuredly for them is the Fire, and they will be (therein) abandoned

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By Allah! We certainly sent (messengers) to nations before thee, but the devil made their deeds fair-seeming to them. So he is their patron to-day, and for them is a painful chastisement

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have not revealed to thee the Book except that thou mayest make clear to them that wherein they differ, and (as) a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah sends down water from above, and therewith gives life to the earth after its death. Surely there is a sign in this for a people who listen

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely there is a lesson for you in the cattle: We give you to drink of what is in their bellies -- from betwixt the faeces and the blood -- pure milk, agreeable to the drinkers

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of the fruits of the palms and the grapes, you obtain from them intoxicants and goodly provision. There is surely a sign in this for a people who ponder

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy Lord revealed to the bee: Make hives in the mountains and in the trees and in what they build

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then eat of all the fruits and walk in the ways of thy Lord submissively. There comes forth from their bellies a beverage of many hues, in which there is healing for men. Therein is surely a sign for a people who reflect

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah creates you, then He causes you to die; and of you is he who is brought back to the worst part of life, so that he knows nothing after having knowledge. Surely Allah is Knowing, Powerful

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has made some of you excel others in the means of subsistence; so those who are made to excel give not away their sustenance to those whom their right hands possess, so that they may be equal therein. Will they then deny the favor of Allah

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has made wives for you from among yourselves, and has given you sons and daughters from your wives, and has provided you with good things. Will they then believe in falsehood and deny the favor of Allah

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they serve besides Allah that which controls for them no sustenance at all from the heavens and the earth; nor have they any power

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So coin not similitudes for Allah. Surely Allah knows and you know not

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah sets forth a parable: There is a slave, the property of another, controlling naught, and there is one to whom we have granted from ourselves goodly provisions, so he spends from it secretly and openly. Are the two alike? Praise be to Allah! Nay, most of them know not

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah sets forth a parable of two men: One of them dumb, controlling naught, and he is a burden to his master; wherever he sends him, he brings no good. Is he equal with him who enjoins justice, and he is on the right path

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah’s is the unseen of the heavens and the earth. And the matter of the Hour is but as a twinkling of the eye or it is nigher still. Surely Allah is Possessor of power over all things

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers -- you knew nothing -- and He gave you hearing and sight and hearts that you might give thanks

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not the birds, constrained in the middle of the sky? None witholds them but Allah. Surely in this are signs for a people who believe

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has given you an abode in your houses, and He has given you houses of the skins of cattle, which you find light to carry on the day of your march and on the day of your halting, and of their wool and their fur and their hair, household stuff and a provision for a time

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has made for you, of what He has created, shelters, and He has given you in the mountains, places of retreat, and He has given you garments to save you from the heat, and coats of mail to save you in your fighting. Thus does He complete His favor to you that you may submit

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then if they turn away, thy duty is only clear deliverance (of the message)

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They recognize the favor of Allah, yet they deny it, and most of them are ungrateful

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And on the day when We raise up a witness out of every nation, then permission (to offer excuse) will not be given to the disbelievers, nor will they be allowed to make amends

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when the wrongdoers see the chastisement, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be respited

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when those who ascribed partners (to Allah) see their associate-gods, they will say: Our Lord, these are our associate-gods on whom we called besides Thee. But they will throw back at them the word: Surely you are liars

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they will tender submission to Allah on that day, and what they used to forge will fail them

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who disbelieve and hinder (men) from Allah’s way, We will add chastisement to their chastisement because they made mischief

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And on the day when We raise up in every people a witness against them from among themselves, and bring thee as a witness against these. And We have revealed the Book to thee explaining all things, and a guidance and mercy and good news for those who submit

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah enjoins justice and the doing of good (to others) and the giving to the kindred, and He forbids indecency and evil and rebellion. He admonishes you that you may be mindful

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And fulfill the covenant of Allah, when you have made a covenant, and break not the oaths after making them fast, and you have indeed made Allah your surety. Surely Allah knows what you do

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And be not like her who unravels her yarn, disintegrating it into pieces, after she has spun it strongly. You make your oaths to be means of deceit between you because (one) nation is more numerous than (another) nation. Allah only tries you by this. And He will certainly make clear to you on the day of Resurrection that wherein you differed

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if Allah please, He would make you a single nation, but He leaves in error whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases. And certainly you will be questioned as to what you did

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And make not your oaths a means of deceit between you, lest a foot should slip after its stability, and you should taste evil because you hinder (men) from Allah’s way and grievous chastisement be your (lot)

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And take not a small price for Allah’s covenant. Surely what is with Allah is better for you, did you but know

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is with you passes away and what is with Allah is enduring. And We shall certainly give to those who are patient their reward for the best of what they did

97.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoever does good, whether male or female, and is a believer, We shall certainly make him live a good life, and We shall certainly give them their reward for the best of what they did

98.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when thou recitest the Qur’an seek refuge in Allah from the accursed devil

99.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely he has no authority over those who believe and rely on their Lord

100.Maulana Muhammad Ali: His authority is only over those who befriend him and those who associate others with Him

101.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We change a message for a message -- and Allah knows best what He reveals -- they say: Thou art only a forger. Nay, most of them know not

102.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: The Holy Spirit has revealed it from thy Lord with truth, that it may establish those who believe, and as a guidance and good news for those who submit

103.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And indeed We know that they say: Only a mortal teaches him. The tongue of him whom they hint at is foreign, and this is clear Arabic language

104.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who believe not in Allah’s messages, Allah guides them not, and for them is a painful chastisement

105.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Only they forge lies who believe not in Allah’s messages, and they are the liars

106.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoso disbelieves in Allah after his belief -- not he who is compelled while his heart is content with faith, but he who opens (his) breast for disbelief -- on them is the wrath of Allah, and for them is a grievous chastisement

107.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is because they love this world’s life more than the Hereafter, and because Allah guides not the disbelieve people

108.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are they whose hearts and ears and eyes Allah has sealed and these are the heedless ones

109.Maulana Muhammad Ali: No doubt that in the Hereafter they are the losers

110.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then surely thy Lord, to those who flee after they are persecuted, then struggle hard and are patient, surely thy Lord after that is Protecting, Merciful

111.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be paid in full what it has done, and they will not be dealt with unjustly

112.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah sets forth a parable: A town safe and secure, to which its means of subsistence came in abundance from every quarter; but it disbelieved in Allah’s favours, so Allah made it taste a pall of hunger and fear because of what they wrought

113.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly there came to them a Messenger from among them, but they rejected him, so the chastisement overtook them, while they were wrongdoers

114.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So eat of what Allah has given you, lawful and good (things), and give thanks for Allah’s favor, if He it is you serve

115.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He has forbidden you only what dies of itself and blood and the flesh of swine and that over which any other name than that of Allah has been invoked; but whoever is driven to (it), not desiring nor exceeding the limit, then surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

116.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And utter not, for what your tongues describe, the lie: This is lawful and this unlawful; so that you forge a lie against Allah. Surely those who forge a lie against Allah will not prosper

117.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A little enjoyment -- and for them is a painful chastisement

118.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to those who are Jews We prohibited what We have related to thee already, and We did them no wrong, but they wronged themselves

119.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord, for those who do evil in ignorance, then turn after that and make amends, surely thy Lord after that is Forgiving, Merciful

120.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Abraham was a model (of virtue), obedient to Allah, upright, and he was not of the polytheists

121.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Grateful for His favours. He chose him and guided him on the right path

122.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave him good in this world; and in the Hereafter he is surely among the righteous

123.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We revealed to thee: Follow the faith of Abraham, the upright one; and he was not of the polytheists

124.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Sabbath was ordained only against those who differed about it. And surely thy Lord will judge between them on the day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they differed

125.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Call to the way of thy Lord with wisdom and goodly exhortation, and argue with them in the best manner. Surely thy Lord knows best him who strays from His path, and He knows best those who go aright

126.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if you take your turn, then punish with the like of that with which you were afflicted. But if you show patience, it is certainly best for the patient

127.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And be patient and thy patience is not but by (the help of) Allah, and grieve not for them, nor be in distress for what they plan

128.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah is with those who keep their duty and those who do good (to others)

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Glory to Him Who carried His servant by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Remote Mosque, whose precincts We blessed, that We might show him of Our signs! Surely He is the Hearing, the Seeing

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave Moses the Book and made it a guidance to the Children of Israel (saying): Take no guardian beside Me -

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The offspring of those whom We bore with Noah. Surely he was a grateful servant

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We made known to the Children of Israel in the Book: Certainly you will make mischief in the land twice, and behave insolently with mighty arrogance

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when of the two, the first warning came to pass, We raised against you Our servants, of mighty prowess, so they made havoc in (your) houses. And it was an accomplished threat

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We gave you back the turn against them, and aided you with wealth and children and made you a numerous band

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If you do good, you do good for your own souls. And if you do evil, it is for them. So when the second warning came, (We raised another people) that they might bring you to grief and that they might enter the Mosque as they entered it the first time, and that they might destroy, whatever they conquered, with utter destruction

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It may be that your Lord will have mercy on you. And if you return (to mischief), We will return (to punishment). And We have made hell a prison for the disbelievers

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this Qur’an guides to that which is most upright, and gives good news to the believers who do good that theirs is a great reward

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have prepared for them a painful chastisement

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And man prays for evil as he ought to pray for good; and man is ever hasty

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We made the night and the day two signs, then We have made the sign of the night to pass away and We have made the sign of the day manifest, so that you may seek grace from your Lord, and that you may know the numbering of years and the reckoning. And We have explained everything with distinctness

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have made every man’s actions to cling to his neck, and We shall bring forth to him on the day of Resurrection a book which he will find wide open

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Read thy book. Thine own soul is sufficient as a reckoner against thee this day

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoever goes aright, for his own soul does he go aright; and whoever goes astray, to its detriment only does he go astray. And no bearer of a burden can bear the burden of another. Nor do We chastise until We raise a messenger

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We wish to destroy a town, We send commandments to its people who lead easy lives, but they transgress therein; thus the word proves true against it, so We destroy it with utter destruction

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many generations did We destroy after Noah! And thy Lord suffices as being Aware and Seer of his servants’ sins

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoso desires this transitory life, We hasten to him therein what We please for whomsoever We desire, then We assign to him the hell; he will enter it despised, driven away

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whoso desires the Hereafter and strives for it as he ought to strive and he is a believer -- those are they whose striving is amply rewarded

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And do We aid -- these as well as those -- out of the bounty of thy Lord, and the bounty of thy Lord is not limited

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See how We have made some of them to excel others. And certainly the Hereafter is greater in degrees and greater in excellence

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Associate not any other god with Allah, lest thou sit down despised, forsaken

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy Lord has decreed that you serve none but Him, and do good to parents. If either or both of them reach old age with thee, say not "Fie" to them, nor chide them, and speak to them a generous word

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy, and say: My Lord, have mercy on them, as they brought me up (when I was) little

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your Lord knows best what is in your minds. If you are righteous, He is surely Forgiving to those who turn (to Him)

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And give to the near of kin his due and (to) the needy and the wayfarer, and squander not wastefully

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the squanderers are the devil’s brethren. And the devil is ever ungrateful to his Lord

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if thou turn away from them to seek mercy from thy Lord, which thou hopest for, speak to them a gentle word

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And make not thy hand to be shackled to thy neck, nor stretch it forth to the utmost (limit) of its stretching forth, lest thou sit down blamed, stripped off

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely thy Lord makes plentiful the means of subsistence for whom He pleases, and He straitens. Surely He is ever Aware, Seer, of His servants

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And kill not your children for fear of poverty -- We provide for them and for you. Surely the killing of them is a great wrong

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And go not nigh to fornication: surely it is an obscenity. And evil is the way

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And kill not the soul which Allah has forbidden except for a just cause. And whoever is slain unjustly, We have indeed given to his heir authority -- but let him not exceed the limit in slaying. Surely he will be helped

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And draw not nigh to the orphan’s property, except in a goodly way, till he attains his maturity. And fulfil the promise; surely, the promise will be enquired into

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And give full measure when you measure out, and weigh with a true balance. This is fair and better in the end

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And follow not that of which thou has no knowledge. Surely the hearing and the sight and the heart, of all of these it will be asked

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And go not about in the land exultingly, for thou canst not rend the earth, nor reach the mountains in height

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And this, the evil thereof, is hateful in the sight of thy Lord

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is of the wisdom which thy Lord has revealed to thee. And associate not any other god with Allah lest thou be thrown into hell, blamed, cast away

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has then your Lord preferred to give you sons, and (for Himself) taken daughters from among the angels? Surely you utter a grievous saying

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have repeated (warnings) in this Qur’an that they may be mindful. And it adds not save to their aversion

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: If there were with Him gods, as they say, then certainly they would have been able to seek a way to the Lord of the Throne

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Glory to Him! and He is highly exalted above what they say

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The seven heavens and the earth and those in them declare His glory. And there is not a single thing but glorifies Him with his praise, but you do not understand their glorification. Surely He is Forbearing, Forgiving

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when thou recitest the Qur’an, We place between thee and those who believe not in the Hereafter a hidden barrier

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We put coverings on their hearts and a deafness in their ears lest they understand it; and when thou makest mention of thy Lord alone in the Qur’an, they turn their backs in aversion

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We know best what they listen to when they listen to thee, and when they take counsel secretly, when the wrongdoers say: You follow only a man deprived of reason

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See, what they liken thee to! So they have gone astray, and cannot find the way

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: When we are bones and decayed particles, shall we then be raised up as a new creation

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Be stones or iron

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or some other creature of those which are too hard (to receive life) in your minds! But they will say: Who will return us? Say: He Who created you at first. Still they will shake their heads at thee and say: When will it be? Say: Maybe it has drawn nigh

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when he will call you forth, then will you obey Him, giving Him praise, and you will think that you tarried but a little (while)

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say to My servants that they speak what is best. Surely the devil sows dissensions among them. The devil is surely an open enemy to man

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your Lord knows you best. He will have mercy on you, if He please, or He will chastise you, if He please. And we have not sent thee as being in charge of them

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy Lord best knows those who are in the heavens and the earth. And certainly We made some of the prophets to excel others, and to David We gave the Zabur

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Call on those whom you assert besides Him; they have no power to remove distress from you nor to change

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those whom they call upon, themselves seek the means of access to their Lord -- whoever of them is nearest -- and they hope for His mercy and fear His chastisement. Surely the chastisement of thy Lord is a thing to be cautious of

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there is not a town but We will destroy it before the day of Resurrection or chastise it with a severe chastisement. That is written in the Book

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And nothing hindered Us from sending signs, but the ancients rejected them. And We gave to Thamud the she-camel, a manifest sign, but they did her wrong, and We send not signs but to warn

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We said to thee: Surely thy Lord encompasses men. And We made not the vision which We showed thee but a trial for men, as also the tree cursed in the Qur’an. And We warn them, but it only adds to their great inordinacy

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We said to the angels: Be submissive to Adam; they submitted, except Iblis. He said: Shall I submit to him whom Thou hast created of dust

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Seest Thou? This is he whom Thou hast honoured above me! If Thou respite me to the day of Resurrection, I will certainly cause his progeny to perish except a few

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Be gone! whoever of them follows thee surely hell is your recompense, a full recompense

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And incite whom thou canst of them with thy voice, and collect against them thy horse and thy foot, and share with them in wealth and children, and promise them. And the devil promises them only to deceive

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My servants -- thou has surely no authority over them. And thy Lord suffices as having charge of affairs

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your Lord is He who speeds the ships for you in the sea that you may seek of His grace. Surely He is ever Merciful to you

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when distress afflicts you in the sea, away go those whom you call on except He; but when He brings you safe to the land, you turn away. And man is ever ungrateful

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you then feel secure that He will not bring you low on a tract of land, or send on you a violent wind? Then you will not find a protector for yourselves

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, do you feel secure that He will not take you back into it another time, then send on you a fierce gale and thus overwhelm you for your ungratefulness? Then you will not find any aider against Us in the matter

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely We have honoured the children of Adam, and We carry them in the land and the sea, and We provide them with good things, and We have made them to excel highly most of those whom We have created

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when We shall call every people with their leader: then whoever is given his book in his right hand, these will read their book; and they will not be dealt with a whit unjustly

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whoever is blind in this (world) he will be blind in the Hereafter, and further away from the path

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely they had purposed to turn thee away from that which We have revealed to thee, that thou shouldst forge against Us other than that, and then they would have taken thee for a friend

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We had not made thee firm, thou mightest have indeed included to them a little

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We would have made thee taste a double (punishment) in life and a double (punishment) after death, and then thou wouldst not have found any helper against Us

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely they purposed to unsettle thee from the land that they might expel thee from it, and then they will not tarry after thee but a little

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (This is Our) way with Our messengers whom We sent before thee, and thou wilt not find a change in Our course

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Keep up prayer from the declining of the sun till the darkness of the night, and the recital of the Qur’an at dawn. Surely the recital of the Qur’an at dawn is witnessed

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And during a part of the night, keep awake by it, beyond what is incumbent on thee; maybe thy Lord will raise thee to a position of great glory

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: My Lord, make me enter a truthful entering, and make me go forth a truthful going forth, and grant me from Thy presence an authority to help (me)

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: The truth has come and falsehood vanished. Surely falsehood is ever bound to vanish

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We reveal of the Qur’an that which is a healing and a mercy to the believers, and it adds only to the perdition of the wrongdoers

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We bestow favours on man, he turns away and behaves proudly; and when evil afflicts him, he is in despair

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Everyone acts according to his manner. But your Lord best knows who is best guided on the path

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they ask thee about the revelation. Say: The revelation is by the commandment of my Lord, and of knowledge you are given but a little

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We please, We could certainly take away that which We have revealed to thee, then thou wouldst find none to please (thy cause) against Us -

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But it is a mercy from thy Lord. Surely His bounty to thee is abundant

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: If men and jinn should combine together to bring the like of this Qur’an, they could not bring the like of it, though some of them were aiders of others

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have made clear for men in this Qur’an every kind of description, but most men consent to naught save denying

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: We will be no means believe in thee, till thou cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or thou have a garden of palms and grapes in the midst of which thou cause rivers to flow forth abundantly

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or thou cause the heaven to come down upon us in pieces, and thou thinkest, or bring Allah and the angels face to face (with us)

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or thou have a house of gold, or thou ascend into heaven. And we will not believe in thy ascending till thou bring down to us a book we can read. Say: Glory to my Lord! am I aught but a mortal messenger

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And nothing prevents people from believing, when the guidance comes to them, except that they say: Has Allah raised up a mortal to be a messenger

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Had there been in the earth angels walking about secure, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel as messenger

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Allah suffices for a witness between me and you. Surely he is ever Aware of His servants, Seeing

97.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he whom Allah guides, he is on the right way; and he whom He leaves in error for them thou wilt find no guardians besides Him. And We shall gather them together on the day of Resurrection on their faces, blind and dumb and deaf. Their abode is hell. Whenever it abates, We make them burn the more

98.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is their retribution because they disbelieve in Our messages and say: When we are bones and decayed particles, shall we then be raised up into a new creation

99.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, is able to create the like of them? And He has appointed for them a term, whereof there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers consent to naught but denying

100.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: If you control the treasures of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withold (them) for fear of spending. And man is ever niggardly

101.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We gave Moses nine clear signs; so ask the Children of Israel. When he came to them, Pharaoh said to him: Surely I deem thee, O Moses, to be one bewitched

102.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Truly thou knowest that none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these as clear proofs; and surely I believe thee, O Pharaoh, to be lost

103.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he desired to scare them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him, all together

104.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We said to the Children of Israel after him: Abide in the land. But when the latter promise came, We brought you all rolled up

105.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And with truth have We revealed it, and with truth did it come. And We have not sent thee but as a giver of good news and as a Wagner

106.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is a Qur’an We have made distinct, so that thou mayest read it to the people by slow degrees, and We have revealed it in portions

107.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Believe in it or believe not. Surely those who are given the knowledge before it, fall down prostrate on their faces, when it is recited to them

108.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: Glory to our Lord! Surely the promise of our Lord was to be fulfilled

109.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they fall down on their faces, weeping, and it adds to their humility

110.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Call on Allah or call on the Beneficent. By whatever (name) you call on Him, He has the best names. And utter not thy prayer loudly nor be silent in it, and seek a way between these

111.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: Praise be to Allah! Who has not taken to Himself a son and Who has not partner in the kingdom, and Who has not a helper because of weakness; and proclaim His greatness, magnifying (Him)

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Praise be to Allah! Who revealed the Book to His servant, and allowed not therein any crookedness

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Rightly directing, to give warning of severe punishment from Him and to give good news to the believers who do good that theirs is a goodly reward

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Staying in it for ever

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to warn those who say: Allah has taken to Himself a son

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grievous is the word that comes out of their mouths. They speak nothing but a lie

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then maybe thou wilt kill thyself with grief, sorrowing after them, if they believe not in this announcement

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have made whatever is on the earth an embellishment for it, so that We may try which of them is best in works

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We shall surely make what is on it dust, without herbage

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, thinkest thou that the companions of the Cave and the Inscription were of Our wonderful signs

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When the youths sought refuge in the Cave, they said: Our Lord, grant us mercy from Thyself, and provide for us a right course in our affair

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We prevented them from hearing in the Cave for a number of years

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We raised them up that We might know which of the two parties was best able to calculate the time for which they remained

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We relate to thee their story with truth. Surely they were youths who believed in their Lord and We increased them in guidance

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and said: Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth; we call upon no god beside Him, for then indeed we should utter an enormity

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These our people have taken gods beside Him. Why do they not bring clear authority for them? Who is then more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when you withdraw from them and what they worship save Allah, take refuge in the Cave; your Lord will spread forth for you of His mercy, and provide for you a profitable course in your affair

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou mightest see the sun, when it rose, decline from their Cave to the right, and when it set leave them behind on the left, while they were in a wide space thereof. This is the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides, he is on the right way; and whom He leaves in error, thou wilt not find for him a friend to guide aright

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou mightest think them awake while they were asleep, and We turned them about to the right and to the left, with their dog outstretching its paws at the entrance. If thou didst look at them, thou wouldst turn back from them in flight, and thou wouldst be filled with awe because of them

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thus did We rouse them that they might question each other. A speaker from among them said: How long have you tarried? They said: We have tarried for a day or a part of a day. (Others) said: Your Lord knows best how long you have tarried. Now send one of you with this silver (coin) of yours to the city, then let him see what food is purest, and bring you provision from it, and let him behave with gentleness, and not make your case known to anyone

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For if they prevail against you, they would stone you to death or force you back to their religion, and then you would never succeed

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thus did We make (men) to get knowledge of them, that they might know that Allah’s promise is true and that the Hour -- there is no doubt about it. When they disputed among themselves about their affair and said: Erect an edifice over them. Their Lord knows best about them. Those who prevailed in their affair said: We shall certainly build a place of worship over them

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Some) say: (They were) three, the fourth of them their dog; and (others) say: Five, the sixth of them their dog, making conjectures about the unseen. And (others) say: Seven, and the eighth of them their dog. Say: My Lord best knows their number -- none knows them but a few. So contend not in their matter but with an outward contention, and question not any of them concerning them

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say not of anything: I will do that to-morrow

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Unless Allah please. And remember thy Lord when thou forgettest and say: Maybe my Lord will guide me to a nearer course to the right than this

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they remained in their cave three hundred years, and they add nine

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Allah knows best how long they remained. His is the unseen of the heavens and the earth. How clear His sight and His hearing! There is no guardian for them beside Him, and He associates none in His judgment

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And recite that which has been revealed to thee of the Book of thy Lord. There is none who can alter His words. And thou wilt find no refuge beside Him

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And keep thyself with those who call on their Lord morning and evening desiring His goodwill, and let not thine eyes pass from them, desiring the beauties of this world’s life. And follow not him whose heart We have made unmindful of Our remembrance, and he follows his low desires and his case exceeds due bounds

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: The Truth is from your Lord; so let him who please believe, and let him who please disbelieve. Surely We have prepared for the iniquitous a Fire, and enclosure of which will encompass them. And if they cry for water, they are given water like molten brass, scalding their faces. Evil the drink! And ill the resting-place

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As for those who believe and do good, We waste not the reward of him who does a good work

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These it is for whom are Gardens of perpetuity wherein flow rivers; they are adorned therein with bracelets of gold, and they wear green robes of fine silk and thick brocade, reclining therein on raised couches. Excellent the recompense! And goodly the resting-place

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And set forth to them the parable of two men -- for one of them We made two gardens of grape-vines, and We surrounded them with date-palms, and between them We made corn-fields

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Both these gardens yielded their fruits, and failed not in aught thereof, and We caused a river to gush forth in their midst

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he had fruit. So he said to his companion, while he argued with him: I have greater wealth than thou, and am mightier in followers

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he went into his garden, while he was unjust to himself. He said: I think not that this will ever perish

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I think not the Hour will come; and even if I am returned to my Lord, I will certainly find a returning-place better than this

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: His companion said to him, while arguing with him: Disbelievest thou in Him Who created thee of dust, then of a small life-germ, then he made thee a perfect man

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But as for me, He, Allah, is my Lord, and I associate none with my Lord

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And wherefore didst thou not say, when thou enteredst thy garden: It is as Allah has pleased -- there is no power save in Allah? If thou consider me as less than thee in wealth and children -

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then maybe my Lord will give me better than thy garden, and will send on (thine) a reckoning from heaven so that it is dust without plant

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or its water will sink down into the ground, so that thou art unable to find it

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And his fruit was destroyed; so he began to wring his hands for what he had spent on it, while it lay waste, its roofs fallen down, and he said: Ah me! would that I had ascribed no partners to my Lord

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he had no host to help him against Allah, nor could he defend himself

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus protection is only Allah’s, the true One. He is Best to reward and Best in requiting

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And set forth to them the parable of the life of this world as water which We send down from the cloud, so the herbage of the earth becomes luxuriant thereby, then it becomes dry, broken into pieces which the winds scatter. And Allah is the Holder of power over all things

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Wealth and children are an adornment of the life of this world; but the ever-abiding, the good works, are better with thy Lord in reward and better in hope

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when We cause the mountains to pass away, and thou seest the earth a levelled plain and We gather them together and leave none of them behind

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they are brought before thy Lord in ranks. Now certainly you have come to Us as We created you at first. Nay, you thought that We had not made an appointment for you

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the book is placed, and thou seest the guilty fearing for what is in it, and they say: O woe to us! what a book is this! It leaves out neither a small thing nor a great one, but numbers them (all), and they find what they did confronting them. And thy Lord wrongs not any one

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We said to the angels: Make submission to Adam, they submitted except Iblis. He was of the jinn, so he transgressed the commandment of his Lord. Will you then take him and his offspring for friends rather than Me, and they are your enemies? Evil is the exchange for the unjust

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I made them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation. Nor could I take those who mislead for aiders

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And one day He will say: Call on those whom you considered to be My partners. So they will call on them, but they will not answer them, and We shall cause a separation between them

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the guilty will see the Fire, and know that they are about to fall into it, and they will find no escape from it

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have made distinct in this Qur’an for mankind every kind of description; and man is in most things contentious

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And nothing prevents men from believing when the guidance comes to them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord, but that (they wait) for the way of the ancients to overtake them, or that the chastisement should confront them

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We send not messengers but as givers of good news and warning, and those who disbelieve contend with falsehood to weaken thereby the Truth, and they take My messages and the warning for a mockery

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the messages of his Lord, then he turns away from them and forgets what his hands have sent before? Surely We have placed veils over their hearts, lest they understand it, and a deafness in their ears. And if thou call them to the guidance, they will even then never follow the right course

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy Lord is Forgiving, Full of Mercy. Were He to punish them what they earn, He would certainly hasten the chastisement for them. But for them there is an appointed time from which they will find no refuge

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And these towns -- We destroyed them when they did wrong. And We have appointed a time for their destruction

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Moses said to his servant: I will not cease until I reach the junction of the two rivers, otherwise I will go on for years

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when they reached the junction of the two (rivers), they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the river, being free

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But when they had gone further, he said to his servant: Bring to us our morning meal, certainly we have found fatigue in this our journey

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Sawest thou when we took refuge on the rock, I forgot the fish, and none but the devil made me forget to speak of it, and it took its way into the river; what a wonder

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: This is what we sought for. So they returned retracing their footsteps

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then they found one of Our servants whom We had granted mercy from Us and whom We had taught knowledge from Ourselves

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Moses said to him: May I follow thee that thou mayest teach me of the good thou hast been taught

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Thou canst not have patience with me

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how canst thou have patience in that whereof thou hast not a comprehensive knowledge

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: If Allah please, thou wilt find me patient, nor shall I disobey thee in aught

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: If thou wouldst follow me, question me not about aught until I myself speak to thee about it

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they set out until, when they embarked in a boat, he made a hole in it. (Moses) said: Hast thou made a hole in it to drown its occupants? Thou has surely done a grievous thing

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Did I not say that thou couldst not have patience with me

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Blame me not for what I forgot, and be not hard upon me for what I did

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they went on, until, when they met a boy, he slew him. (Moses) said: Hast thou slain an innocent person, not guilty of slaying another? Thou hast indeed done a horrible thing

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Did I not say to thee that thou couldst not have patience with me

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: If I ask thee about anything after this, keep not company with me. Thou wilt then indeed have found an excuse in my case

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they went on, until, when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to entertain them as guests. Then they found in it a wall which was on the point of falling, so he put it into a right state, (Moses) said: If thou hadst wished, thou couldst have taken a recompense for it

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: This is the parting between me and thee. Now I will inform thee of the significance of that with which thou couldst not have patience

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As for the boat, it belonged to poor people working on the river, and I intended to damage it, for there was behind them a king who seized every boat by force

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as for the boy, his parents were believers and We feared lest he should involve them in wrongdoing and disbelief

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We intended that their Lord might give them in his place one better in purity and nearer to mercy

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father had been a righteous man. So thy Lord intended that they should attain their maturity and take out their treasure -- a mercy from thy Lord -- and I did not do it of my own accord. This is the significance of that with which thou couldst not have patience

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they ask thee about Dhu-l-qarnain. Say: I will recite to you an account of him

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Truly We established him in the land and granted him means of access to everything

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he followed a course

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Until, when he reached the setting-place of the sun, he found it going down into a black sea, and found by it a people. We said: O Dhu-l-qarnain, either punish them or do them a benefit

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: As for him who is unjust, we shall chastise him, then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will chastise him with an exemplary chastisement

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as for him who believes and does good, for him is a good reward, and We shall speak to him an easy word of Our command

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he followed a course

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Until, when he reached the (land of) the rising sun, he found it rising on a people to whom We had given no shelter from it -

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So it was. And We had full knowledge of what he had

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he followed a course

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Until, when he reached (a place) between the two mountains, he found on that side of them a people who could hardly understand a world

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: O Dhu-l-qarnain, Gog and Magog do mischief in the land. May we then pay thee tribute on condition that thou raise a barrier between us and them

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: That wherein my Lord has established me is better, so if only you help me with strength (of men), I will make a fortified barrier between you and them

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Bring me blocks of iron. At length, when he had filled up the space between the two mountain sides, he said, Blow. Till, when he had made it (a) fire, he said: Bring me molten brass to pour over it

97.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they were not able to scale it, nor could they make a hole in it

98.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: This is a mercy from my Lord, but when the promise of my Lord comes to pass He will crumble it, and the promise of my Lord is ever true

99.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And on that day We shall let some of them surge against others and the trumpet will be blown, then We shall gather them all together

100.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We shall bring forth hell, exposed to view, on that day before the disbelievers

101.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whose eyes were under a cover from My Reminder, and they could not bear to hear

102.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants to be friends besides Me? Surely We have prepared hell as an entertainment for the disbelievers

103.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Shall We inform you who are the greatest losers in respect of deeds

104.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those whose effort goes astray in this world’s life, and they think that they are making good manufactures

105.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those are they who disbelieve in the messages of their Lord and meeting with Him, so their works are vain. Nor shall We set up a balance for them on the day of Resurrection

106.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is their reward -- hell, because they disbelieved and held My messages and My messengers in mockery

107.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As for those who believe and do good deeds, for them are Gardens of Paradise, an entertainment

108.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To abide therein; they will not desire removal therefrom

109.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would surely be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, though We brought the like of it to add (thereto)

110.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I am only a mortal like you -- it is revealed to me that God is one God. So whoever hopes to meet his Lord, he should do good deeds, and join no one in the service of his Lord

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Sufficient, Guide, Blessed, Knowing, Truthful God

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A mention of the mercy of thy Lord to His servant Zacharias -

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he called upon his Lord, crying in secret

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, my bones are weakened, and my head flares with hoariness, and I have never been unsuccessful in my prayer to Thee, my Lord

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I fear my kinsfolk after me, and my wife is barren, so grant me from Thyself an hei

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who should inherit me and inherit of the Children of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, acceptable (to Thee)

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Zacharias, We give thee good news of a boy, whose name is John: We have not made before anyone his equal

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, how shall I have a son, and my wife is barren, and I have reached extreme old age

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord says: It is easy for Me, and indeed I created thee before, when thou wast nothing

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, give me a sign. He said: Thy sign is that thou speak not to people three nights, being in sound health

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he went forth to his people from the sanctuary and proclaimed to them: Glorify (Allah) morning and evening

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O John, take hold of the Book with strength. And We granted him wisdom when a child

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And kind-heartedness from Us and purity. And he was dutiful

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And kindly to his parents, and he was not insolent, disobedient

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And peace on him the day he was born and the day he died, and the day he is raised to life

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And mention Mary in the Book. When she drew aside from her family to an eastern place

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So she screened herself from them. Then We sent to her Our spirit and it appeared to her as a well-made man

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: She said: I flee for refuge from thee to the Beneficent, if thou art one guarding against evil

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: I am only bearer of a message of thy Lord: That I will give thee a pure boy

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: She said: How can I have a son and no mortal has yet touched me, nor have I been unchaste

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: So (it will be). Thy Lord says: It is easy to Me; and that We may make him a sign to men and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter decreed

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then she conceived him; and withdrew with him to a remote place

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the throes of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree. She said: Oh, would that I had died before this, and had been a thing quite forgotten

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So a voice came to her from beneath her: Grieve not, surely thy Lord has provided a stream beneath three

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And shake towards thee the trunk of the palm-tree, it will drop on thee fresh ripe dates

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So eat and drink and cool the eye. Then if thou seest any mortal, say: Surely I have vowed a fast to the Beneficent, so I will not speak to any man to-day

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then she came to her people with him, carrying him. They said: O Mary, thou has indeed brought a strange thing

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O sister of Aaron, thy father was not a wicked man, nor was thy mother an unchaste woman

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But she pointed to him. They said: How should we speak to one who is a child in the cradle

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: I am indeed a servant of Allah. He has given me the Book and made me a prophet

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He has made me blessed wherever I may be, and He has enjoined on me prayer and poor-rate so long as I live

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to be kind to my mother; and He has not made me insolent, unblessed

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And peace on me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I am raised to life

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Such is Jesus son of Mary -- a statement of truth about which they dispute

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It beseems not Allah that He should take to Himself a son. Glory be to Him! when he decrees a matter He only says to it, Be, and it is

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him. This is the right path

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But parties from among them differed; so woe to those who disbelieve, because of their presence on a grievous day

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: How clearly will they hear and see on the day when they come to Us; but the wrongdoers are to-day in manifest error

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And warn them of the day of Regret, when the matter is decided. And they are (now) in negligence and they believe not

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We inherit the earth and those thereon, and to Us they are returned

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And mention Abraham in the Book. Surely he was a truthful man, a prophet

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he said to his sire: O my sire, why worshippest thou that which hears not, or sees, or can it avail thee aught

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O my sire, to me indeed has come the knowledge which has not come to thee; so follow me, I will guide thee on a right path

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O my sire, serve not the devil. Surely the devil is disobedient to the Beneficent

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O my sire, surely I fear lest a punishment from the Beneficent should afflict thee, so that thou become a friend of the devil

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Dislikest thou my gods, O Abraham? If thou desist not, I will certainly drive thee away. And leave me for a time

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Peace be to thee! I shall pray my Lord to forgive thee. Surely He is ever Kind to me

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I withdraw from you and that which you call on beside Allah, and I call upon my Lord. Maybe I shall not remain unblessed in calling upon my Lord

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So, when he withdrew from them and that which they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob. And each (of them) We made a prophet

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave them of Our mercy, and We granted them a truthful mention of eminence

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And mention Moses in the Book. Surely he was one purified, and was a messenger, a prophet

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We called to him from the blessed side of the mountain, and We made him draw nigh in communion

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a prophet

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And mention Ishmael in the Book. Surely he was truthful in promise, and he was a messenger, a prophet

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he enjoined on his people prayer and almsgiving, and was one in whom his Lord was well pleased

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And mention Idris in the Book. Surely he was a truthful man, a prophet

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We raised him to an elevated state

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are they on whom Allah bestowed favours, from among the prophets, of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the messages of the Beneficent were recited to them, they fell down in submission, weeping

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But there came after them an evil generation, who wasted prayers and followed lusts, so they will meet perdition

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except those who repent and believe and do good -- such will enter the Garden, and they will not be wronged in aught

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Gardens of perpetuity which the Beneficent has promised to His servants in the Unseen. Surely His promise ever comes to pass

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will hear therein no vain discourse, but only, Peace! And they have their sustenance therein, morning and evening

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is the Garden which We cause those of Our servants to inherit who keep their duty

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we descend not but by the command of thy Lord. To Him belongs what is before us and what is behind us and what is between these, and thy Lord is never forgetful

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, so serve Him and be patient in His service. Knowest thou any one equal to Him

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And says man: When I am dead, shall I truly be brought forth alive

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Does not man remember that We created him before, when he was nothing

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So by thy Lord! We shall certainly gather them together and the devils, then shall We bring them around hell on their knees

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We shall draw forth from every sect those most rebellious against the Beneficent

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Again, We certainly know best those who deserve most to be burned therein

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there is not one of you but shall come to it. This is an unavoidable decree of thy Lord

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We shall deliver those who guard against evil, and leave the wrongdoers therein on their knees

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when our clear messages are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: Which of the two parties is better in position and better in assembly

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them, who had better possessions and appearance

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: As for him who is in error, the Beneficent will prolong his length of days; until they see what they were threatened with, either the punishment or the Hour. Then they will know who is worse in position and weaker in forces

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah increases in guidance those who go aright. And deeds that endure, the good deeds, are, with thy Lord, better in recompense and yield better return

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Hast thou seen him who disbelieves in Our messages and says: I shall certainly be given wealth and children

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has he gained knowledge of the unseen, or made a covenant with the Beneficent

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By no means! We write down what he says, and We shall lengthen to him the length of the chastisement

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We shall inherit from him what he says, and he will come to Us alone

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they have taken gods besides Allah, that they should be to them a source of strength -

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By no means! They will soon deny their worshipping them, and be their adversaries

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not that We send the devils against the disbelievers, inciting them incitingly

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So make no haste against them. We only number out to them a number (of days)

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when We gather the dutiful to the Beneficent to receive honours

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And drive the guilty to hell, as thirsty beasts

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They have no power of intercession, save him who has made a covenant with the Beneficent

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: The Beneficent has taken to Himself a son

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly you make an abominable assertion

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The heavens may almost be rent thereat, and the earth cleave asunder, and the mountains fall down in pieces

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That they ascribe a son to the Beneficent

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is not worthy of the Beneficent that he should take to Himself a son

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There is none in the heavens and the earth but comes to the Beneficent as a servant

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly He comprehends them, as has numbered them all

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And every one of them will come to Him on the day of Resurrection, alone

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who believe and do good deeds, for them the Beneficent will surely bring about love

97.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We have made it easy in thy tongue only that thou shouldst give good news thereby to those who guard against evil, and shouldst warn thereby a contentious people

98.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Canst thou see any one of them or hear a sound of them

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O man

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We have not revealed the Qur’an to thee that thou mayest be unsuccessful

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But it is a reminder to him who fears

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Beneficent is established on the Throne of Power

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and whatever is between them and whatever is beneath the soil

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if thou utter the saying aloud, surely He knows the secret, and what is yet more hidden

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah -- there is no God but He. His are the most beautiful names

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And has the story of Moses come to thee

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he saw a fire, he said to his people: Stay, I see a fire; haply I may bring to you therefrom a live coal or find guidance at the fire

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when he came to it, a voice came: O Moses

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I am thy Lord, so take off thy shoes; surely thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I have chosen thee so listen to what is revealed

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I am Allah, there is no God but I, so serve Me, and keep up prayer for My remembrance

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the Hour is coming -- I am about to make it manifest -- so that every soul may be rewarded as it strives

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So let not him, who believes not in it and follows his low desire, turn thee away from it, lest thou perish

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And what is this in thy right hand, O Moses

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: This is my staff -- I lean on it, and beat the leaves with it for my sheep, and I have other uses for it

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Cast it down, O Moses

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent, gliding

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Seize it and fear not. We shall return it to its former state

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And press thy hand to thy side, it will come out white without evil -- another sign

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That We may show thee of Our greater signs

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Go to Pharaoh, surely he has exceeded the limits

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, expand my breast for me

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And ease my affair for me

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And loose the knot from my tongue

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (That) they may understand my word

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And give to me an aider from my family

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Aaron, my brother

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Add to my strength by him

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And make him share my task -

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So that we may glorify Thee much

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And much remember Thee

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely, Thou art ever Seeing us

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Thou art indeed granted thy petition, O Moses

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And indeed We bestowed on thee a favor at another time

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When We revealed to thy mother that which was revealed

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Put him into a chest, then cast it into the river, the river will cast it upon the shore -- there an enemy to Me and an enemy to him shall take him up. And I shed on thee love from Me; and that thou mayest be brought up before My eyes

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When thy sister went and said: Shall I direct you to one who will take charge of him? So We brought thee back to thy mother that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve. And thou didst kill a man, then We delivered thee from grief, and tried thee with (many) trials. Then thou didst stay for years among the people of Midian. Then thou camest hither as ordained, O Moses

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I have chosen thee for Myself

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Go thou and thy brother with My messages and be not remiss in remembering Me

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Go both of you to Pharaoh, surely he is inordinate

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then speak to him a gentle word, haply he may mind or fear

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Our Lord, we fear lest he hasten to do evil to us or be inordinate

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Fear not, surely I am with you -- I do hear and see

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So go you to him and say: Surely we are two messengers of thy Lord; so send forth the Children of Israel with us; and torment them not. Indeed we have brought to thee a message from thy Lord, and peace to him who follows the guidance

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It has indeed been revealed to us that punishment will overtake him who rejects and turns away

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said: Who is your Lord, O Moses

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Our Lord is He Who gives to everything its creation, then guides (it)

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: What then is the state of the former generations

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a book; my Lord neither errs nor forgets -

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who made the earth for you an expanse and made for you therein paths and sent down water from the clouds. Then thereby We bring forth pairs of various herbs

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Eat and pasture your cattle. Surely there are signs in this for men of understanding

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: From it We created you, and into it We shall return you, and from it raise you a second time

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And truly We showed him all Our signs but he rejected and refused

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Said he: Hast thou come to us to turn us out of our land by thy enchantment, O Moses

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We too can bring to thee enchantment like it, so make an appointment between us and thee, which we break not, (neither) we nor thou, (in) a central place

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Moses) said: Your appointment is the day of the Festival, and let the people be gathered in the early forenoon

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So Pharaoh went back and settled his plan, then came

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Moses said to them: Woe to you! Forge not a lie against Allah, lest He destroy you by punishment, and he fails indeed who forges (a lie)

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they disputed one with another about their affair and kept the discourse secret
