75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are rewarded with high places because they are patient, and are met therein with greetings and salutation

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Abiding therein. Goodly the abode and the resting-place

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: My Lord would not care for you, were it not for your prayer. Now indeed you have rejected, so the punishment will come

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Benignant, Hearing, Knowing God

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are the verses of the Book that makes manifest

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Perhaps thou wilt kill thyself with grief because they believe not

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If We please, We could send down on them a sign from heaven, so that their necks would bend before it

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there comes not to them a new Reminder from the Beneficent but they turn away from it

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They indeed reject, so the news will soon come to them of that at which they mock

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not the earth, how many of every noble kind We cause to grow in it

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely in this is a sign; yet most of them believe not

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when thy Lord called Moses, saying: Go to the iniquitous people -

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not guard against evil

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, I fear that they will reject me

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And my breast straitens, and my tongue is not eloquent, so send for Aaron (too)

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they have a crime against me, so I fear that they will kill me

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: By no means; so go you both with Our signs; surely We are with you, Hearing

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then come to Pharaoh, and say: We are bearers of a message of the Lord of the worlds

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Send with us the Children of Israel

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said: Did we not bring thee up as a child among us, and thou didst tarry (many) years of thy life among us

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou didst (that) deed of thine which thou didst and thou art of the ungrateful ones

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: I did it then when I was of those who err

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So I fled from you when I feared you, then my Lord granted me judgment and made me of the messengers

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And is it a favour of which thou remindest me that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the worlds

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you would be sure

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said to those around him: Do you not hear

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of old

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said: Surely your messenger, who is sent to you, is mad

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: The Lord of the East and the West and what is between them, if you have any sense

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said: If thou takest a god besides me, I will certainly put thee is prison

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Even if I show thee something plain

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said: Show it, then, if thou art of the truthful

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he cast down his rod, and lo! it was an obvious serpent

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he drew forth his hand, and lo! it appeared white to the beholders

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said to the chiefs around him: Surely this is a skilful enchanter

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who desires to turn you out of your land with his enchantment. What is it then that you counsel

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Give him and his brother respite and send heralds into the citie

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That they bring to thee every skilful enchanter

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So the enchanters were gathered together for the appointment of a well-known day

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it was said to the people: Will you gather together

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Haply may we follow the enchanters, if they are the vanquishers

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when the enchanters came, they said to Pharaoh: Will there be a reward for us, if we are the vanquishers

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Yes, and surely you will then be of those who are nearest (to me)

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Moses said to them: Cast what you are going to cast

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they cast down their cords and their rods and said: By Pharaoh’s power we shall most surely be victorious

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then Moses cast down his rod, and lo! it swallowed up their fabrication

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the enchanters were thrown down prostrate -

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: We believe in the Lord of the worlds

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Lord of Moses and Aaron

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Pharaoh) said: You believe in him before I give you leave; surely he is the chief of you who taught you enchantment, so you shall know. Certainly I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposites sides, and I will crucify you all

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: No harm; surely to our Lord we return

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our wrongs because we are the first of the believers

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We revealed to Moses, saying: Travel by night with My servants -- you will be pursued

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Pharaoh sent heralds into the cities (proclaiming)

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are indeed a small band

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they have surely enraged us

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we are truly a vigilant multitude

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We turned them out of gardens and springs

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And treasures and goodly dwellings -

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Even so. And We gave them as a heritage to the Children of Israel

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then they pursued them at sunrise

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Moses cried out: Surely we are overtaken

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: By no means; surely my Lord is with me -- He will guide me

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We revealed to Moses: March on to the sea with thy staff. So it parted, and each party was like a huge mound

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there We brought near the others

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We saved Moses and those with him, all

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We drowned the others

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely there is a sign in this; yet most of them believe not

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And recite to them the story of Abraham

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he said to his sire and his people: What do you worship

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: We worship idols, so we shall remain devoted to them

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Do they hear you when you call (on them)

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or do they benefit or harm you

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Nay, we found our fathers doing so

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Do you then see what you worship -

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: You and your ancient sires

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely they are an enemy to me, but not (so) the Lord of the worlds

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who created me, then He shows me the way

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Who gives me to eat and to drink

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when I am sick, He heals me

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Who will cause me to die, then give me life

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Who, I hope, will forgive me my mistakes on the day of Judgment

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My Lord, grant me wisdom, and join me with the righteous

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And ordain for me a goodly mention in later generations

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And make me of the heirs of the Garden of bliss

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And forgive my sire, surely he is of the erring ones

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And disgrace me not on the day when they are raised -

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when wealth will not avail, nor sons

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Save him who comes to Allah with a sound heart

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the Garden is brought near for the dutiful

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And hell is made manifest to the deviators

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is said to them: Where are those that you worshipped

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they are hurled into it, they and the deviators

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the hosts of the devil, all

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will say, while they quarrel therein

97.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By Allah! We were certainly in manifest error

98.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When we made you equal with the Lord of the worlds

99.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And none but the guilty led us astray

102.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Now, if we could but once return, we would be believers

103.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely there is a sign in this; yet most of them believe not

104.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

105.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The people of Noah rejected the messengers

106.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When their brother Noah said to them: Will you not guard against evil

107.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I am a faithful messenger to you

108.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

109.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I ask of you no reward for it: my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

110.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

111.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Shall we believe in thee and the meanest follow thee

112.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: And what knowledge have I of what they did

113.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Their reckoning is only with my Lord, if you but perceive

114.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I am not going to drive away the believers

115.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I am only a plain warner

116.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: If thou desist not, O Noah, thou wilt certainly be stoned to death

117.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, my people give me the lie

118.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So judge Thou between me and them openly, and deliver me and the believers who are with me

119.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We delivered him and those with him in the laden ark

120.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We drowned the rest afterwards

121.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely there is sign in this, yet most of them believe not

122.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

123.Maulana Muhammad Ali: ‘Ad gave the lie to the messengers

124.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When their brother Hud said to them: Will you not guard against evil

125.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I am a faithful messenger to you

126.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

127.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I ask of you no reward for it; surely my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

128.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you build on every height a monument? You (only) sport

129.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And you make fortresses that you may abide

130.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when you seize, you seize as tyrants

131.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

132.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And keep your duty to Him Who aids you with that which you know -

133.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He aids you with cattle and childre

135.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I fear for you the chastisement of a grievous day

136.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: It is the same to us whether thou admonish, or art not one of the admonishers

137.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is naught but a fabrication of the ancients

138.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we will not be chastised

139.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they rejected him, then We destroyed them. Surely there is a sign in this; yet most of them believe not

140.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

141.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thamud gave the lie to the messengers

142.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When their brother Salih said to them: Will you not guard against evil

143.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I am a faithful messenger to you

144.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

145.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I ask of you no reward for it; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

146.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Will you be left secure in what is here

148.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And corn-fields and palm-trees having fine flower-spikes

149.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And you hew houses out of the mountains exultingly

150.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

151.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And obey not the bidding of the extravagant

152.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who make mischief in the land and act not aright

153.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Thou art only a deluded person

154.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thou art naught but a mortal like ourselves -- so bring a sign if thou art truthful

155.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: This is a she-camel; she has her portion of water, and you have your portion of water at an appointed time

156.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And touch her not with evil, lest the chastisement of a grievous day overtake you

157.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But the hamstrung her, then regretted

158.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So the chastisement overtook them. Surely there is a sign in this; yet most of them believe not

159.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

160.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The people of Lot gave the lie to the messengers

161.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When their brother Lot said to them: Will you not guard against evil

162.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I am a faithful messenger to you

163.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

164.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I ask of you no reward for it; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

165.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you come to the males from among the creatures

166.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And leave your wives whom your Lord has created for you? Nay, you are a people exceeding limits

167.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: If thou desist not, O Lot, thou wilt surely be banished

168.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Surely I abhor what you do

169.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My Lord, deliver me and my followers from what they do

170.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We delivered him and his followers all

171.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except an old woman, among those who remained behind

173.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We rained on them a rain, and evil was the rain on those warned

174.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely there is a sign in this; yet most of them believe not

175.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

176.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The dwellers of the thicket gave the lie to the messengers

177.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When Shu’aib said to them: Will you not guard against evil

178.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I am a faithful messenger to you

179.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

180.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I ask of you no reward for it; my reward only with the Lord of the worlds

181.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Give full measure and be not of those who diminish

182.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And weigh with a true balance

183.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And wrong not men of their dues, and act not corruptly in the earth, making mischief

184.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And keep your duty to Him Who created you and the former generation

185.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Thou art only a deluded person

186.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou art naught but a mortal like ourselves, and we deem thee to be a liar

187.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So cause a portion of the heaven to fall on us, if thou art truthful

188.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord knows best what you do

189.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they rejected him, so the chastisement of the day of Covering overtook them. Surely it was the chastisement of a grievous day

190.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely there is a sign in this; yet most of them believe not

191.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful

192.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely this is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds

193.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The faithful Spirit has brought i

194.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On thy heart that thou mayest be a warner

196.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely the same is in the Scriptures of the ancients

197.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it not a sign to them that the learned men of the Children of Israel know it

198.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We have revealed it to any of the foreigners

199.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he had read it to them, they would not have believed in it

200.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus do We cause it to enter into the hearts of the guilty

201.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will not believe in it till they see the painful chastisement

202.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So it will come to them suddenly, while they perceive not

203.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then they will say: Shall we be respited

204.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do they still seek to hasten on Our chastisement

205.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou, if We let them enjoy themselves for years

206.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then that which they are promised comes to them -

207.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That which they were made to enjoy will not avail them

208.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We destroyed no town but it had (its) warners -

209.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To remind. And We are never unjust

210.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the devils have not brought it

211.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it behoves them not, nor have they the power to do (it)

212.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely they are far removed from hearing it

213.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So call not upon another god with Allah, lest thou be of those who are chastised

215.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And lower thy wing to the believers who follow thee

216.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But if they disobey thee, say: I am clear of what you do

217.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And rely on the Mighty, the Merciful

218.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who sees thee when thou standest up

219.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy movements among those who prostrate themselves

220.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely He is the Hearing, the Knowing

221.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend

222.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They descend upon every lying, sinful one -

223.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They give ear, and most of them are liars

224.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the poets -- the deviators follow them

225.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not that they wander in every valley

226.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that they say that which they do not

227.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except those who believe and do good and remember Allah much, and defend themselves after they are oppressed. And they who do wrong, will know to what final place of turning they will turn back

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Benignant, Hearing God! These are the verses of the Qur’an and the Book that makes manifest

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A guidance and good news for the believers

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate, and they are sure of the Hereafter

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, We make their deeds fair-seeming to them, but they blindly wander on

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are they for whom is an evil chastisement, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou art surely made to receive the Qur’an from the Wise, the Knowing

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When Moses said to his family: Surely I see a fire; I will bring you news thence, or bring you therefrom a burning brand, so that you may warm yourselves

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when he came to it, a voice issued, saying: Blessed is he who is in search of fire and those around it. And glory be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Moses, surely I am Allah, the Mighty, the Wise

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And cast down thy rod. So when he saw it in motion as if it were a serpent, he turned back retreating and did not return. O Moses, fear not. Surely the messengers fear not in My presence -

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor he who does wrong, then does good instead after evil; surely I am Forgiving, Merciful

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And put thy hand into thy bosom, it will come forth white without evil, among nine signs to Pharaoh and his people. Surely they are a transgressing people

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when our clear signs came to them, they said: This is clear enchantment

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they denied them unjustly and proudly, while their souls were convinced of them. See then, what was the end of the mischief-makers

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We gave knowledge to David and Solomon. And they said: Praise be to Allah, Who has made us excel many of His believing servants

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Solomon was David’s heir, and he said: O men, we have been taught the speech of birds, and we have been granted of all things. Surely this is manifest grace

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And his hosts of the jinn and the men and the birds were gathered to Solomon, and they were formed into groups

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Until when they came to the valley of the Naml, a Namlite said: O Naml, enter your houses, (lest) Solomon and his hosts crush you, while they know not

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he smiled, wondering at her word, and said: My Lord, grant me that I may be grateful for Thy favour which Thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may do good such as Thou art pleased with, and admit me, by Thy mercy, among Thy righteous servants

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he reviewed the birds, then said: How is it I see not Hudhud, or is it that he is one of the absentees

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I will certainly punish him with a severe punishment, or kill him, or he shall bring me a clear excuse

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he tarried not long, then said: I have compassed that which thou has not compassed and I have come to thee from Saba’ with sure information -

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given of everything and she has a mighty throne

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I found her and her people adoring the sun instead of Allah, and the devil has made their deeds fair-seeming to them and turned them from the way, so they go not aright -

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So that they worship not Allah, Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows what you hide and what you proclaim

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah, there is no God but He, the Lord of the mighty Throne

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: We shall see whether thou speakest the truth or whether thou art a liar

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Take this my letter and hand it over to them, then turn from them and see what (answer) they return

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: She said: O chiefs, an honourable letter has been delivered to me

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is from Solomon, and it is in the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Proclaiming, Exalt not yourselves against me and come to me in submission

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: She said: O chiefs, advise me respecting my affair; I never decide an affair until you are in my presence

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: We are possessors of strength and possessors of mighty prowess. And the command is thine, so consider what thou wilt command

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: She said: Surely the kings, when they enter a town, ruin it and make the noblest of its people to be low; and thus they do

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely I am going to send them a present, and to see what (answer) the messengers bring back

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when (the envoy) came to Solomon, he said: Will you help me with wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than that which He has given you. Nay, you are exultant because of your present

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Go back to them, so we shall certainly come to them with hosts which they have no power to oppose, and we shall certainly expel them therefrom in disgrace, while they are abased

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: O chiefs, which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: One audacious among the jinn said: I will bring it to thee before thou rise up from thy place; and surely I am strong, trusty for it

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: One having knowledge of the Book said: I will bring it to thee in the twinkling of an eye. Then when he saw it settled beside him, he said: This is of the grace of my Lord, that He may try me whether I am grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful, he is grateful only for his own soul, and whoever is ungrateful, then surely my Lord is Self-sufficient, Bountiful

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Alter her throne for her; we may see whether she follows the right way or is of those who go not aright

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when she came, it was said: Was thy throne like this? She said: It is as it were the same; and we were given the knowledge before about it, and we submitted

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that which she worshipped besides Allah prevented her; for she was of a disbelieving people

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It was said to her: Enter the palace. But when she saw it she deemed it to be a great expanse of water, and prepared herself to meet the difficulty. He said: Surely it is a palace made smooth with glass. She said: My Lord, surely I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of the worlds

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We sent to Thamud their brother Salih saying: Serve Allah. Then lo! they became two parties, contending

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: O my people, who do you hasten on the evil before the good? Why do you not ask forgiveness of Allah so that you may have mercy

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: We augur evil of thee and those with thee. He said: Your evil augury is with Allah; nay, you are a people who are tried

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there were in the city nine persons who made mischief in the land and did not act aright

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Swear one to another by Allah that we shall attack him and his family by night, then we shall say to his heir: We witnessed not the destruction of his family, and we are surely truthful

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See, then, what was the end of their plan, that We destroyed them and their people, all (of them)

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So those are their houses fallen own because they were iniquitous. Surely there is a sign in this for a people who know

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We delivered those who believed and kept their duty

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Lot, when he said to his people: Do you commit foul deeds, while you see

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Will you come to men lustfully rather than women? Nay, you are a people who act ignorantly

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But the answer of his people was naught except that they said: Drive out Lot’s followers from your town; surely they are a people who would keep pure

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But We delivered him and his followers except his wife; We ordained her to be of those who remained behind

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We rained on them a rain; so evil was the rain on those who had been warned

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Praise be to Allah and peace on His servants whom He has chosen! Is Allah better or what they associate (with Him)

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down for you water from the cloud? Then We cause to grow thereby beautiful gardens -- it is not possible for you to make the trees thereof to grow. Is there a god with Allah? Nay, they are a people who deviate

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, Who made the earth a resting-place, and made in it rivers, and raised on it mountains, and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a god with Allah? Nay, most of them know not

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, Who answers the distressed one when he calls upon Him and removes the evil, and will make you successors in the earth? Is there a god with Allah? Little is it that you mind

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, Who guides you in the darkness of the land and the sea, and Who sends the winds as good news before His mercy? Is there a god with Allah? Exalted by Allah above what they associate (with Him)

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, Who originates the creation, then reproduces it, and Who gives you sustenance from the heaven and the earth? Is there a god with Allah? Say: Bring your proof, if you are truthful

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: No one in the heavens and the earth knows the unseen but Allah; and they know not when they will be raised

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, their knowledge reaches not the Hereafter. Nay, they are in doubt about it. Nay, they are blind to it

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve say: When we have become dust and our fathers (too), shall we indeed be brought forth

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We have certainly been promised this -- we and our fathers before; these are naught but stories of the ancients

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Travel in the earth, then see what was the end of the guilty

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And grieve not for them, nor be distressed because of what they plan

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Maybe somewhat of that which you seek to hasten has drawn nigh to you

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord is full of grace to men, but most of them do not give thanks

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thy Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they manifest

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there is nothing concealed in the heaven and the earth but it is in a clear book

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this Qur’an declares to the Children of Israel most of that wherein they differ

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely it is a guidance and a mercy for the believers

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Truly thy Lord will judge between them by His judgment, and He is the Mighty, the Knowing

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So rely on Allah. Surely thou art on the plain truth

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly thou canst not make the dead to hear the call, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear, when they go back retreating

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor canst thou lead the blind out of their error. Thou canst make none to hear except those who believe in Our messages, so they submit

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when the word comes to pass against them, We shall bring forth for them a creature from the earth that will speak to them, because people did not believe in Our messages

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when We gather from every nation a party from among those who rejected Our messages, then they will be formed into groups

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Until, when they come, He will say: Did you reject My messages, while you did not comprehend them in knowledge? Or what was it that you did

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the word will come to pass against them because they were unjust, so they will not speak

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not that We have made the night that they may rest therein, and the day to give light? Surely there are signs in this for a people who believe

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when the trumpet is blown, then those in the heavens and those in the earth will be struck with terror, except such as Allah please. And all shall come to Him abased

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou seest the mountains -- thou thinkest them firmly fixed -- passing away as the passing away of the cloud: the handiwork of Allah, Who has made everything thoroughly. Surely He is Aware of what you do

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoever brings good, he will have better than it; and they will be secure from terror that day

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whoever brings evil, these will be thrown down on their faces into the Fire. Are you rewarded aught except for what you did

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I am commanded only to serve the Lord of this city, Who has made it sacred, and His are all things, and I am commanded to be of those who submit

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to recite the Qur’an. So whoever goes aright, he goes aright for his own soul, and whoever goes astray -- say: I am only one of the warners

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: Praise be to Allah! He will show you His signs so that you shall recognize them. And thy Lord is not heedless of what you do

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Benignant, Hearing, Knowing God

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are the verses of the Book that makes manifest

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We recite to thee the story of Moses and Pharaoh with truth, for a people who believe

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into parties, weakening one party from among them; he slaughtered their sons and let their women live. Surely he was one of the mischief-makers

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We desire to bestow a favour upon those who were deemed weak in the land, and to make them the leaders, and to make them the heirs

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to grant them power in the land, and to make Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts see from them what they feared

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We revealed to Moses’ mother, saying: Give him suck; then when thou fearest for him, cast him into the river and fear not, nor grieve; surely We shall bring him back to thee and make him one the messengers

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So Pharaoh’s people took him up that he might be en enemy and a grief for them. Surely Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were wrongdoers

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Pharaoh’s wife said: A refreshment of the eye to me and to thee -- slay him not; maybe he will be useful to us, or we may take him for a son. And they perceived not

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the heart of Moses’ mother was free (from anxiety). She would almost have disclosed it, had We not strengthened her heart, so that she might be of the believers

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And she said to his sister: Follow him up. So she watched him from a distance, while they perceived not

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We did not allow him to suck before, so she said: Shall I point out to you the people of a house who will bring him up for you, and they will wish him well

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We gave him back to his mother that her eye might be refreshed, and that she might not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them know not

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when he attained his maturity and became full-grown, We granted him wisdom and knowledge. And thus do We reward those who do good (to others)

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he went into the city at a time of carelessness on the part of its people, so he found therein two men fighting -- one being of his party and the other of his foes; and he who was of his party cried out to him for help against him who was of his enemies, so Moses struck him with his fist and killed him. He said: This is on account of the devil’s doing; surely he is an enemy, openly leading astray

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, surely I have done harm to myself, so do Thou protect me; so He protected him. Surely He is the Forgiving, the Merciful

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, because Thou has bestowed a favour on me, I shall never be a backer of the guilty

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he was in the city, fearing, awaiting, when lo, he who had asked his assistance the day before was crying out to him for help. Moses said to him: Thou art surely one erring manifestly

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when he desired to seize him who was an enemy to them both, he said: O Moses, dost thou intend to kill me as thou didst kill a person yesterday? Thou only desirest to be a tyrant in the land, and thou desirest not to be of those who act aright

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a man came running from the remotest part of the city. He said: O Moses, the chiefs are consulting together to slay thee, so depart (at once); surely I am of those who wish thee well

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he went forth therefrom, fearing, awaiting. He said: My Lord, deliver me from the iniquitous people

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when he turned his face towards Midian, he said: Maybe my Lord will guide me in the right path

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when he came to the water of Midian, he found there a group of men watering, and he found besides them two women keeping back (their flocks). He said: What is the matter with you? They said: We cannot water until the shepherds take away (their sheep) from the water; and our father is a very old man

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he watered (their sheep) for them, then went back to the shade, and said: My Lord, I stand in need of whatever good Thou mayest send to me

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then one of the two women came to him walking bashfully. She said: My father invites thee that he may reward thee for having watered for us. So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said: Fear not, thou art secure from the iniquitous people

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: One of them said: O my father, employ him; surely the best of those that thou canst employ is the strong, the faithful one

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: I desire to marry one of these two daughters of mine to thee on condition that thou serve me for eight years; but, if thou complete ten, it will be of thy own free will, and I wish not to be hard on thee. If Allah please, thou wilt find me one of the righteous

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: That is (agreed) between me and thee; whichever of the two terms I fulfil, there will be no injustice to me; and Allah is surety over what we say

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then when Moses had completed the term, and was travelling with his family, he perceived a fire on the side of the mountain. He said to his family: Wait, I see a fire; maybe I will bring to you from it some news or a brand of fire, so that you may warm yourselves

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley in the blessed spot of the bush: O Moses, surely I am Allah, the Lord of the worlds

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And cast down thy rod. So when he saw it in motion as if it were a serpent, he turned away retreating, and looked not back. O Moses, come forward and fear not; surely thou art of the those who are secure

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Insert thy hand into thy bosom, it will come forth white without evil, and remain calm in fear. These two are two arguments from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs. Surely they are a transgressing people

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, I killed one of them, so I fear lest they slay me

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And my brother, Aaron, he is more eloquent in speech than I, so send him with me as a helper to confirm me. Surely I fear that they would reject me

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: We will strengthen thine arm with thy brother, and We will give you both an authority, so that they shall not reach you. With Our signs, you two and those who follow you, will triumph

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said: This is nothing but forged enchantment, and we never heard of it among our fathers of old

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Moses said: My Lord knows best who comes with guidance from Him, and whose shall be the good end of the abode. Surely the wrongdoers will not be successful

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Pharaoh said: O chiefs, I know no god for you besides myself; so kindle a fire for me, O Haman, on (bricks of) clay, then prepare for me a lofty building, so that I may obtain knowledge of Moses’ God, and surely I think him a liar

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he was unjustly proud in the land, he and his hosts, and they deemed that they would not be brought back to Us

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We caught hold of him and his hosts, then We cast them into the sea, and see what was the end of the iniquitous

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we made them leaders who call to the Fire, and on the day of Resurrection they will not be helped

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We made a curse to follow them in this world, and on the day of Resurrection they will be hideous

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We gave Moses the Book after We had destroyed the former generations -- clear arguments for men and a guidance and a mercy, that they may be mindful

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou wast not on the western side when We revealed to Moses the commandment, nor wast thou among those present

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But We raised up generations, then life became prolonged to them. And thou was not dwelling among the people of Midian, reciting to them Our messages, but We are the Sender (of messengers)

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou wast not at the side of the mountain when We called, but a mercy from thy Lord that thou mayest warn a people to whom no warner came before thee, that they may be mindful

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And lest, if a disaster should befall them for what their hands have sent before, they should say: Our Lord, why didst Thou not send to us a messenger so that we might have followed Thy messages and been of the believers

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But (now) when the Truth has come to them from Us, they say: Why is he not given the like of what was given to Moses? Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They say: Two enchantments backing up each other! And they say: Surely we are disbelievers in both

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Then bring some (other) Book from Allah which is a better guide than these two, I will follow it -- if you are truthful

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But if they answer thee not, know that they only follow their low desires. And who is more erring than he who follows his low desires without any guidance from Allah? Surely Allah guides not the iniquitous people

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have made the Word to have many connections for their sake, so that they may be mindful

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those to whom We gave the Book before it, they are believers in it

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when it is recited to them they say: We believe in it; surely it is the Truth from our Lord; we were indeed before this submitting ones

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These will be granted their reward twice because they are steadfast, and they repel evil with good and spend out of what We have given them

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when they hear idle talk, they turn aside from it and say: For us are our deeds and for you your deeds. Peace be to you! We desire not the ignorant

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely thou canst not guide whom thou lovest, but Allah guides whom He pleases; and He knows best those who walk aright

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: If we follow the guidance with thee, we should be carried off from our country. Have We not settled them in a safe, sacred territory to which fruits of every kind are drawn? A sustenance from Us -- but most of them know not

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many a town have We destroyed which exulted in its means of subsistence! So those are their abodes: they have not been dwelt in after them except a little. And We are ever the inheritors

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy Lord never destroyed the towns, until He has raised in their metropolis a messenger, reciting to them Our messages, and We never destroyed the towns except when their people were iniquitous

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whatever things you have been given are only a provision of this world’s life and its adornment, and whatever is with Allah is better and more lasting. Do you not then understand

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is he to whom We have promised a goodly promise, which he will meet with, like him whom We have provided with the provisions of this world’s life, then on the day of Resurrection he will be of those brought up (for punishment)

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when He will call them and say: Where are those whom you deemed to be My associates

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those against whom the word has proved true will say: Our Lord, these are they whom we caused to deviate -- we caused them to deviate as we ourselves deviated. We declare our innocence before Thee. Us they never worshipped

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it will be said: Call your associate-gods. So they will call upon them, but they will not answer them, and they will see the chastisement. Would that they had followed the right way

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day He will call them, then say: What was the answer you gave to the messengers

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On that day excuses will become obscure to them, so they will not ask each other

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But as to him who repents and believes and does good, maybe he will be among the successful

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy Lord creates and chooses whom He pleases. To choose is not theirs. Glory be to Allah and exalted be He above what they associate (with Him)

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thy Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they proclaim

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He is Allah, there is no god but He! His is the praise in this (life) and the Hereafter; and His is the judgment, and to Him you will be brought back

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Do you see if Allah were to make the night to continue incessantly on you till the day of Resurrection, who is the god besides Allah who could bring you light? Will you not then hear

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Do you see if Allah were to make the day to continue incessantly on you till the day of Resurrection, who is the god besides Allah that could bring you the night in which you take rest? Do you not then see

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And out of His mercy He has made for you the night and the day, that you may rest therein, and that you may seek of His grace, and that you may give thanks

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when He will call them and say: Where are My associates whom you pretended

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We shall draw forth from among every nation a witness and say: Bring your proof. Then shall they know that the Truth is Allah’s and that which they forged will fail them

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Korah was surely of the people of Moses, but he oppressed them, and We gave him treasures, so much so that his hoards of wealth would weight down a body of strong men. When his people said to him: Exult not; surely Allah loves not the exultant

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And seek the abode of the Hereafter by means of what Allah has given thee, and neglect not thy portion of the world, and do good (to others) as Allah has done good to thee, and seek not to make mischief in the land. Surely Allah loves not the mischief-makers

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: I have been given this only on account of the knowledge I have. Did he not know that Allah had destroyed him generations who were mightier in strength than he and greater in assemblage? And the guilty are not questioned about their sins

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he went forth to his people in his finery. Those who desired this world’s life said: O would that we had the like of what Korah is given! Surely he is possessed of mighty good fortune

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But those who were given the knowledge said: Woe to you! Allah’s reward is better for him who believes and does good, and none is made to receive this except the patient

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We made the earth to swallow him up and his abode. He had no host to help him against Allah, nor was he of those who can defend themselves

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who had yearned for his place the day before began to say: Ah! (know) that Allah amplifies and straitens the means of subsistence for whom He pleases of His servants; had not Allah been gracious to us, He would have abased us. Ah! (know) that the ungrateful are never successful

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That abode of the Hereafter, We assign it to those who have no desire to exalt themselves in the earth nor to make mischief. And the good end is for those who keep their duty

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoever brings good, he will have better than it; and whoever brings evil, those who do evil will be requited only for what they did

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He who has made the Qur’an binding on thee will surely bring thee back to the Place of Return. Say: My Lord knows best him who has brought the guidance and him who is in manifest error

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou didst not expect that the Book would be inspired to thee, but it is a mercy from thy Lord, so be not a backer up of the disbelievers

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And let them not turn thee aside from the messages of Allah after they have been revealed to thee, and call (men) to thy Lord and be not of the polytheists

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And call not with Allah any other god. There is no God but He. Everything will perish but He. His is the judgment, and to Him you will be brought back

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I, Allah, am the best Knower

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do men think that they will be left alone on saying, We believe, and will not be tried

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And indeed We tried those before them, so Allah will certainly know those who are true and He will know the liars

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or do they who work evil think that they will escape Us? Evil is it that they judge

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoever hopes to meet with Allah, the term of Allah is then surely coming. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whoever strives hard, strives for himself. Surely Allah is Self-sufficient, above (need of) (His) creatures

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who believe and do good, We shall certainly do away with their afflictions and reward them for the best of what they did

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have enjoined on man goodness to his parents. But if they contend with thee to associate (others) with Me, of which thou has no knowledge, obey them not. To Me is your return, so I will inform you of what you did

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who believe and do good, We shall surely make them enter among the righteous

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And among men is he who says: We believe in Allah; but when he is persecuted for the sake of Allah, he thinks the persecution of men to be as the chastisement of Allah. And if there comes help from thy Lord, they will say: Surely we were with you. Is not Allah the Best Knower of what is in the hearts of mankind

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly Allah will know those who believe, and He will know the hypocrites

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe: Follow our path and we will bear your wrongs. And they can never bear aught of their wrongs. Surely they are liars

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they will certainly bear their own burdens, and other burdens besides their own burdens; and they will certainly be questioned on the day of Resurrection as to what they forged

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We indeed sent Noah to his people, so he remained among them a thousand years save fifty years. And the deluge overtook them, and they were wrongdoers

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We delivered him and the inmates of the ark, and made it a sign to the nations

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And (We sent) Abraham, when he said to his people: Serve Allah and keep your duty to Him. That is better for you, if you did but know

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: You only worship idols besides Allah and you invent a lie. Surely they whom you serve besides Allah control no sustenance for you; so seek sustenance from Allah and serve Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be brought back

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if you reject, nations before you indeed reject (the Truth). And the duty of the Messenger is only to deliver (the message) plainly

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not how Allah originates the creation, the reproduces it? Surely that is easy to Allah

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Travel in the earth then see how He makes the first creation, then Allah creates the latter creation. Surely Allah is Possessor of power over all things

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He chastises whom He pleases and has mercy on whom He pleases, and to Him you will be turned back

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And you cannot escape in the earth nor in the heaven, and you have no protector or helper besides Allah

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve in the messages of Allah and the meeting with Him, they despair of My mercy and for them is a painful chastisement

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So naught was the answer of his people except that they say: Slay him or burn him! But Allah delivered him from the fire. Surely therein are signs for a people who believe

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he said: you have only taken idols besides Allah by way of friendship between you in this world’s life, then on the day of Resurrection some of you will deny others, and some of you will curse others; and your abode is the Fire, and you will have no helpers

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So Lot believed in him. And he said: I am fleeing to my Lord. Surely He is the Mighty, the Wise

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and ordained prophethood and the Book among his seed. And We gave him his reward in this world, and in the Hereafter he will surely be among the righteous

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And (We sent) Lot when he said to his people: Surely you are guilty of an abomination which none of the nations has done before you

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you come to males and commit robbery on the highway, and commit evil deeds in your assemblies? But the answer of his people was only that they said: Bring on us Allah’s chastisement, if thou art truthful

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, help me against the mischievous people

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with good news, they said: We are going to destroy the people of this town, for its people are iniquitous

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Surely in it is Lot. They said: We know well who is in it; we shall certainly deliver him and his followers, except his wife; she is of those who remain behind

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when our messengers came to Lot, he was grieved on account of them, and he lacked strength to protect them. And they said: Fear not, nor grieve; surely we will deliver thee and thy followers, except thy wife -- she is of those who remain behind

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We are going to bring down upon the people of this town a punishment from heaven, because they transgressed

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have left a clear sign of it for a people who understand

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to Midian (We sent) their brother Shu’aib, so he said: O my people, serve Allah and fear the Latter day, and act not corruptly, making mischief, in the land

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they rejected him, so a severe earthquake overtook them and they lay prostrate in their abodes

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And ‘Ad and Thamud! And some of their dwellings are indeed apparent to you. And the devil made their deeds fairseeming to them, so he kept them back from the path, and they could see clearly

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Korah and Pharaoh and Haman! And certainly Moses came to them with clear arguments, but they behaved haughtily in the land; and they could not outstrip (us)

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So each one We punished for his sin. Of them was he on whom We sent a violent storm, and of them was he whom the rumbling overtook, and of them was he whom We caused the earth to swallow, and of them was he whom We drowned. And it was not Allah, Who wronged them, but they wronged themselves

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The parable of those who take guardians besides Allah is as the parable of the spider that makes for itself a house; and surely the frailest of the houses is the spider’s house -- if they but knew

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah knows whatever they call upon besides Him. And He is the Mighty, the Wise

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And these parables, We set them forth for men, and none understand them but the learned

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth. Surely there is a sign in this for the believers

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Recite that which has been revealed to thee of the Book and keep up prayer. Surely prayer keeps (one) away from indecency and evil; and certainly the remembrance of Allah is the greatest (force). And Allah knows what you do

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And argue not with the People of the Book except by what is best, save such of them as act unjustly. But say: We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you, and our God and your God is One, and to Him we submit

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thus have We revealed the Book to thee. So those whom We have given the Book believe in it, and of these there are those who believe in it; and none deny Our messages except the disbelievers

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And thou didst not recite before it any book, nor didst thou transcribe one with thy right hand, for then could the liars have doubted

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, it is clear messages in the hearts of those who are granted knowledge. And none deny Our messages except the iniquitous

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: Why are not signs sent down upon him from his Lord? Say: Signs are with Allah only, and I am only a plain warner

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it not enough for them that We have revealed to thee the Book which is recited to them? Surely there is mercy in this and a reminder for a people who believe

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you -- He knows what is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in Allah, these it is that are the losers

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they ask thee to hasten on the chastisement. And had not a term been appointed, the chastisement would certainly have come to them. And certainly it will come to them all of a sudden, while they perceive not

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They ask thee to hasten on the chastisement, and surely hell encompasses the disbelievers -

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when the chastisement will cover them for above them, and from beneath their feet! And he will say: Taste what you did

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O My servants who believe, surely My earth is vast, so serve Me only

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Every soul must taste of death; then to Us you will be returned

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who believe and do good, We shall certainly give them an abode in high places in the Garden wherein flow rivers, abiding therein. Excellent the reward of the workers

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who are patient, and on their Lord they rely

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many a living creature carries not its sustenance! Allah sustains it and yourselves. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if thou ask them, Who created the heavens and the earth and made the sun and the moon subservient? they would say, Allah. Whence are they then turned away

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah makes abundant the means of subsistence for whom He pleases of His servants, or straitens (them) for him. Surely Allah is Knower of all things

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if thou ask them, Who is it that sends down water from the clouds, then gives life to the earth with it after its death? they will say, Allah. Say: Praise be to all! Nay most of them understand not

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the life of this world is but a sport and a play. And the home of the Hereafter, that surely is the Life, did they but know

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when they ride in the ships, they call upon Allah, being sincerely obedient to Him; but when He brings them safe to the land, lo! they associate others (with Him)

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That they may be ungrateful for what We have given them, and that they may enjoy. But they shall soon know

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not that We have made a sacred territory secure, while men are carried off by force from around them? Will they still believe in the falsehood and disbelieve in the favour of Allah

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And who is more iniquitous than one who forges a lie against Allah, or gives the lie to the Truth, when it has come to him? Is there not an abode in hell for the disbelievers

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who strive hard for Us, We shall certainly guide them in Our ways. And Allah is surely with the doers of good

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I, Allah, am the Best Knower

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Romans are vanquishe

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In a near land, and they, after their defeat, will gain victor

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Within nine years. Allah’s is the command before an after. And on that day the believers will rejoic

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In Allah’s help. He helps whom He pleases, and He is the Mighty, the Merciful -

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (It is) Allah’s promise! Allah will not fail in His promise, but most people know not

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They know the outward of this world’s life, but of the Hereafter they are heedless

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do they not reflect within themselves? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them but with truth, and (for) an appointed term. And surely most of the people are deniers of the meeting with their Lord

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Have they not travelled in the earth and seen what was the end of those before them? They were stronger than these in prowess, and dug up the earth, and built on it more than these have built. And their messengers came to them with clear arguments. So it was not Allah, Who wronged them, but they wronged themselves

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then evil was the end of those who did evil, because they rejected the messages of Allah and mocked at them

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah originates the creation, then reproduces it, then to Him you will be returned

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when the Hour comes, the guilty will despair

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they will have no intercessors from among their associate-gods, and they will deny their associate-gods

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when the Hour comes, that day they will be separated one from the other

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then as to those who believed and did good, they will be made happy in a garden

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as for those who disbelieved and rejected Our messages and the meeting of the Hereafter, they will be brought to chastisement

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So glory be to Allah when you enter the evening and when you enter the morning

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And to Him be praise in the heavens and the earth, and in the afternoon, and when the sun declines

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and gives life to the earth after its death. And thus will you be brought forth

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of His signs is this, that He created you from dust, then lo! you are mortals (who) scatter

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of His signs is this, that He created mates for you from yourselves that you might find quiet of mind in them, and He put between you love and compassion. Surely there are signs in this for a people who reflect

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your tongues and colours. Surely there are signs in this for the learned

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of His signs is your sleep by night and by day and your seeking of His bounty. Surely there are signs in this for a people who would hear

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of His signs is this, that He shows you the lightning for fear and for hope, and sends down water from the cloud, then gives life therewith to the earth after its death. Surely there are signs in this for a people who understand

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of His signs is this, that the heaven and the earth subsist by His command. Then when He calls you -- from the earth -- lo! you come forth

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And His is whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient to Him

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He it is, Who originates the creation, then reproduces it, and it is very easy to Him. And His is the most exalted state in the heavens and the earth; and He is the Mighty, the Wise

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He sets forth to you a parable related to yourselves. Have you among those whom your right hands possess partners in that which We have provided you with, so that with respect to it you are alike -- you fear them as you fear each other? Thus do We make the messages clear for a people who understand

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, those who are unjust follow their low desires without any knowledge; so who can guide him whom Allah leaves in error? And they shall have no helpers

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So set thy face for religion, being upright, the nature made by Allah in which He has created men. There is no altering Allah’s creation. That is the right religion -- but most people know not -

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Turning to Him; and keep your duty to Him, and keep up prayer and be not of the polytheists

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Of those who split up their religion and become parties; every sect rejoicing in that which is with it

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when harm afflicts men, they call upon their Lord, turning to Him, then when He makes them taste of mercy from Him, lo! some of them begin to associate (others) with their Lord

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So as to be ungrateful for that which We have given them. So enjoy yourselves a while -- you will soon come to know

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, have We sent to them an authority so that it speaks of that which they associate with Him

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We make people taste of mercy they rejoice in it, and if an evil befall them for what their hands have already wrought, lo! they despair

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not that Allah enlarges provision and straitens (it) for whom He pleases? Certainly there are signs in this for a people who believe

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So give to the near of kin his due, and to the needy and the wayfarer. This is best for those who desire Allah’s pleasure, and these it is who are successful

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whatever you lay out at usury, so that it may increase in the property of men, it increases not with Allah; and whatever you give in charity, desiring Allah’s pleasure -- these will get manifold

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah is He who created you, then He sustains you, then He causes you to die, then brings you to life. Is there any of your associate-gods who does aught of it? Glory be to Him, and exalted be He above what they associate (with Him)

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Corruption has appeared in the land and the sea on account of that which men’s hands have wrought, that He may make them taste a part of that which they have done, so that they may return

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Travel in the land, then see what was the end of those before! Most of them were polytheists

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then set thyself, being upright, to the right religion before there come from Allah the day which cannot be averted: on that day they will be separated

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoever disbelieves will be responsible for his disbelief; and whoever does good such prepare (good) for their own souls

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That He may reward out of His grace those who believe and do good. Surely He loves not the disbelievers

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of His signs is this, that He sends forth the winds bearing good news, and that He may make you taste of His mercy, and that the ships may glide by His command, and that you may seek His grace, and that you may be grateful

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We sent before thee messengers to their people, so they came to them with clear arguments, then We punished those who were guilty. And to help believers is ever incumbent on Us

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah is He Who sends forth the winds, so they raise a cloud, then He spreads it forth in the sky as He pleases, and He breaks it, so that you see the rain coming forth from inside it; then when He causes it to fall upon whom He pleases of His servants, lo! they rejoice -

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Though they were before this, before it was sent down upon them, in sure despair

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Look then at the signs of Allah’s mercy, how He gives life to the earth after its death. Surely He is the Quickener of the dead; and He is Possessor of power over all things

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We send a wind and they see it yellow, they would after that certainly continue to disbelieve

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So surely thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call, when they turn back retreating

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor canst thou guide the blind out of their error. Thou canst make none to hear but those who believe in Our messages, so they submit

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah is He Who created you from a state of weakness, then He gave strength after weakness, then ordained weakness and hoary hair after strength. He creates what He pleases, and He is the Knowing, the Powerful

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the day when the Hour comes, the guilty will swear: They did not tarry but an hour. Thus are they ever turned away

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who are given knowledge and faith will say: Certainly you tarried according to the ordinance of Allah till the day of Resurrection -- so this is the day of Resurrection -- but you did not know

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So that day their excuse will not profit those who were unjust, nor will they be granted goodwill

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have set forth for men in this Qur’an every kind of parable. And if thou bring them a sign, those who disbelieve would certainly say: You re naught but deceivers

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who know not

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So be patient; surely the promise of Allah is true; and let not those disquiet thee who have no certainty

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I, Allah, am the Best Knower

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are verses of the Book of Wisdom -

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A guidance and a mercy for the doers of good

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate and who are certain of the Hereafter

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are on a guidance from their Lord, and these are they who are successful

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of men is he who takes instead frivolous discourse to lead astray from Allah’s path without knowledge, and to make it a mockery. For such is an abasing chastisement

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Our messages are recited to him, he turns back proudly, as if he had not heard them, as if there were deafness in his ears; so announce to him a painful chastisement

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who believe and do good, for them are Gardens of bliss

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To abide therein. A promise of Allah in truth! And He is the Mighty, the Wise

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He created the heavens without pillars that you see, and cast mountains on the earth lest it should be convulsed with you, and He spread on it animals of every kind. And We send down water from the clouds, there cause to grow therein of every nobel kind

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is Allah’s creation; now show Me that which those besides Him have created. Nay, the unjust are in manifest error

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We gave Luqman wisdom, saying: Give thanks to Allah. And whoever is thankful, is thankful for his own soul; and whoever denies, then surely Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praised

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Luqman said to his son, while he admonished him: O my son, ascribe no partner to Allah. Surely ascribing partners (to Him) is a grievous iniquity

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have enjoined on man concerning his parents -- his mother bears him with faintings upon faintings and his weaning takes two years -- saying: Give thanks to Me and to thy parents. To Me is the eventual coming

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if they strive with thee to make thee associate with Me that of which thou has no knowledge, obey them not, and keep kindly company with them in this world, and follow the way of him who turns to Me; then to Me is your return, then I shall inform you of what you did

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O my son, even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard-seed, even though it be in a rock, or in the heaven or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Surely Allah is Knower of subtilities, Aware

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O my son, keep up prayer and enjoin good and forbid evil, and bear patiently that which befalls thee. Surely this is an affair of great resolution

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And turn not thy face away from people in contempt, nor go about in the land exultingly. Surely Allah loves not any self-conceited boaster

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And pursue the right curse in thy going about and lower thy voice. Surely the most hateful of voices is braying of asses

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See you not that Allah has made subservient to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and granted to you His favours complete outwardly and inwardly? And among men is he who disputes concerning Allah without knowledge or guidance or a Book giving light

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when it is said to them, Follow that which Allah has revealed, they say: Nay, we follow that wherein we found our fathers. What! Though the devil calls them to the chastisement of the burning Fire

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whoever submits himself to Allah and does good (to others), he indeed takes hold of the firmest handle. And Allah’s is the end of affairs

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whoever disbelieves, let not his disbelief grieve thee. To Us is their return, then We shall inform them of what they did. Surely Allah is Knower of what is in the breasts

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We give them to enjoy a little, then We shall drive them to a severe chastisement

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if thou ask them who created the heavens and the earth? they will say: Allah. Say: Praise be to Allah! Nay, most of them know not

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Surely Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praised

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if all the trees in the earth were pens, and the sea with seven more seas added to it (were ink), the worlds of Allah would not be exhausted. Surely Allah is Mighty, Wise

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your creation or your raising is only like a single soul. Surely Allah is Hearing, Seeing

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not that Allah makes the night to enter into the day, and He makes the day to enter into the night, and He has made the sun and the moon subservient (to you) -- each pursues its course till an appointed time -- and that Allah is Aware of what you do

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon besides Him is falsehood, and that Allah is the High, the Great

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not that the ships glide on the sea by Allah’s grace, that He may show you of His signs? Surely there are signs in this for every patient, endurer, grateful one

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when a wave like awnings covers them, they call upon Allah, being sincere to Him in obedience. But when He brings them safe to land, some of them follow the middle course. And none denies Our signs but every perfidious, ungrateful one

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O people, keep your duty to your Lord and dread the day when no father can avail his son in aught, nor the child will avail this father. Surely the promise of Allah is true, so let not this world’s life deceive you, nor let the arch-deceiver deceive you about Allah

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah is He with Whom is the knowledge of the Hour, and He sends down the rain, and He knows what is in the wombs. And no one knows what he will earn on the morrow. And no one knows in what land he will die. Surely Allah is Knowing, Aware

32.SurahEnglishNames: The Prostration, Worship, Adoration, The Adoration

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I, Allah, am the Best Knower

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The revelation of the Book, there is no doubt in it, is from the Lord of the worlds

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or do they say: He has forged it? Nay it is the Truth from thy Lord that thou mayest warn a people to whom no warner has come before thee that they may walk aright

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six periods, and He is established on the Throne of Power. You have not besides Him a guardian or an intercessor. Will you not then mind

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He orders the Affair from the heaven to the earth; then it will ascend to Him in a day the measure of which is a thousand years as you count

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Such is the Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty, the Merciful

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who made beautiful everything that He created, and He began the creation of man from dust

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then He made his progeny of an extract, of worthless water

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then He made him complete and breathed into him of His spirit, and gave you ears and eyes and hearts; little it is that you give thanks

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: When we are lost in the earth, shall we then be in a new creation? Nay, they are disbelievers in the meeting with their Lord

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: The angel of death, who is given charge of you, will cause you to die, then to your Lord you will be returned

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And couldst thou but see when the guilty hang their heads before their Lord: Our Lord, we have seen and heard; so send us back, we will do good; we are (now) certain

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We have pleased, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the word from Me was just; I will certainly fill hell with the jinn and men together

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So taste, because you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours; surely We forsake you; and taste the abiding chastisement for what you did

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Only they believe in Our messages who, when they are reminded of them, fall down prostrate and celebrate the praise of their Lord, and they are not proud
