16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They forsake (their) beds, calling upon their Lord in fear and in hope, and spend out of what We have given them

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So no soul knows what refreshment of the eyes is hidden for them: a reward for what they did

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is he then, who is a believer, like him who is a transgressor? They are not equal

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As for those who believe and do good deeds, for them are Gardens, a refuge -- an entertainment for what they did

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as for those who transgress, their refuge is the Fire. Whenever they desire to go forth from it, they are brought back into it, and it is said to them: Taste the chastisement of the Fire, which you called a lie

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We will make them taste the nearer punishment before the greater chastisement, that haply they may turn

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And who is more iniquitous than he who is reminded of the messages of his Lord, then he turns away from them? Surely We exact retribution from the guilty

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We indeed gave Moses the Book -- so doubt not the meeting with Him -- and We made it a guide for the Children of Israel

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We made from among them leaders to guide by Our command when they were patient. And they were certain of Our messages

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely thy Lord will judge between them on the day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they differed

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it not clear to them, how many of the generations, in whose abodes they go about, We destroyed before them? Surely there are signs in this. Will they not then hear

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not that We drive the water to a land having no herbage, then We bring forth thereby seed-produce, of which their cattle and they themselves eat. Will they not then see

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: When will this victory come, if you are truthful

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: On the day of victory the faith of those who (now) disbelieve will not profit them, nor will they be respited

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So turn away from them and wait, surely they too are waiting

33.SurahEnglishNames: The Clans, The Coalition, The Combined Forces, The Allies

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, keep thy duty to Allah and obey not the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Surely Allah is ever Knowing, Wise

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And follow that which is revealed to thee from thy Lord. Surely Allah is ever Aware of what you do

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And trust in Allah. And Allah is enough as having charge (of affairs)

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah has not made for any man two hearts within him; nor has He made your wives whom you desert by Zihar, your mothers, nor has He made those whom you assert (to be your sons) your sons. These are the words of your mouths. And Allah speaks the truth and He shows the way

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Call them by (the names of) their fathers; this is more equitable with Allah; but if you know not their fathers, then they are your brethren in faith and your friends. And there is no blame on you in that wherein you make a mistake, but (you are answerable for) that which your hearts purpose. And Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Prophet is closer to the faithful than their own selves, and his wives are (as) their mothers. And the possessors of relationship are closer one to another in the ordinance of Allah than (other) believers, and those who fled (their homes), except that you do some good to your friends. This is written in the Book

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when We took a covenant from the prophets and from thee, and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, son of Mary, and We took from them a solemn covenant

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That He may question the truthful of their truth, and He has prepared for the disbelievers a painful chastisement

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, call to mind the favour of Allah to you when there came against you hosts, so We sent against them a strong wind and hosts that you saw not. And Allah is ever Seer of what you do

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when the eyes turned dull and the hearts rose up to the throats, and you began to think diverse thoughts about Allah

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There were the believers tried and they were shaken with a severe shaking

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when a party of them said: O people of Yathrib, you cannot make a stand, so go back. And a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying, Our houses are exposed. And they were not exposed. They only desired to run away

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if an entry were made upon them from the outlying parts of it, then they were asked to wage war (against the Muslims), they would certainly have done it, and they would not have stayed in it but a little while

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they had indeed made a covenant with Allah before, (that) they would not turn (their) backs. And a covenant with Allah must be answered for

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Flight will not profit you, if you flee from death or slaughter, and then you will not be allowed to enjoy yourselves but a little

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Who is it that can protect you from Allah, if He intends harm for you or He intends to show you mercy? And they will not find for themselves a guardian or a helper besides Allah

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah indeed knows those among you who hinder others and those who say to their brethren, Come to us. And they come not to the fight but a little

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Being niggardly with respect to you. But when fear comes, thou wilt see them looking to thee, their eyes rolling like one swooning because of death. But when fear is gone they smite you with sharp tongues, being covetous of wealth. These have not believed, so Allah makes their deeds naught. And that is easy for Allah

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They think the allies are not gone, and if the allies should come (again), they would fain be in the deserts with the desert Arabs, asking for news about you. And if they were among you, they would not fight save a little

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly you have in the Messenger of Allah an excellent exemplar for him who hopes in Allah and the Latter day, and remembers Allah much

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And follow that which is revealed to thee from thy Lord. Surely Allah is ever Aware of what you do

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when the believers saw the allies, they said: This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us, and Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth. And it only added to their faith and submission

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Of the believers are men who are true to the covenant they made with Allah; so of them is he who has accomplished his vow, and of them is he who yet waits, and they have not changed in the least -

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That Allah may reward the truthful for their truth, and chastise the hypocrites, if He pleases, or turn to them (mercifully). Surely Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah turned back the disbelievers in their rage -- they gained no advantage. And Allah sufficed the believers in fighting. And Allah is ever Strong, Mighty

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He drove down those of the People of the Book who backed them from their fortresses and He cast awe into their hears; some you killed and you took captive some

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He made you heirs to their land and their dwellings and their property, and (to) a land which you have not yet trodden. And Allah is ever Possessor of power over all things

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, say to thy wives: If you desire this world’s life and its adornment, come, I will give you a provision and allow you to depart a goodly departing

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the abode of the Hereafter, then surely Allah has prepared for the doers of good among you a mighty reward

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O wives of the Prophet, whoever of you is guilty of manifestly improper conduct, the chastisement will be doubled for her. And this is easy for Allah

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whoever of you is obedient to Allah and His Messenger and does good, We shall give her a double reward, and We have prepared for her an honourable sustenance

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like any other women. If you would keep your duty, be not soft in speech, lest he in whose heart is a disease yearn; and speak a word of goodness

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And stay in your houses and display not your beauty like the displaying of the ignorance of yore; and keep up prayer, and pay the poor-rate, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only desires to take away uncleanness from you, O people of the household, and to purify you a (thorough) purifying

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And remember that which is recited in your houses of the messages of Allah and the Wisdom. Surely Allah is ever Knower of subtilties, Aware

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the men who submit and the women who submit, and the believing men and the believing women, and the truthful men and the truthful women, and the patient men and the patient women, and the humble men and the humble women, and the charitable men and the charitable women, and the fasting men and the fasting women, and the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard, and the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember -- Allah has prepared for them forgiveness and a mighty reward

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it behoves not a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decided an affair, to exercise a choice in their matter. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, he surely strays off to manifest error

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when thou saidst to him to whom Allah had shown favour and to whom thou hadst shown a favour: Keep thy wife to thyself and keep thy duty to Allah; and thou concealedst in thy heart what Allah would bring to light, and thou fearedst men, and Allah has a greater right that thou shouldst fear Him. So when Zaid dissolved her marriage-tie, We gave her to thee as a wife, so that there should be no difficulty for the believers about the wives of their adopted sons, when they have dissolved their marriage-tie. And Allah’s command is ever performed

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There is no harm for the Prophet in that which Allah has ordained for him. Such has been the way of Allah with those who have gone before. And the command of Allah is a decree that is made absolute -

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who deliver the messages of Allah and fear Him, and fear none but Allah. And Allah is Sufficient to take account

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Muhammad is not the father of any of you men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the prophets. And Allah is ever Knower of all things

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, remember Allah with much remembrance

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And glorify Him morning and evening

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who sends blessings on you, and (so do) His angels, that He may bring you forth out of darkness into light. And He is ever Merciful to the believers

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Their salutation on the day they meet Him will be, Peace! and He has prepared for them an honourable reward

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, surely We have sent thee as a witness, and a bearer of good news and a warner

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as an inviter to Allah by His permission, and as a light-giving sun

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And give the believers the good news that they will have great grace from Allah

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And obey not the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and disregard their annoying talk, and rely on Allah. And Allah is enough as having charge (of affairs)

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, when you marry believing women, then divorce them before you touch them, you have in their case no term which you should reckon. But make provision for them and set them free in a goodly manner

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, We have made lawful to thee thy wives whom thou hast given their dowries, and those whom thy right hand possesses, out of those whom Allah has given thee as prisoners of war, and the daughters of thy paternal uncle and the daughters of thy paternal aunts, and the daughters of thy maternal uncle and the daughters of thy maternal aunts who fled with thee; and a believing woman, if she gives herself to the Prophet, if the Prophet desires to marry her. (It is) especially for thee, not for the believers -- We know what We have ordained for them concerning their wives and those whom their right hands possess in order that no blame may attach to thee. And Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thou mayest put off whom thou pleasest of them, and take to thee whom thou pleasest. And whom thou desirest of those whom thou hadst separated provisionally, no blame attaches to thee. This is most proper so that their eyes may be cool and they may not grieve, and that they should be pleased, all of them, with what thou givest them. And Allah knows what is in your hearts. And Allah is ever Knowing, Forbearing

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is not allowed to thee to take wives after this, nor to change them for other wives, though their beauty be pleasing to thee, except those whom thy right hand possesses. And Allah is ever Watchful over all things

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, enter not the houses of the Prophet unless permission is given to you for a meal, not waiting for its cooking being finished -- but when you are invited, enter, and when you have taken food, disperse -- not seeking to listen to talk. Surely this gives the Prophet trouble, but he forbears from you, and Allah forbears not from the truth. And when you ask of them any goods, ask of them from behind a curtain. This is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it behoves you not to give trouble to the Messenger of Allah, nor to marry his wives after him ever. Surely this is grievous in the sight of Allah

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If you do a thing openly or do it in secret, then surely Allah is ever Knower of all things

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There is no blame on them in respect of their fathers, nor their sons, nor their brothers, nor their brothers’ sons, nor their sisters’ sons, nor their own women, nor of what their right hands possess -- and (ye women) keep your duty to Allah. Surely Allah is ever Witness over all things

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah and His angels bless the Prophet. O you who believe, call for blessings on him and salute him with a (becoming) salutation

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely those who annoy Allah and His Messenger, Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter, and He has prepared for them an abasing chastisement

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who annoy believing men and believing women undeservedly, they bear the guilt of slander and manifest sin

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, tell thy wives and thy daughters and the women of believers to let down upon them their over-garments. This is more proper, so that they may be known, and not be given trouble. And Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease and the agitators in Madinah desist not, We shall certainly urge thee on against them, then they shall not be thy neighbours in it but for a little while -

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Accursed, wherever they are found they will be seized and slain

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That was the way of Allah concerning those who have gone before; and thou wilt find no change in the way of Allah

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Men ask thee about the Hour. Say: The Knowledge of it is only with Allah. And what will make thee comprehend that the Hour may be nigh

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a burning Fire

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To abide therein for a long time; they will find no protector nor helper

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when their leaders are turned back into the Fire, they say: O would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: Our Lord, we only obeyed our leaders and our great men, so they led us astray from the path

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Our Lord, give them a double chastisement and curse them with a great curse

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, be not like those who maligned Moses, but Allah cleared him what they said. And he was worthy of regard with Allah

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, keep your duty to Allah and speak straight worlds

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He will put your deeds into a right state for you, and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, he indeed achieves a mighty success

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to be unfaithful to it and feared from it, and man has turned unfaithful to it. Surely he is ever unjust, ignorant -

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That Allah may chastise the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women and the polytheistic men and the polytheistic women, and Allah will turn (mercifully) to the believing men and the believing women. And Allah is every Forgiving, Merciful

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Praise be to Allah! Whose is whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, and to Him be praise in the Hereafter! And He is the wise, the Aware

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He knows that which goes down into the earth and that which comes out of it, and that which comes down from heaven and that which goes up to it. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve say: The Hour will never come to us. Say: Yea, by my Lord, the Knower of the unseen! it will certainly come to you. Not an atom’s weight escapes Him in the heavens or in the earth, nor is there less than that nor greater, but (all) is in a clear book

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That He may reward those who believe and do good. For them is forgiveness and an honourable sustenance

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who strive hard in opposing Our Messages, for them is a painful chastisement of an evil kind

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed to thee from thy Lord, is the Truth, and it guides into the path of the Mighty, the Praised

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve say: Shall we show to you a man who informs you that, when you are scattered the utmost scattering, you will then be in a new creation

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has he forged a lie against Allah or is there madness in him? Nay, those who believe not in the Hereafter are in torment and in far error

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We please, We can make them low in the land or bring down upon them a portion of heaven. Surely there is a sign in this for every servant turning (to Allah)

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We gave David abundance from Us: O mountains, repeat praises with him, and the birds, and We made the iron pliant to him

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Saying: Make ample (coats of mail), and assign a time to the making of coats of mail and do ye good. Surely I am Seer of what you do

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And (We made) the wind (subservient) to Solomon; it made a month’s journey in the morning and a month’s journey in the evening; and We made a fountain of molten brass to flow for him. And of the jinn there were those who worked before him by the command of his Lord. And whoever turned aside from Our command from among them, We made him taste of the chastisement of burning

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They made for him what he pleased, of synagogues and images, and bowls (large) as watering-troughs and fixed cooking-pots. Give thanks, O people of David! And very few of My servants are grateful

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But when We decreed death for him, naught showed them his death but a creature of the earth that are away his staff. So when it fell down, the jinn saw clearly that, if they had known the unseen, they would not have tarried in humiliating torment

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly there was a sign for Saba’ in their abode -- two gardens on the right and the left. East of the sustenance of your Lord and give thanks to Him. A good land and a Forgiving Lord

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they turned aside, so We sent upon them a violent torrent, and in place of their two gardens We gave them two gardens yielding bitter fruit and (growing) tamarisk and a few lote-trees

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: With this We requited them because they were ungrateful; and We punish none but the ingrate

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We made between them and the towns which We had blessed, (other) towns easy to be seen, and We apportioned the journey therein: Travel through them nights and days, secure

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they said: Our Lord, make longer stages between our journeys. And they wronged themselves; so We made them stories and scattered them a total scattering. Surely there are signs in this for every patient, grateful one

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the devil indeed found true his conjecture concerning them, so they follow him, except a party of the believers

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he has no authority over them, but that We may know him who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt concerning it. And thy Lord is the Preserver of all things

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Call upon those whom you assert besides Allah; they control not the weight of an atom in the heavens or in the earth, nor have they any partnership in either, nor has He a helper among them

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And intercession avails naught with Him, save of him whom He permits. Until when fear is removed from their hearts, they say: What is it that your Lord said? They say: The Truth. And He is the Most High, the Great

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth? Say: Allah. And surely we or you are on a right way or in manifest error

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: You will not be asked of what we are guilty, nor shall we be asked of what you do

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Our Lord will gather us together, then He will judge between us with truth. And He is the Best Judge, the Knower

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Show me those whom you join with Him as associates. By no means (can you)! Nay, He is Allah, the Mighty, the Wise

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have not sent thee but as a bearer of good news and as a warner to all mankind, but most men know not

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: When will this promise be (fulfilled), if you are truthful

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: You have the appointment of a day which you cannot postpone by an hour, nor hasten on

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve say: We believe not in this Qur’an, nor in that which is before it. And if thou couldst see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, throwing back the blame one to another! Those who were reckoned weak say to those who were proud: Had it not been for you, we would have been believers

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who were proud say to those who were deemed weak: Did we turn you away from the guidance after it had come to you? Nay, you (yourselves) were guilty

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who were deemed weak say to those who were proud: Nay, (it was your) planning by night and day when you told us to disbelieve in Allah and to set up likes with Him. And they will manifest regret when they see the chastisement. And We put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieve. They will not be requited but for what they did

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We never sent a warner to a town but those who led easy lives in it said: We are disbelievers in that with which you are sent

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: We have more wealth and children, and we cannot be punished

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Surely my Lord amplifies and straitens provision for whom He pleases, but most men know not

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is not your wealth, nor your children, that bring you near to Us in rank; but whoever believes and does good, for such is a double reward for what they do, and they are secure in the highest places

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who strive in opposing Our messages, they will be brought to the chastisement

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Surely my Lord amplifies provision for whom He pleases of His servants and straitens (it) for him. And whatsoever you spend, He increases it in reward, and He is the Best of Providers

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And on the day when He will gather them all together, then will he say to the angels: Did these worship you

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will say: Glory be to Thee! Thou art our Protecting Friend, not they; nay, they worshipped the jinn; most of them were believers in them

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So on that day you will not control profit nor harm for one another. And We will say to those who were iniquitous: Taste the chastisement of the Fire, which you called a lie

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Our clear messages are recited to them, they say: This is naught but a man who desires to turn you away from that which your fathers worshipped. And they say: This is naught but a forged lie! And those who disbelieve say of the Truth when it comes to them: This is only clear enchantment

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have not given them any Books which they read, nor did We send to them before thee a warner

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those before them rejected (the truth), and these have not yet attained a tenth of that which We gave them, but they gave the lie to My messengers. How (terrible) was then My disapproval

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I exhort you only to one thing, that you rise up for Allah’s sake by twos and singly, then ponder! There is no madness in your companion. He is only a warner to you before a severe chastisement

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Whatever reward I ask of you, that is only for yourselves. My reward is only with Allah, and He is a Witness over all things

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Surely my Lord casts the Truth, the great Knower of the unseen

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: The Truth has come, and falsehood neither originates, nor reproduces

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: If I err, I err only to my own loss; and if I go aright, it is because of what my Lord reveals to me. Surely He is Hearing, Nigh

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And couldst thou see when they become terrified, but (then) there will be no escape and they will be seized from a near place

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they will say: We believe in it. And how can they attain (to faith) from a distant place

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they indeed disbelieved in it before, and they utter conjectures with regard to the unseen from a distant place

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a barrier is placed between them and that which they desire, as was done with their partisans before. Surely they are in a disquieting doubt

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Praise be to Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, the Maker of the angels, messengers flying on wings, two, and three, and four. He increase in creation what He pleases. Surely Allah is Possessor of power over all things

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever Allah grants to men of (His) mercy, there is none to withhold it, and what He withholds, none can grant thereafter. And He is the Mighty, the Wise

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Men, call to mind the favour of Allah to you. Is there any Creator besides Allah who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? There is no God but He. How are you then turned away

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if they reject thee -- truly messengers before thee were rejected. And to Allah are all affairs returned

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O men, surely the promise of Allah is true, so let not the life of this world deceive you. And let not the arch-deceiver deceive you about Allah

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the devil is your enemy, so take him for an enemy. He only invites his party to be companions of the burning Fire

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who disbelieve, for them is a severe chastisement. And those who believe and do good, for them is forgiveness and a great reward

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is he whose evil deed is made fair-seeming to him so that he considers it good? -- Now surely Allah leaves in error whom He pleases and guides aright whom He pleases, so let not thy soul waste away in grief for them. Surely Allah is Knower of what they do

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah is He Who sends the winds, so they raise a cloud, then We drive it on to a dead land, and therewith give life to the earth after its death. Even so is the quickening

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whoever desires might, then to Allah belongs the might wholly. To Him do ascend the goodly words, and the goodly deed -- He exalts it. And those who plan evil -- for them is a severe chastisement. And their plan will perish

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah created you from dust, then from the life-germ, then He made you pairs. And no females bears, nor brings forth, except with His knowledge. And no one living long is granted a long life, nor is aught diminished of one’s life, but it is all in a book. Surely this is easy to Allah

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the two seas are not alike: the one sweet, very sweet, pleasant to drink; and the other salt, bitter. Yet from both you eat fresh flesh and bring forth ornaments which you wear. And thou seest the ships cleave through it, that you may seek of His bounty and that you may give thanks

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He causes the night to enter in upon the day, and causes the day to enter in upon the night, and He has made subservient the sun and the moon, each one moves to an appointed time. This is Allah, your Lord; His is the kingdom. And those whom you call upon besides Him own not a straw

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If you call on them, they hear not your call; and if they heard, they could not answer you. And on the day of Resurrection they will deny your associating them (with Allah). And none can inform thee like the All-Aware one

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O men, it is you that have need of Allah, and Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praised One

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If He please, He will remove you and bring a new creation

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And this is not hard to Allah

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And no burdened soul can bear another’s burden. And if one weighed down by a burden calls another to carry his load, naught of it will be carried, even though he be near of kin. Thou warnest only those who fear their Lord in secret and keep up prayer. And whoever purifies himself, purifies himself only for his own good. And to Allah is the eventual coming

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the blind and the seeing are not alike

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor the darkness and the light

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor the shade and the heat

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Neither are the living and the dead alike. Surely Allah makes whom He pleases hear, and thou canst not make those hear who are in the graves

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thou art naught but a warner

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have sent thee with the Truth as a bearer of good news and a warner. And there is not a people but a warner has gone among them

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if they reject thee, those before them also rejected -- their messengers came to them with clear arguments, and with scriptures, and with the illuminating Book

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then I seized those who disbelieved, so how (terrible) was My disapproval

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not that Allah sends down water from the clouds, then We bring forth therewith fruits of various hues? And in the mountains are streaks, white and red, of various hues and (others) intensely black

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of men and beasts and cattle there are various colours likewise. Those of his servants only who are possessed of knowledge fear Allah. Surely Allah is Mighty, Forgiving

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely those who recite the Book of Allah and keep up prayer and spend out of what We have given them, secretly and openly, hope for a gain which perishes not -

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That He may pay them back fully their rewards and give them more out of His grace. Surely He is Forgiving, Multiplier of reward

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that which We have revealed to thee of the Book, that is the truth, verifying that which is before it. Surely Allah is Aware, Seer of His servants

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We have given the Book as inheritance to those whom We have chosen from among Our servants: so of them is he who wrongs himself, and of them is he who takes a middle course, and of them is he who is foremost in deeds of goodness by Allah’s permission. That is the great grace

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Gardens of perpetuity, which they enter -- they are made to wear therein bracelets of gold and pearls, and their dress therein is silk

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: Praise be to Allah, Who has removed grief from us! Surely our Lord is Forgiving, Multiplier of reward

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who out of His grace has made us alight in a house abiding for ever; therein toil touches us not nor does fatigue afflict us therein

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve, for them is Fire of hell; it is not finished with them so that they should die, nor is chastisement thereof lightened to them. Thus We deal retribution on every ungrateful one

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And therein they cry for succour: Our Lord, take us out! we will do good deeds other than those which we used to do! Did We not give you a life long enough, for him to be mindful who would mind? And there came to you the warner. So taste; because for the iniquitous there is no helper

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah is the Knower of the unseen in the heavens and the earth. Surely He is Knower of what is in the hearts

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who made you successors in the earth. So whoever disbelieves, his disbelief is against himself. And their disbelief increases the disbelievers with their Lord in naught but hatred; and their disbelief increases the disbelievers in naught but loss

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Have you seen your associates which you call upon besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth! Or have they any share in the heavens? Or, have We given them a Book so that they follow a clear argument thereof? Nay, the wrongdoers hold out promises one to another only to deceive

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah upholds the heavens and the earth lest they come to naught. And if they come to naught, none can uphold them after Him. Surely He is ever Forbearing, Forgiving

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they swore by Allah, their strongest oaths, that, if a warner came to them, they would be better guided than any of the nations. But when a warner came to them, it increased them in naught but aversion

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Behaving proudly in the land and planning evil. And the evil plan besets none save the authors of it. So they wait for naught but the way of the ancients. But thou wilt find no alteration in the course of Allah; and thou wilt find no change in the course of Allah

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Have they not travelled in the land and seen what was the end of those before them -- and they were stronger than those in power? And Allah is not such that anything in the heavens or the earth can escape Him. Surely He is ever Knowing, Powerful

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And were Allah to punish men for what they earn, he would not leave on the back of it any creature, but He respites them till an appointed term; so when their doom comes, then surely Allah is ever Seer of His servants

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O man

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By the Qur’an, full of wisdom

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely thou art one of the messengers

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On a right way

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A revelation of the Mighty

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That thou mayest warn a people whose fathers were not warned, so they are heedless

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The word has indeed proved true of most of them, so they believe not

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have placed on their necks chains reaching up to the chins, so they have their heads raised aloft

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have set a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, thus We have covered them, so that they see not

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is alike to them whether thou warn them or warn them not -- they believe not

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thou canst warn him only who follows the Reminder and fears the Beneficent in secret; so give him good news of forgiveness and a generous reward

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We give life to the dead, and We write down that which they send before and their footprints, and We record everything in a clear writing

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And set out to them a parable of the people of the town, when apostles came to it

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When We sent to them two, they rejected them both; then We strengthened (them) with a third, so they said: Surely we are sent to you

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: You are only mortals like ourselves, nor has the Beneficent revealed anything -- you only lie

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Our Lord knows that we are surely sent to you

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And our duty is only a clear deliverance (of the message)

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Surely we augur evil from you. If you desist not, we will surely stone you, and a painful chastisement from us will certainly afflict you

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Your evil fortune is with you. What! If you are reminded! Nay, you are an extravagant people

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And from the remote part of the city there came a man running. He said: O my people, follow the apostles

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Follow him who asks of you no reward, and they are on the right course

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And what reason have I that I should not serve Him Who created me and to Whom you will be brought back

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Shall I take besides Him gods whose intercession, if the Beneficent should desire to afflict me with harm, will avail me naught, nor can they deliver me

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then I shall surely be in clear error

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I believe in your Lord, so hear me

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It was said: Enter the Garden. He said: Would that my people knew

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: How my Lord has forgiven me and made me of the honoured ones

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We sent not down upon his people after him any host from heaven, nor do We ever send

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It was naught but a single cry, and lo! they were still

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Alas for the servants! Never does a messenger come to them but they mock him

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not how many generations We destroyed before them, that they return not to them

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And all -- surely all -- will be brought before Us

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a sign to them is the dead earth: We give life to it and bring forth from it grain so they eat of it

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We make therein gardens of date-palms and grapes and We make springs to flow forth therein

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That they may eat of the fruit thereof, and their hands made it not. Will they not then give thanks

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Glory be to Him Who created pairs of all things, of what the earth grows, and of their kind and of what they know not

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a sign to them is the night: We draw forth from it the day, then lo! they are in darkness

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the sun moves on to its destination. That is the ordinance of the Mighty, the Knower

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the moon, We have ordained for it stages till it becomes again as an old dry palm-branch

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Neither is it for the sun to overtake the moon, nor can the night outstrip the day. And all float on in an orbit

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a sign to them is that We bear their offspring in the laden ship

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have created for them the like thereof, whereon they ride

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We please, We may drown them, then there is no succour for them, nor can they be rescued -

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But by mercy from Us and for enjoyment till a time

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when it is said to them: Guard against that which is before you and that which is behind you, that mercy may be shown to you

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there comes to them no message of the messages of their Lord but they turn away from it

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when it is said to them: Spend out of that which Allah has given you, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: Shall we feed him whom, if Allah please, He could feed? You are in naught but clear error

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They await but a single cry, which will overtake them while they contend

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they will not be able to make a bequest, nor will they return to their families

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the trumpet is blown, when lo! from their graves they will hasten on to their Lord

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will say: O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping-place? This is what the Beneficent promised and the messengers told the truth

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is but a single cry, when lo! they are all brought before Us

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So this day no soul is wronged in aught; and you are not rewarded aught but for what you did

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the owners of the Garden are on that day in a happy occupation

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They and their wives are in shades, reclining on raised couches

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They have fruits therein, and they have whatever they desire

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Peace! A word from a Merciful Lord

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And withdraw to-day, O guilty ones

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Did I not charge you, O children of Adam, that you serve not the devil? Surely he is your open enemy

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that you serve Me. This is the right way

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly he led astray numerous people from among you. Could you not then understand

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is the hell which you were promised

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Enter it this day because you disbelieved

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That day We shall seal their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will bear witness as to what they earned

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We pleased, We would put out their eyes, then they would strive to get first to the way, but how should they see

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if We pleased, We would transform them in their place, then they would not be able to go on, or turn back

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whomsoever We cause to live long, We reduce to an object state in creation. Do they not understand

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have not taught him poetry, nor is it meet for him. This is naught but a Reminder and a plain Qur’an

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To warn him who would have life, and (that) the word may prove true against the disbelievers

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See they not that We have created cattle for them, out of what Our hands have wrought, so they are their masters

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have subjected them to them, so some of them they ride, and some they eat

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And therein they have advantages and drinks. Will they not then give thanks

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they take gods besides Allah and they may be helped

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They are not able to help them, and they are a host brought up before them

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So let not their speech grieve thee. Surely We know what they do in secret and what they do openly

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Does not man see that We have created him from the small life-germ? Then lo! he is an open disputant

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he strikes out a likeness for Us and forgets his own creation. Says he: Who will give life to bones, when they are rotten

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: He will give life to them, Who brought them into existence at first, and He is Knower of all creation

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who produced fire for you out of the green tree, so that with it you kindle

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yea! And He is the Creator (of all), the Knower

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: His command, when He intends anything, is only to say to it, Be, and it is

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So glory be to Him in Whose hand is the kingdom of all things! and to Him you will be returned

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By those ranging in ranks

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who restrain holding in restraint

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who recite the Reminder

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely your God is One

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, and the Lord of the eastern lands

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have adorned the lower heaven with an adornment, the stars

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And (there is) a safeguard against every rebellious devil

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They cannot listen to the exalted assembly and they are reproached from every side

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Driven off; and for them is a perpetual chastisement

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except him who snatches away but once, then there follows him a brightly shining flame

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So ask them whether they are stronger in creation or those (others) whom We have created. Surely We created them of firm clay

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, thou wonderest, while they mock

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when they are reminded, they mind not

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when they see a sign, they seek to scoff

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And say: This is nothing but clear enchantment

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be raised

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or our fathers of yore

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Yea, and you will be humiliated

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So it will be but one cry, when lo! they will see

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they will say: O woe to us! This is the day of Requital

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is the day of Judgment, which you called a lie

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Gather together those who did wrong and their associates, and what they worshippe

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Besides Allah, then lead them to the way to hell

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And stop them, for they shall be questioned

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is the matter with you that you help not one another

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, on that day they will be submissive

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And some of them will turn to others mutually questioning -

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Saying: Surely you used to come to us from the right side

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will say: Nay, you (yourselves) were not believers

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we had no authority over you, but you were an inordinate people

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So the word of our Lord has proved true against us: we shall surely taste

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We led you astray, for we ourselves were erring

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So, that day they will be sharers in the chastisement

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus do We deal with the guilty

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They indeed were arrogant, when it was said to them: There is no god but Allah

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And said: Shall we give up our gods for a mad poet

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, he has brought the Truth and verifies the messengers

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely you will taste the painful chastisement

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And you are requited naught but for what you did -

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Save the servants of Allah, the purified ones

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For them is a known sustenance

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Fruits. And they are honoured

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In Gardens of delight

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On thrones, facing each other

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A bowl of running water will be made to go round them

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: White, delicious to those who drink

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It deprives not of reason, nor are they exhausted therewith

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And with them are those modest in gaze, having beautiful eyes

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As if they were eggs, carefully protected

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then some of them will turn to others, questioning mutually

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A speaker of them will say: Surely I had a comrade

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who said: Art thou indeed of those who accept

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be requited

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He will say: Will you look

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he looked down and saw him in the midst of hell

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He will say: By Allah! thou hadst almost caused me to perish

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And had it not been for favour of my Lord, I should have been among those brought up

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Are we not to die

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except our previous death? And are we not to be chastised

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this is the mighty achievement

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For the like of this, then, let the workers work

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is this the better entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have made it a trial for the wrongdoers

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is a tree that grows in the bottom of hell -

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then truly they will eat of it and fill (their) bellies with it

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then surely they shall have after it a drink of boiling water

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then their return is surely to the flaming Fire

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They indeed found their fathers astray

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So in their footsteps they are hastening on

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And most of the ancients surely went astray before them

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And indeed We sent among them warners

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then see what was the end of those warned -

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except the servants of Allah, the purified ones

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Noah certainly called upon Us, and excellent Answerer of prayers are We

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Its produce is as it were the heads of serpents

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We delivered him and his people from the great distress

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And made his offspring the survivors

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And left for him (praise) among the later generations

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Peace be to Noah among the nations

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus indeed do We reward the doers of good

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely he was of Our believing servants

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We drowned the others

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely of his party was Abraham

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he came to his Lord with a secure heart

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he said to his sire and his people: What is it that you worship

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A lie -- gods besides Allah do you desire

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is then your idea about the Lord of the worlds

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he glanced a glance at the stars

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And said: Surely I am sick (of your deities)

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they turned their backs on him, going away

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he turned to their gods and said: Do you not eat

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is the matter with you that you speak not

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he turned upon them, smiting with the right hand

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then they came to him, hastening

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Do you worship that which you hew out

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has created you and what you make

97.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Build for him a building, then cast him into the flaming fire

98.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they designed a plan against him, but We brought them low

99.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he said: Surely I flee to my Lord -- He will guide me

100.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My Lord, grant me a doer of good deeds

101.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We gave him the good news of a forbearing son

102.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But when he became of (age to) work with him, he said: O my son, I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice thee: so consider what thou seest. He said: O my father, do as thou art commanded; if Allah please, thou wilt find me patient

103.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when they both submitted and he had thrown him down upon his forehead

104.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We called out to him saying, O Abraham

105.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thou has indeed fulfilled the vision. Thus do We reward the doers of good

106.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this is a manifest trial

107.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice

108.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We granted him among the later generations (the salutation)

110.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus do We reward the doers of good

111.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely he was one of Our believing servants

112.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave him the good news of Isaac, a prophet, a righteous one

113.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We blessed him and Isaac. And of their offspring some are doers of good, but some are clearly unjust to themselves

114.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We conferred a favour on Moses and Aaron

115.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We delivered them, and their people from the mighty distress

116.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We helped them, so they were the vanquishers

117.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave them both the clear Book

118.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We guided them on the right way

119.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We granted them among the later generations (the salutation)

120.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Peace be to Moses and Aaron

121.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus do We reward the doers of good

122.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely they were both of Our believing servants

123.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Elias was surely of those sent

124.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he said to his people: Will you not guard against evil

125.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you call upon Ba’l and forsake the Best of the creators

126.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of yore

127.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they rejected him, so they shall be brought up

128.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But not the servants of Allah, the purified ones

129.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We granted him among the later generations (the salutation)

131.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Even thus We reward the doers of good

132.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely he was one of Our believing servants

133.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Lot was surely of those sent

134.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When We delivered him and his people, all -

135.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except an old woman among those who remained behind

137.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely you pass by them in the morning

138.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And at night. Do you not then understand

139.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Jonah was surely of those sent

140.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When he fled to the laden ship

141.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he shared with others but was of those cast away

142.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So the fish took him into its mouth while he was blamable

143.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But had he not been of those who glorify (Us)

144.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He would have tarried in its belly till the day when they are raised

145.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We cast him on the naked shore, while he was sick

146.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We caused a gourd to grow up for him

147.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We sent him to a hundred thousand or more

148.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they believed, so We gave them provision till a time

149.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Now ask them whether thy Lord has daughters and they have sons

150.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or did We create the angels females, while they witnessed

151.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Now surely it is of their own lie that they say

152.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah has begotten. And truly they are liars

153.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has He preferred daughters to sons

154.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is the matter with you? How you judge

156.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or have you a clear authority

157.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then bring your Book, if you are truthful

158.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they assert a relationship between Him and the jinn. And certainly the jinn know that they will be brought up (for judgment) -

159.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Glory be to Allah from what they describe! -

160.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But not so the servants of Allah, the purified ones

161.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So surely you and that which you serve

162.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Not against Him can you cause (any) to fall into trial

163.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Save him who will burn in the flaming Fire

164.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there is none of us but has an assigned place

166.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely they used to say

167.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Had we a reminder from those of yore

168.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We would have been sincere servants of Allah

169.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But (now) they disbelieve in it, so they will come to know

170.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly Our word has already gone forth to Our servants, to those sent

171.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That they, surely they, will be helped

172.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Our hosts, surely they, will be triumphant

173.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So turn away from them till a time

174.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And watch them, they too will see

175.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Would they hasten on Our chastisement

176.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when it descends in their court, evil will be the morning of the warned ones

177.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And turn away from them till a time

178.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And watch, for they too will see

179.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Glory be to thy Lord, the Lord of Might, above what they describe

180.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And peace be to those sent

181.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds

182.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And verily we are ranged in ranks

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Truthful God! By the Qur’an, possessing eminence

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, those who disbelieve are in self-exaltation and opposition

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: How many a generation We destroyed before them, then they cried when there was no longer time for escape

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they wonder that a warner from among themselves has come to them, and the disbelievers say: This is an enchanter, a liar

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Makes he the gods a single God? Surely this is a strange thing

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the chiefs among them say: Go and steadily adhere to your gods: surely this is a thing intended

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We never heard of this in the former faith: this is nothing but a forgery

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has the Reminder been revealed to him from among us? Nay, they are in doubt as to My Reminder. Nay, they have not yet tasted My chastisement

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, have they the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Great Giver

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is between them theirs? Then let them rise higher in means

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What an army of the allies is here put to flight

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The people of Noah, and ‘Ad, and Pharaoh, the lord of hosts, rejected (prophets) before them

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Thamud and the people of Lot and the dwellers of the thicket. These were the parties (opposing Truth)

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Not one of them but rejected the messengers, so just was My retribution

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And these wait but for one cry, wherein there is no delay

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: Our Lord, hasten on for us our portion before the day of Reckoning

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Bear patiently what they say, and remember Our servant David, the possessor power. He ever turned (to Allah)

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Truly We made the mountains subject to him, glorifying (Allah) at nightfall and sunrise

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the birds gathered together. All were obedient to him

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We strengthened his kingdom and We gave him wisdom and a clear judgment

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And has the story of the adversaries come to thee? When they made an entry into the private chamber by climbing the wall -

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When they came upon David so he was afraid of them. They said: Fear not; two litigants, of whom one has wronged the other, so decide between us with justice, and act not unjustly, and guide us to the right way

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is my brother. He has ninety-nine ewes and I have a single ewe. Then he said, Make it over to me, and he has prevailed against me in dispute

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Surely he has wronged thee in demanding thy ewe (to add) to his own ewes. And surely many partners wrong one another save those who believe and do good, and very few are they! And David knew that We had tried him, so he asked his Lord for protection, and he fell down bowing and turned (to God)

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We gave him this protection, and he had a nearness to Us and an excellent resort

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O David, surely We have made thee a ruler in the land; so judge between men justly and follow not desire, lest it lead thee astray from the path of Allah. Those who go astray from the path of Allah, for them is surely a severe chastisement because they forgot the day of Reckoning

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We created not the heaven and the earth and what is between them in vain. That is the opinion of those who disbelieve. So woe to those who disbelieve on account of the Fire

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Shall We treat those who believe and do good like the mischief-makers in the earth? Or shall We make the dutiful like the wicked

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (This is) a Book that We have revealed to thee abounding in good, that they may ponder over its verses, and that the men of understanding may mind

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave to David Solomon. Most excellent the servant! Surely he ever turned (to Allah)

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When well-bred, swift (horses) were brought to him at evening -

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he said, I love the good things on account of the remembrance of my Lord -- until they were hidden behind the veil

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (He said): Bring them back to me. So he began to stroke (their) legs and necks

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly we tried Solomon, and We put on his throne a (mere) body, so he turned (to Allah)

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom which is not fit for any one after me; surely Thou art the Great Giver

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We made the wind subservient to him; it made his command to run gently wherever he desired

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the devils, every builder and diver

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And others fettered in chains

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is Our free gift, so give freely or withhold, without reckoning

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely he had a nearness to Us and an excellent resort

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And remember Our servant Job. When he cried to his Lord: The devil has afflicted me with toil and torment

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Urge with thy foot; here is a cool washing-place and a drink

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We gave him his people and the like of them with them, a mercy from Us, and a reminder for men of understanding

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And take in thy hand few worldly goods and earn goodness therewith and incline not to falsehood. Surely We found him patient; most excellent the servant! Surely he (ever) turned (to Us)

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And remember Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, men of power and insight

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We indeed purified them by a pure quality, the keeping in mind of the (final) abode

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely they were with Us, of the elect, the best

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And remember Ishmael and Elisha and Dhu-l-Kifl; and they were all of the best

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is a reminder and surely there is an excellent resort for the dutiful

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Gardens of perpetuity -- the doors are opened for them

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Reclining therein, calling therein for many fruits and drink

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And with them are those modest in gaze, equals in age

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is what you are promised for the day of Reckoning

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this is Our sustenance; it will never come to an end -

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This (is for the good)! And surely there is an evil resort for the inordinate -

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Hell. They will enter it. So evil is the resting-place

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This -- so let them taste it, boiling and intensely cold (drink)

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And other similar (punishment), of various sorts

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is an army rushing headlong with you -- no welcome for them! Surely they will burn in fire

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They say: Nay! you -- no welcome to you! You prepared it for us, so evil is the resting-place

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They say: Our Lord, whoever prepared it for us, give him more, a double, punishment in the Fire

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: What is the matter with us? -- we see not men whom we used to count among the vicious

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Did we (only) take them in scorn, or do our eyes miss them

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That surely is the truth -- the contending one with another of the inmates of the Fire

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I am only a warner; and there is no God but Allah, the One, the Subduer (of all) -

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Mighty, the Forgiving

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: It is a message of importance

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: From which you turn away

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I have no knowledge of the exalted chiefs when they contend

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Only this is revealed to me that I am a plain warner

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When thy Lord said to the angels: Surely I am going to create a mortal from dust

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when I have made him complete and breathed into him of My spirit, fall down submitting to him

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the angels submitted, all of them

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But not Iblis. He was proud and he was one of the disbelievers

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: O Iblis, what prevented thee from submitting to him whom I created with both My hands? Art thou proud or art thou of the exalted ones

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: I am better than he; Thou hast created me of fire, and him Thou didst create of dust

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Go forth from hence! surely thou art driven away

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely My curse is on thee to the day of Judgment

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, respite me to the day that they are raised

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Surely thou art of the respited ones

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Till the day of the time made known

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: Then by Thy Might! I will surely lead them all astray

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except Thy servants from among them, the purified ones

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: The Truth is, and the truth I speak -

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That I shall fill hell with thee and with all those among them who follow thee

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I ask you no reward for it; nor am I of the impostors

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is naught but a Reminder to the nations

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly you will come to know about it after a time

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have revealed to thee the Book with truth, so serve Allah, being sincere to Him in obedience

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Now surely sincere obedience is due to Allah (alone). And those who choose protectors besides Him (say): We serve them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah. Surely Allah will judge between them in that in which they differ. Surely Allah guides not him who is a liar, ungrateful

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If Allah desired to take a son to Himself, He could have chosen those He pleased out of those whom He has created -- Glory be to Him! He is Allah, the One, the Subduer (of all)

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He has created the heavens and the earth with truth; He makes the night cover the day and makes the day overtake the night, and He has made the sun and the moon subservient; each one moves on to an assigned term. Now surely He is the Mighty, the Forgiver

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He created you from a single being, then made its mates of the same (kind). And He sent down for you eight of the cattle in pairs. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers -- creation after creation -- in triple darkness. That is Allah, your Lord; His is the kingdom. There is no God but He. How are you then turned away

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If you are ungrateful, then surely Allah is above need of you. And He likes not ungratefulness in His servants. And if you are grateful, He likes it for you. And no bearer of a burden will bear another’s burden. Then to your Lord is your return, then will He inform you of what you did. Surely He is Knower of what is in the breasts

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when distress afflicts a man he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him; then when He grants him a favour from Him, he forgets that for which he called upon Him before, and sets up rivals to Allah that he may cause (men) to stray from His path. Say: Enjoy thine ungratefulness for a little, surely thou art of the companions of the Fire

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is he who is obedient during hours of the night, prostrating himself and standing, taking care of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord --? Say: Are those who know and those who know not alike? Only men of understanding mind

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: O My servants who believe; keep your duty to your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and Allah’s earth is spacious. Truly the steadfast will be paid their reward without measure

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I am commanded to serve Allah, being sincere to Him in obedience

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I am commanded to be the first of those who submit

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the chastisement of a grievous day

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Allah I serve, being sincere to Him in my obedience

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Serve then what you will beside Him. Say: The losers surely are those who lose themselves and their people on the day of Resurrection. Now surely that is the manifest loss

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They shall have coverings of fire above them and coverings beneath them. With that Allah makes His servants to fear; so keep your duty to Me, O My servants

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who eschew the worship of the idols and turn to Allah, for them is good news. So give good news to My servants

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who listen to the Word, then follow the best of it. Such are they whom Allah has guided, and such are the men of understanding

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He against whom the sentence of chastisement is due -- canst thou save him who is in the Fire

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are high places, above them higher places, built (for them), wherein rivers flow. (It is) the promise of Allah. Allah fails not in (His) promise

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not that Allah sends down water from the clouds, then makes it go down into the earth in springs, then brings forth therewith herbage of various hues; then it withers so that thou seest it turn yellow, then He makes it chaff? Surely there is a reminder in this for men of understanding

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is he whose breast Allah has opened to Islam so that he follows a light from his Lord --? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah! Such are in clear error

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah has revealed the best announcement, a Book consistent, repeating (its injunctions), whereat do shudder the skins of those who fear their Lord, then their skins and their hearts soften to Allah’s remembrance. This is Allah’s guidance -- He guides with it whom He pleases. And he whom Allah leaves in error, there is no guide for him

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is then he who has to guard himself with his own person against the evil chastisement on the Resurrection day --? And it will be said to the iniquitous: Taste what you earned

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those before them denied, so the chastisement came to them from whence they perceived not

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So Allah made them taste disgrace in this worlds’ life, and certainly the chastisement of the Hereafter is greater. Did they but know

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have set forth for men in this Qur’an similitudes of every sort that they may mind

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: An Arabic Qur’an without any crookedness, that they may guard against evil

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah sets forth a parable: A man belonging to partners differing with one another, and a man (devoted) wholly to one man. Are the two alike in condition? Praise be to Allah! Nay, most of them know not

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely thou wilt die and they (too) will die

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then surely on the day of Resurrection you will contend one with another before your Lord

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who is then more unjust than he who utters a lie against Allah and denies the truth, when it comes to him? Is there not in hell an abode for the disbelievers

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he who brings the truth and accepts the truth -- such are the dutiful

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They shall have with their Lord what they please. Such is the reward of the doers of good -

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That Allah may ward off from them the worst of what they did, and give them their reward for the best of what they did

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is not Allah sufficient for His servant? And they seek to frighten thee with those besides Him. And whomsoever Allah leaves in error, there is no guide for him

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whom Allah guides, there is none that can lead him astray. Is not Allah Mighty, the Lord of retribution

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if thou ask them, Who created the heavens and the earth? They will say: Allah. Say: See you then that those you call upon besides Allah, would they, if Allah desire to afflict me with harm, remove His harm? Or if He desire to show me mercy, could they withhold His mercy? Say: Allah is sufficient for me. On Him do the reliant rely

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: O my people, work in your place. Surely I am a worker, so you will come to know

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who it is to whom there comes a chastisement abasing him, and on whom falls a lasting chastisement

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have revealed to thee the Book with truth for (the good of) men. So whoever follows the right way, it is for his own soul, and whoever errs, he errs only to its detriment. And thou art not a custodian over them

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah takes (men’s) souls at the time of their death, and those that die not, during their sleep. Then He withholds those on whom He has passed the decree of death and sends the others back till an appointed term. Surely there are signs in this for a people who reflect

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or, take they intercessors besides Allah? Say: What! Even though they control naught, nor do they understand

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: say: Allah’s is the intercession altogether. His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter shrink, and when those besides Him are mentioned, lo! they are joyful

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: O Allah, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the seen, Thou judgest between Thy servants as to that wherein they differ

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And had those who do wrong all that is in the earth and the like of it with it, they would certainly offer it as ransom from the evil of the chastisement on the day of Resurrection. And what they never thought of shall become plain to them from Allah

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the evil of what they wrought will become plain to them, and that which they mocked at will beset them

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when harm afflicts a man he calls upon Us; then, when We give him a boon from Us, he says: I have been given it only by means of knowledge. Nay, it is a trial, but most of them know not

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those before them did say it indeed, but what they earned availed them not

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So there befell them the evil which they had earned. And those who are unjust from among these, there shall befall them the evil which they earn, and they shall not escape

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Know they not that Allah gives ample subsistence to whom He pleases, and He straitens; surely there are signs in this for a people who believe

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: O My servants who have been prodigal regarding their souls, despair not of the mercy of Allah; surely Allah forgives sins altogether. He is indeed the Forgiving, the Merciful

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And turn to your Lord and submit to Him before chastisement comes to you, then you will not be helped

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And follow the best that has been revealed to you from your Lord before chastisement comes to you all of a sudden, while you perceive not -
