1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, be not forward in the presence of Allah and his Messenger, and keep your duty to Allah. Surely Allah is Hearing, Knowing

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, raise not your voices above the Prophet’s voice, nor speak loudly to him as you speak loudly one to another, lest your deeds become null, while you perceive not

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely those who lower their voices before Allah’s Messenger are they whose hearts Allah has proved for dutifulness. For them is forgiveness and a great reward

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who call out to thee from behind the private apartments, most of them have no sense

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if they had patience till thou come out to them, it would be better for them. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, if an unrighteous man brings you news, look carefully into it, lest you harm a people in ignorance, then be sorry for what you did

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And know that among you is Allah’s Messenger. Were he to obey you in many a matter, you would surely fall into distress; but Allah has endeared the faith to you and has made it seemly in your hearts, and He has made hateful to you disbelief and transgression and disobedience. Such are those who are rightly guided -

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A grace from Allah and a favour. And Allah is Knowing, Wise

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if two parties of the believers quarrel, make peace between them. Then if one of them does wrong to the other, fight that which does wrong, till it return to Allah’s command. Then, if it returns, make peace between them with justice and act equitably. Surely Allah loves the equitable

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The believers are brethren so make peace between your brethren, and keep your duty to Allah that mercy may be had on you

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, let not people laugh at people, perchance they may be better than they; nor let women (laugh) at women, perchance they may be better than they. Neither find fault with your own people, nor call one another by nick-names. Evil is a bad name after faith; and whoso turns not, these it is that are the iniquitous

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, avoid most of suspicion, for surely suspicion in some cases is sin; and spy not nor let some of you backbite others. Does one of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You abhor it! And keep your duty to Allah, surely Allah is Oft-returning (to mercy), Merciful

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O mankind, surely We have created you from a male and a female, and made you tribes and families that you may know each other. Surely the noblest of you with Allah is the most dutiful of you. Surely Allah is Knowing, Aware

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The dwellers of the desert say: We believe. Say: You believe not, but say, We submit; and faith has not yet entered into your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish aught of your deeds. Surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The believers are those only who believe in Allah and His Messenger, then they doubt not, and struggle hard with their wealth and their lives in the way of Allah. Such are the truthful ones

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Would you apprise Allah of your religion? and Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. And Allah is Knower of all things

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They presume to lay thee under an obligation by becoming Muslims. Say: Lay me not under an obligation by your Islam; rather Allah lays you under an obligation by guiding you to the faith, if you are truthful

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah knows the unseen of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Seer of what you do

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Almighty (God)! By the glorious Qur’an

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, they wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves; so the disbelievers say: This is a wonderful thing

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When we die and become dust -- that is a far return

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We know indeed what the earth diminishes of them and with Us is a book that preserves

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, they reject the Truth when it comes to them, so they are in a state of confusion

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do they not look at the sky above them? -- how We have made it and adorned it and it has no gaps

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the earth, We have spread it out, and cast therein mountains, and We have made to grow therein of every beautiful kind -

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To give sight and as a reminder to every servant who turns (to Allah)

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We send down from the clouds water abounding in good, then We cause to grow thereby gardens and the grain that is reaped

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the tall palm-trees having flower spikes piled one above another -

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A sustenance for the servants, and We give life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the rising

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Before them the people of Noah rejected (the Truth) and (so did) the dwellers of Al-Rads and Thamu

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And ‘Ad and Pharaoh and Lot’s brethren

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the dwellers of the grove and the people of Tubba. They all rejected the messengers, so My threat came to pass

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Were We then fatigued with the first creation? Yet they are in doubt about a new creation

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We created man, and We know what his mind suggests to him -- and We are nearer to him than his life-vein

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When the two receivers receive, sitting on the right and on the left

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He utters not a word but there is by him a watcher at hand

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the stupor of death comes in truth; that is what thou wouldst shun

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the trumpet is blown. That is the day of threatening

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And every soul comes, with it a driver and a witness

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thou wast indeed heedless of this, but now We have removed from thee thy veil, so thy sight is sharp this day

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And his companion will say: This is what is ready with me

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Cast into hell every ungrateful, rebellious one

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Forbidder of good, exceeder of limits, doubter

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who sets up another god with Allah, so cast him into severe chastisement

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: His companion will say: Our Lord, I did not cause him to rebel but he himself went far in error

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He will say: Dispute not in My presence, and indeed I gave you warning beforehand

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My sentence cannot be changed, nor am I in the least unjust to the servants

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when We say to hell: Art thou filled up? And it will say: Are there any more

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the Garden is brought near for those who guard against evil -- (it is) not distant

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is what you are promised -- for every one turning (to Allah), keeping (the limits) -

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who fears the Beneficent in secret, and comes with a penitent heart

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Enter it in peace. That is the day of abiding

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For them therein is all they wish, and with Us is yet more

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many a generation We destroyed before them who were mightier in prowess than they! so they went about in the lands. Is there a place of refuge

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely there is a reminder in this for him who has a heart or he gives ear and is a witness

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six periods, and no fatigue touched Us

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So bear with what they say, and celebrate the praise of thy Lord before the rising of the sun and before the setting

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And glorify Him in the night and after prostration

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And listen on the day when the crier cries from a near place -

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when they hear the cry in truth. That is the day of coming forth

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We give life and cause to die, and to Us is the eventual coming -

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when the earth cleaves asunder from them, hastening forth. That is a gathering easy to Us

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We know best what they say, and thou art not one to compel them. So remind by means of the Qur’an him who fears My threat

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By those scattering broadcast

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those bearing the load

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those running easily

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those distributing the Affair! -

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What you are promised is surely true

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the Judgment will surely come to pass

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By the heaven full of paths

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely you are of warying opinion -

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He is turned away from it who would be turned away

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Cursed by the liars

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who are in an abyss, neglectful

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They ask: When is the day of Judgment

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (It is) the day when they are tried at the Fire

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Taste your persecution! This is what you would hasten on

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the dutiful are amidst Gardens and fountains

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Taking that which their Lord gives them. Surely they were before that the doers of good

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The used to sleep but little at night

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in the morning they asked (Divine) protection

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in their wealth there was a due share for the beggar and for one who is denied (good)

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in the earth are signs for those who are sure

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in yourselves -- do you not see

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in the heavens is your sustenance and that which you are promised

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So by the Lord of the heavens and the earth! it is surely the truth, just as you speak

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has the story of Abraham’s honoured guests reached thee

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When they came to him, they said: Peace! Peace! said he. Strangers

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he turned aside to his family and brought a fat calf

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he placed it before them. He said: Will you not eat

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he conceived a fear of them. They said: Fear not. And they gave him the good news of a boy possessing knowledge

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then his wife came up in grief, and she smote her face and said: A barren old woman

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Thus says thy Lord. Surely He is the Wise, the Knowing

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: What is your errand, O messengers

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: We have been sent to a guilty peopl

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That we may send upon them stones of clay

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Marked from thy Lord for the prodigal

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then we brought forth such believers as were there

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We found there but a (single) house of Muslims

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful chastisement

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in Moses, when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But he turned away on account of his might and said: An enchanter or a madman

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We seized him and his hosts and hurled them into the sea, and he was blameable

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in ‘Ad, when We sent upon them the destructive wind

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It spared naught that it came against, but it made it like ashes

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in Thamud, when it was said to them: Enjoy yourselves for a while

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they revolted against the commandment of their Lord, so the punishment overtook them, while they saw

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they were unable to rise up, nor could they defend themselves

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the people of Noah before. Surely they were a transgressing people

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the heaven, We raised it high with power, and We are Makers of the vast extent

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the earth, We have spread it out. How well We prepared it

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And of everything We have created pairs that you may be mindful

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So flee to Allah. Surely I am a plain warner to you from Him

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And do not set up with Allah another god. Surely I am a plain warner to you from Him

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus there came not a messenger to those before them but they said: An enchanter or a madman

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Have they charged each other with this? Nay, they are an inordinate people

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So turn away from them, for thou art not to blame

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And remind, for reminding profits the believers

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I have not created the jinn and the men except that they should serve Me

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: I desire no sustenance from them, nor do I desire that they should feed Me

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah is the Bestower of sustenance, the Lord of Power, the Strong

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the lot of the wrongdoers is as was the lot of their companions, so let them not ask Me to hasten on

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Woe, then, to those who disbelieve because of that day of theirs which they are promised

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By the Mountain

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a Book writte

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On unfolded vellum

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the frequented House

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the elevated canopy

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the swollen sea

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The chastisement of thy Lord will surely come to pass -

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There is none to avert it

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when the heaven will be in a state of commotion

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the mountains will pass away, fleeing

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Woe on that day to the deniers

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who amuse themselves by vain talk

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when they are driven to hell-fire with violence

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is the Fire, which you gave the lie to

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it magic or do you not see

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Burn in it, then bear (it) patiently, or bear (it) not, it is the same to you. You are requited only for what you did

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The dutiful will be surely in Gardens and bliss

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Rejoicing because of what their Lord has given them; and their Lord saved them from the chastisement of the burning Fire

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Eat and drink with pleasure for what you did

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Reclining on thrones set in lines, and We shall join them to pure; beautiful ones

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who believe and whose offspring follow them in faith -- We unite with them their off-spring and We shall deprive them of naught of their work. Every man is pledged for what he does

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We shall aid them with fruit and flesh, as they desire

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They pass therein from one to another a cup, wherein is neither vanity, nor sin

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And round them go boys of theirs as if they were hidden pearls

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they will advance to each other, questioning -

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Saying: Surely we feared before on account of our families

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But Allah has been gracious to us and He has saved us from the chastisement of the hot wind

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We called upon Him before. Surely, He is the Benign, the Merciful

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So remind for, by the grace of thy Lord thou art no soothsayer, nor madman

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or they say: A poet -- we wait for him the evil accidents of time

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Wait, I too wait along with you

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or do their understandings bid them this? Or are they an inordinate people

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or say they: He has forged it. Nay, they have no faith

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then let them bring a saying like it, if they are truthful

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or were they created without a (creative) agency? Or are they the creators

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, they are sure of nothing

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or have they the treasures of thy Lord with them? Or have they absolute authority

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or have they the means by which they listen? Then let their listener bring a clear authority

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or has He daughters and you have sons

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or askest thou a reward from them so that they are over-burdened by a debt

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or possess they the unseen, so they write (it) down

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or do they intend a plot? But those who disbelieve will be the ensnared ones in the plot

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or have they a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah from what they set up (with Him)

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if they were to see a portion of the heaven coming down, they would say: Piled-up clouds

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Leave them then till they meet that day of theirs wherein they are smitten with punishment

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when their struggle will avail them naught, nor will they be helped

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely for those who do wrong there is a chastisement besides that; but most of them know not

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And wait patiently for the judgment of thy Lord, for surely thou art before Our eyes, and celebrate the praise of thy Lord, when thou risest

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in the night, give Him glory, too, and at the setting of the stars

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By the star when it sets

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your companion errs not, nor does he deviate

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor does he speak out of desire

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is naught but revelation that is revealed -

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: One Mighty in Power has taught him

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Lord of Strength. So he attained to perfection

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And he is in the highest part of the horizon

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he drew near, drew nearer yet

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he was the measure of two bows or closer still

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So He revealed to His servant what He revealed

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The heart was not untrue in seeing what he saw

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you then dispute with him as to what he saw

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly he saw Him in another descent

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: At the farthest lote-tree

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Near it is the Garden of Abode

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When that which covers covered the lote-tree

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The eye turned not aside, nor did it exceed the limit

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly he saw of the greatest signs of his Lord

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Have you then considered Lat and ‘Uzza

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And another, the third, Manat

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Are the males for you and for Him the females

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This indeed is an unjust division

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They are naught but names which you have named, you and your fathers -- Allah has sent no authority for them. They follow but conjecture and what (their) souls desire. And certainly the guidance has come to them from their Lord

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or shall man have what he wishes

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they said: What! A single mortal from among us! Shall we follow him? We shall then be in sure error and distress

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But for Allah is the Hereafter and the former (life)

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has the reminder been sent to him from among us? Nay, he is an insolent liar

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many angels are in the heavens, whose intercession avails naught except after Allah gives permission to whom He pleases and chooses

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely those who believe not in the Hereafter name the angels with female names

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they have no knowledge of it. They follow but conjecture, and surely conjecture avails naught against Truth

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So shun him who turns his back upon Our Reminder, and desires nothing but this world’s life

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is their goal of knowledge. Surely thy Lord knows best him who strays from His path and He knows best him who goes aright

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah’s is whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, that He may reward those who do evil for that which they do, and reward those who do good with goodness

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who avoid the great sins and the indecencies, but the passing idea -- surely thy Lord is Liberal in Forgiving. He knows best when He brings you forth from the earth and when you are embryos in the wombs of your mothers; so ascribe not purity to yourselves. He knows him best who guards against evil

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou him who turns back

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And gives a little, then withholds

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has he the knowledge of the unseen so that he can see

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or has he not been informed of what is in the scriptures of Moses

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And (of) Abraham who fulfilled (commandments)

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That no bearer of a burden bears another’s burden

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that man can have nothing but what he strives for

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that his striving will soon be seen

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he will be rewarded for it with the fullest reward

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that to thy Lord is the goal

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that He it is Who makes (men) laugh and makes (them) weep

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that He it is Who causes death and gives life

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or say they: We are a host allied together to help each other

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that He creates pairs, the male and the female

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Soon shall the hosts be routed, and they will show (their) backs

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: From the small life-germ when it is adapted

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that He his ordained the second bringing forth

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that He it is Who gives wealth and contentment

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that He is the Lord of Sirius

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that He destroyed the First ‘Ad

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Thamud, so He spared not

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the people of Noah before. Surely they were most iniquitous and inordinate

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the overthrown cities, He hurled down

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So there covered them that which covered

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which, then, of thy Lord’s benefits wilt thou dispute

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is a warner of the warners of old

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The near Event draw nigh

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There is none besides Allah to remove it

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Wonder you then at this announcement

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And do you laugh and not weep

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: While you sport

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So bow down in prostration before Allah and serve (Him)

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The hour drew nigh and the moon was rent asunder

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if they see a sign, they turn away and say: Strong enchantment

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they deny and follow their low desires; and every affair is settled

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly narratives have come to them, which should deter -

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Consummate wisdom -- but warnings avail not

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So turn away from them. On the day when the Inviter invites them to a hard task -

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Their eyes cast down, they will go forth from their graves as if they were scattered locusts

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Hastening to the Inviter. The disbelievers will say: This is a hard day

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Before them the people of Noah rejected -- they rejected Our servant and called (him) mad, and he was driven away

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he called upon his Lord: I am overcome, so do Thou help

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We opened the gates of heaven with water pouring down

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And made water to flow forth in the land in springs, so the water gathered together according to a measure already ordained

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We bore him on that which was made of planks and nails

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Floating on, before Our eyes -- a reward for him who was denied

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We left it as a sign, but is there any that will mind

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: How terrible was then My chastisement and My warning

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have made the Qur’an easy to remember, but is there any one who will mind

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: ‘Ad denied, so how terrible was My chastisement and My warning

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We sent on them a furious wind in a day of bitter ill-luck

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Tearing men away as if they were the trunks of palm-trees torn up

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: How terrible was then My chastisement and My warning

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have made the Qur’an easy to remember, but is there any one who will mind

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thamud rejected the warning

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To-morrow they will know who is the liar, the insolent one

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We are going to send the she-camel as a trial for them; so watch them and have patience

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And inform them that the water is shared between them; every share of the water shall be attended

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they called their companion, so he took (a sword) and hamstrung (her)

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: How (terrible) was then My chastisement and My warning

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We sent upon them a single cry, so they were like the dry fragments of trees, which the maker of an enclosure collects

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have made the Qur’an easy to remember, but is there any one who will mind

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The people of Lot treated the warning as a lie

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We sent upon them a stone-storm, except Lot’s followers; We saved them a little before daybreak -

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A favour from Us. Thus do We reward him who gives thanks

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly he warned them of Our violent seizure, but they disputed the warning

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly they endeavoured to turn him from his guests, but We blinded their eyes; so taste My chastisement and My warning

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly a lasting chastisement overtook them in the morning

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So taste My chastisement and My warning

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have made the Qur’an easy to remember, but is there any one who will mind

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly the warning came to Pharaoh’s people

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They rejected all Our signs, so We overtook them with the seizing of the Mighty, the Powerful

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Are your disbelievers better than these, or have you an immunity in the scriptures

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, the Hour is their promised time, and the Hour is most grievous and bitter

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the guilty are in error and distress

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when they are dragged into the Fire upon their faces: Taste the touch of hell

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have created everything according to a measure

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Our command is but once, as the twinkling of an eye

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We destroyed your fellows, but is there any one who will mind

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And everything they do is in the writings

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And everything small and great is written down

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the dutiful will be among Gardens and rivers

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In the seat of truth, with a most Powerful King

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Beneficen
