4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He created man

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Taught him expression

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The sun and the moon follow a reckoning

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the herbs and the trees adore (Him)

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the heaven, He raised it high, and He set up the measure

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That you may not exceed the measure

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And keep up the balance with equity, nor fall short in the measure

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the earth, He has set it for (His) creatures

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therein is fruit and palms having sheathed clusters

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the grain with (its) husk and fragrance

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He created man from dry clay like earthen vessels

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He created the jinn of a flame of fire

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Lord of the two Easts, and Lord of the two Wests

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He has made the two seas to flow freely -- they meet

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Between them is a barrier which they cannot pass

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There come forth from them both, pearls large and small

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And His are the ships reared aloft in the sea like mountains

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Every one on it passes awa

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And there endures for ever the person of thy Lord, the Lord of glory and honour

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: All those in the heavens and the earth ask of Him. Every moment He is in a state (of glory)

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Soon shall We apply Ourselves to you, O you two armies

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O assembly of jinn and men, if you are able to pass through the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass through. You cannot pass through but with authority

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The flames of fire and sparks of brass will be sent upon you, then you will not be able to defend yourselves

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when the heaven is rent asunder, so it becomes red like red hide

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So on that day neither man or jinni will be asked about his sin

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The guilty will be known by their masks, so they shall be seized by the forelocks and the feet

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is the hell which the guilty den

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Round about shall they go between it and hot, boiling water

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And for him who fears to stand before his Lord are two Gardens

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Full of varieties

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therein are two fountains flowing

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therein are pairs of every fruit

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Reclining on beds, whose inner coverings are of silk brocade. And the fruits of the two Gardens are within reach

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therein are those restraining their glances, whom no man nor jinni has touched before them

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As though they were rubies and pearls

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is the reward of goodness aught but goodness

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And besides those are two (other) Gardens

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Inclining into blackness

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therein are two springs gushing forth

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therein are fruits and palms and pomegranates

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therein are goodly beautiful ones

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Pure ones confined to pavilions

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Before them man has not touched them, nor jinni

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful carpets

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which then of the bounties of your Lord will you deny

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, the Lord of Glory and Honour

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When the Event comes to pass -

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: There is no belying its coming to pass -

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Abasing (some), exalting (others) -

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When the earth is shaken with a (severe) shaking

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the mountains are crumbled to pieces

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they are as scattered dust

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And you are three sorts

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So those on the right hand; how (happy) are those on the right-hand

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those on the left; how (wretched) are those on the left

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the foremost are the foremost -

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are drawn nigh (to Allah)

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In Gardens of blis

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A multitude from among the first

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a few from among those of later times

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On thrones inwrought

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Reclining on them, facing each other

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Round about them will go youths never altering in age

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: With goblets and ewers, and a cup of pure drink -

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They are not affected with headache thereby, nor are they intoxicated

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And fruits that they choose

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And flesh of fowl that they desire

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And pure, beautiful ones

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Like to hidden pearls

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A reward for what they did

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They hear therein no vain or sinful talk -

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But only the saying, Peace! Peace

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those on the right hand; how (happy) are those on the right hand

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Amid thornless lote-trees

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And clustered banana-trees

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And extensive shade

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And water gushing

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And abundant fruit

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Neither intercepted, nor forbidden

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And exalted couches

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have created them a (new) creation

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So We have made them virgins

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Loving, equals in age

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For those on the right hand

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A multitude from among the first

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And a multitude from among those of later times

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those on the left hand; how (wretched) are those on the left hand

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In hot wind and boiling water

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And shadow of black smoke

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Neither cool nor refreshing

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely they lived before that in ease

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they persisted in the great violation

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they used to say: When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be rised

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or our fathers of yore

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: The ancients and those of later time

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Will surely be gathered together for the appointed hour of a known day

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then shall you, O you who err and deny

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: East of the tree of Zaqqum

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And fill (your) bellies with it

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then drink after it of boiling water

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And drink as drinks the thirsty camel

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: This is their entertainment on the day of Requital

57.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We have created you, why do you not then accept

58.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See you that which you emit

59.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it you that create it or are We the Creators

60.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We have ordained death among you and We are not to be overcome

61.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That We may change your state and make you grow into what you know not

62.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly you know the first growth, why do you not then mind

63.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See you what you sow

64.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it you that cause it to grow, or are We the Causer of growth

65.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If We pleased, We would make it chaff, then would you lament

66.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely we are burdened with debt

67.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, we are deprived

68.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See you the water which you drink

69.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you bring it down from the clouds, or are We the Bringer

70.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If We pleased, We could make it saltish; why give you not thanks

71.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See you the fire which you kindle

72.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it you that produce the trees for it, or are We the Producer

73.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We have made it a reminder and an advantage for the wayfarers of the desert

74.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So glorify the name of thy Lord, the Incomparably Great

75.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But nay, I swear by revelation of portions (of the Qur’an)! -

76.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is a great oath indeed, if you knew -

77.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely it is a bounteous Qur’an

78.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In a book that is protected

79.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which none touches save the purified ones

80.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A revelation from the Lord of the worlds

81.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is it this announcement that you disdain

82.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And make your denial your means of subsistence

83.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Why is it not then that when it comes up to the throat

84.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And you at that time look on -

85.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We are nearer to it than you, but you see not -

86.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Why then, if you are not held under authority

87.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you not send it back, if you are truthful

88.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then if he is one of those drawn nigh (to Allah)

89.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then happiness and bounty and a Garden of bliss

90.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if he is one of those on the right hand

91.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then peace to thee from those on the right hand

92.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if he is one of the rejectors, the erring ones

93.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He has an entertainment of boiling water

94.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And burning in hell

95.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this is a certain truth

96.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So glorify the name of thy Lord, the Incomparably Great

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and the earth declares the glory of Allah, and He is the Mighty, the Wise

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death; and He is Possessor of power over all things

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He is the First and the Last and the Manifest and the Hidden, and He is Knower of all things

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six periods, and He is established on the Throne of Power. He knows that which goes down into the earth and that which comes forth out of it, and that which comes down from heaven and that which goes up to it. And He is with you wherever you are. And Allah is Seer of what you do

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; and to Allah are (all) affairs returned

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He causes the night to pass into the day, and causes the day to pass into the night. And He is Knower of what is in the hearts

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend of that whereof He has made you heirs. So those of you who believe and spend -- for them is a great reward

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And what reason have you that you believe not in Allah? And the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and He has indeed accepted your covenant, if you are believers

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who sends down clear messages to His servant, that he may bring you forth from darkness into light. And surely Allah is Kind, Merciful to you

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And what reason have you that you spend not in Allah’s way? And Allah’s is the inheritance of the heavens and the earth. Those of you who spent before the Victory and fought are not on a level (with others). They are greater in rank than those who spent and fought afterwards. And Allah has promised good to all. And Allah is Aware of what you do

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who is he that will offer to Allah a good gift, so He will double it for him, and he will have a generous reward

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On that day thou wilt see the faithful men and the faithful women, their light gleaming before them and on their right hand. Good news for you this day! -- Gardens wherein rivers flow, to abide therein! That is the grand achievement

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when the hypocrites, men and women, will say to those who believe: Wait for us, that we may borrow from your light. It will be said: Turn back and seek a light. Then a wall, with a door in it, will be raised between them. Within it shall be mercy, and outside of its chastisement

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will cry out to them: Were we not with you? They will say: Yea, but you caused yourselves to fall into temptation, and you waited and doubted, and vain desires deceived you, till the threatened punishment of Allah came, and the arch-deceiver deceived you about Allah

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So this day no ransom will be accepted from you, nor from those who disbelieved. Your abode is the Fire; it is your patron and evil is the resort

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has not the time yet come for the believers that their hearts should be humble for the remembrance of Allah and the Truth that is revealed, and (that) they should not be like those who were given the Book before, but time was prolonged for them, so their hearts hardened. And most of them are transgressors

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Know that Allah gives life to the earth after its death. Indeed, We have made the signs clear for you that you may understand

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The men who give in charity and the women who give in charity and set apart for Allah a goodly portion, it will be doubled for them, and their’s is a generous reward

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers, they are the truthful and the faithful ones with their Lord. They have their reward and their light. And those who disbelieve and reject Our messages, they are the inmates of hell

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Know that this world’s life is only sport and play and gaiety and boasting among yourselves and a vying in the multiplication of wealth and children. It is as rain, whose causing the vegetation to grow pleases the husbandmen, then it withers away so that thou seest it turning yellow, then it becomes chaff. And in the Hereafter is a severe chastisement, and (also) forgiveness from Allah and (His) pleasure. And this world’s life is naught but a source of vanity

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Vie one with another for forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden the extensiveness of which is as the extensiveness of the heaven and the earth -- it is prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the grace of Allah; He gives it to whom He pleases. And Allah is the Lord of mighty grace

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: No disaster befalls in the earth, or in yourselves, but it is in a book before We bring it into existence -- surely that is easy to Allah -

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So that you grieve not for what has escaped you, nor exult in that which He has given you. And Allah loves not any arrogant boaster

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Such as are niggardly and enjoin niggardliness on men. And whoever turns back, then surely Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praised

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly We sent Our messengers with clear arguments, and sent down with them the Book and the measure, that men may conduct themselves with equity. And We sent down iron, wherein is great violence and advantages to men, and that Allah may know who helps Him and His messengers, unseen. Surely Allah is Strong, Might

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We sent Noah and Abraham, and We gave prophethood and the Book to their offspring; so among them is he who goes aright, but most of them are transgressors

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then We made Our messengers to follow in their footsteps, and We made Jesus son of Mary to follow, and We gave him the Gospel. And We put compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. And (as for) monkery they innovated it -- We did not prescribe it to them -- only to seek Allah’s pleasure, but they did not observe it with its due observance. So We gave those of them who believed their reward, but most of them are transgressors

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, keep your duty to Allah and believe in His Messenger -- He will give you two portions of His mercy, and give you a light in which you shall walk, and forgive you. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful -

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That the People of the book may know that they control naught of the grace of Allah, and that grace is in Allah’s hand. He gives it to whom He pleases. And Allah is the Lord of mighty grace

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah indeed has heard the plea of her who pleads with thee about her husband and complains to Allah; and Allah hears the contentions of both of you. Surely Allah is Hearing, Seeing

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those of you who put away their wives by calling them their mothers -- they are not their mothers. None are their mothers save those who give them birth, and they utter indeed a hateful word and a lie. And surely Allah is Pardoning, Forgiving

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who put away their wives by calling them their mothers, then go back on that which they said, must free a captive before they touch one another. To this you are exhorted; and Allah is Aware of what you do

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But he who has not the means, should fast for two months successively before they touch one another, and he who is unable to do so should feed sixty needy ones. That is in order that you may have faith in Allah and His Messenger. And these are Allah’s limits. And for the disbelievers is a painful chastisement

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be humbled as those before them were humbled; and indeed We have revealed clear messages. And for the disbelievers is an abasing chastisement

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when Allah will raise them all together, then inform them of what they did. Allah records it, while they forget it. And Allah is Witness over all things

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth? There is no secret counsel between three but He is the fourth of them, nor between five but He is the sixth of them, nor between less than that nor more but He is with them wheresoever they are; then He will inform them of what they did on the day of Resurrection. Surely Allah is Knower of all things

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seest thou not those who are forbidden secret counsels, then they return to that which they are forbidden, and hold secret counsels for sin and revolt and disobedience to the Messenger. And when they come to thee they greet thee with a greeting with which Allah greets thee not, and say within themselves; Why does not Allah punish us for what we say? Hell is enough for them; they will burn in it, and evil is the resort

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, when you confer together in private, give not to each other counsel of sin and revolt and disobedience to the Messenger, but give to each other counsel of goodness and observance of duty. And keep your duty to Allah, to Whom you will be gathered together

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Secret counsels are only of the devil that he may cause to grieve those who believe, and he can hurt them naught except with Allah’s permission. And on Allah let the believers rely

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, when it is said to you, Make room in assemblies, make room. Allah will give you ample. And when it is said, Rise up, rise up. Allah will exalt those of you who believe, and those who are given knowledge, to high ranks. And Allah is Aware of what you do

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, when you consult the Messenger, offer something in charity before your consultation. That is better for you and purer. But if you have not (the means), then surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you fear that you will not (be able to) give in charity before your consultation? So when you do it not, and Allah has turned to you (mercifully), keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Aware of what you do

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Hast thou not seen those who take for friends a people with whom Allah is wroth? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear falsely, while they know

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah has prepared for them a severe chastisement. Evil indeed is that which they do

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They take shelter under their oaths, so they turn (men) from Allah’s way; for them is an abasing chastisement

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Of no avail against Allah, will be to them their wealth or their children. They are the companions of the Fire; therein they will abide

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when Allah will raise them all up, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and they think that they have some (excuse). Now surely they are the liars

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The devil has gained the mastery over them, so he has made them forget the remembrance of Allah. They are the devil’s party. Now surely the devil’s party are the losers

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, they shall be among the most abased

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah has written down: I shall certainly prevail, I and My messengers. Surely Allah is Strong, Mighty

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thou wilt not find a people who believe in Allah and the latter day loving those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even though they be their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their kinsfolk. These are they into whose hearts He has impressed faith, and strengthened them with a Spirit from Himself, and He will cause them to enter Gardens wherein flow rivers, abiding therein. Allah is well-pleased with them and they are well-pleased with Him. These are Allah’s party. Now surely it is Allah’s party who are the successful

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah; and He is the Mighty, the Wise

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who caused those who disbelieved of the People of the Book to go forth from their homes at the first banishment. You deemed not that they would go forth, while they thought that their fortresses would defend them against Allah. But Allah came to them from place they expected not and cast terror into their hearts -- they demolished their houses with their own hands and the hands of the believers. So take a lesson, O you who have eyes

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And had it not been that Allah had decreed for them the exile, He would certainly have chastised them in this world; and for them in the Hereafter is the chastisement of Fire

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is because they were opposed to Allah and His Messenger, and whoever is opposed to Allah, surely Allah is Severe in retribution

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever palm-tree you cut down or leave it standing upon its roots, it is by Allah’s permission, and that He may abase the transgressors

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whatever Allah restored to His Messenger from them, you did not press forward against it any horse or any riding-camel, but Allah gives authority to His messengers against whom He pleases. And Allah is Possessor of power over all things

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever Allah restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns, it is for Allah and for the Messenger, and for the near of kin and the orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, so that it be not taken by turns by the rich among you. And whatever the Messenger gives you, accept it, and whatever he forbids you, abstain (therefrom); and keep your duty to Allah. Surely Allah is Severe in retribution

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (It is) for the poor who fled, who were driven from their homes and their possessions, seeking grace of Allah and (His) pleasure, and helping Allah and His Messenger. These it is that are the truthful

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who made their abode in the City and in faith before them love those who have fled to them, and find in their hearts no need of what they are given, and prefer (them) before themselves, though poverty may afflict them. And whoever is saved from the niggardliness of his soul, these it is that are the successful

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who come after them say: Our Lord, forgive us and our brethren who had precedence of us in faith, and leave no spite in our hearts towards those who believe. Our Lord surely Thou art Kind, Merciful

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Hast thou not seen the hypocrites? They say to their brethren who disbelieve from among the People of the book: If you are expelled, we certainly will go forth with you, and we will never obey any one concerning you; and if you are fought against, we will certainly help you. And Allah bears witness that they surely are liars

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If they are expelled, they will not go forth with them, and if they are fought against, they will not help them; and even if they help them, they will certainly turn (their) backs; then they shall not be helped

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your fear in their hearts is indeed greater than Allah’s. That is because they are a people who understand not

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They will not fight against you in a body save in fortified towns or from behind walls. Their fighting between them is severe. Thou wouldst think them united, but their hearts are divided. That is because they are a people who have no sense

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Like those before them shortly: they tasted the evil consequences of their conduct, and for them is a painful chastisement

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Like the devil when he says to man: Disbelieve. But when he disbelieves, he says: I am free of thee: surely I fear Allah, the Lord of the worlds

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So the end of both of them is that they are both in the Fire to abide therein. And that is the reward of the wrongdoers

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, keep your duty to Allah, and let every soul consider that which it sends forth for the morrow, and keep your duty to Allah. Surely Allah is Aware of what you do

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And be not like those who forget Allah, so He makes them forget their own souls. These are the transgressors

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Not alike are the companions of the Fire and the owners of the Garden. The owners of the Garden are the achievers

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Had We sent down this Qur’an on a mountain, thou wouldst certainly have seen it falling down, splitting asunder because of the fear of Allah. And We set forth these parables to men that they may reflect

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He is Allah besides Whom there is no God: The Knower of the unseen and the seen; He is the Beneficent, the Merciful

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He is Allah, besides Whom there is no God; the King, the Holy, the Author of Peace, the Granter of Security, Guardian over all, the Mighty, the Supreme, the Possessor of greatness. Glory be to Allah from that which they set up (with Him)

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He is Allah, the Creator, the Maker, the Fashioner: His are the most beautiful names. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth declares His glory; and He is the Mighty, the Wise

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, take not My enemy and your enemy for friends. Would you offer them love, while they deny the Truth that has come to you, driving out the Messenger and yourselves because you believe in Allah, your Lord? If you have come forth to strive in My way and to seek My pleasure, would you love them in secret? And I know what you conceal and what you manifest. And whoever of you does this, he indeed strays from the straight path

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If they overcome you, they will be your enemies, and will stretch forth their hands and their tongues towards you with evil, and they desire that you may disbelieve

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your relationships and your children would not profit you, on the day of Resurrection -- He will decide between you. And Allah is Seer of what you do

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Indeed there is for you a good example in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people: We are clear of you and of that which you serve besides Allah. We disbelieve in you and there has arisen enmity and hatred between us and you forever until you believe in Allah alone -- except Abraham’s saying to his sire: I would ask forgiveness for thee, and I control naught for thee from Allah. Our Lord, on Thee do we rely, and to Thee do we turn, and to Thee is the eventual coming

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Our Lord, make us not a trial for those who disbelieve, and forgive us, our Lord. Surely Thou art the Mighty, the Wise

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Certainly there is for you in them a good example, for him who hopes for Allah and the Last Day. And whoever turns away, surely Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praised

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It may be that Allah will bring about friendship between you and those of them whom you hold as enemies. And Allah is Powerful; and Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah forbids you not respecting those who fight you not for religion, nor drive you forth from your homes, that you show them kindness and deal with them justly. Surely Allah loves the doers of justice

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah forbids you only respecting those who fight you for religion, and drive you forth from your homes and help (others) in your expulsion, that you make friends of them; and whoever makes friends of them, these are the wrongdoers

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, when believing women come to you fleeing, examine them. Allah knows best their faith. Then if you know them to be believers send them not back to the disbelievers. Neither are these (women) lawful for them, nor are those (men) lawful for them. And give them what they have spent; and there is no blame on you in marrying them, when you give them their dowries. And hold not to the ties of marriage of disbelieving women, and ask for what you have spent, and let them ask for what they have spent. That is Allah’s judgment; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing, Wise

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if any part (of the dowries) of your wives has passed away from you to the disbelievers, then your turn comes, give to those whose wives have gone away the like of what they have spent, and keep your duty to Allah in Whom you believe

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, when believing women come to thee giving thee a pledge that they will not associate aught with Allah, and will not steal, nor commit adultery; nor kill their children, nor bring a calumny which they have forged of themselves, nor disobey thee in what is good, accept their pledge, and ask forgiveness for them from Allah. Surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, take not for friends people with whom Allah is wroth- they indeed despair of the Hereafter, as the disbelievers despair of those in the graves

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah; and He is the Mighty, the Wise

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, why say you that which you do not

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is most hateful in the sight of Allah that you say that which you do not

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely Allah loves those who fight in His way in ranks, as if they were a solid wall

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Moses said to his people: O my people, why do you malign me, when you know that I am Allah’s messenger to you? But when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviate. And Allah guides not the transgressing people

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when Jesus, son of Mary, said: O Children of Israel, surely I am the messenger of Allah to you, verifying that which is before me of the Torah and giving the good news of a Messenger who will come after me, his name being Ahmad. But when he came to them with clear argument, they said: This is clear enchantment

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And who is more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah and he is invited to Islam. And Allah guides not the unjust people

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They desire to put out the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will perfect His light, though the disbelievers may be averse

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the true religion, that He may make it overcome the religions, all of them, though the polytheists may be averse

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, shall I lead you to a merchandise which will deliver you from a painful chastisement

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: You should believe in Allah and His Messenger, and strive hard in Allah’s way with your wealth and your lives. That is better for you, did you but know

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He will forgive you your sins and cause you to enter Gardens wherein rivers flow, and goodly dwellings in Gardens of perpetuity -- that is the mighty achievement -

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And yet another (blessing) that you love: help from Allah and a victory near at hand; and give good news to the believers

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, be helpers (in the cause) of Allah, as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples: Who are my helpers in the cause of Allah? The disciples said: We are the helpers (in the cause) of Allah. So a party of the Children of Israel believed and another party disbelieved; then We aided those who believed against their enemy, and they became predominant

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah, the King, the Holy, the Mighty, the Wise

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who raised among the illiterates a Messenger from among themselves, who recites to them His messages and purifies them, and teaches them the Book and the Wisdom -- though they were before certainly in manifest error -

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And others from among them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Mighty, the Wise

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is Allah’s grace; He grants it to whom He pleases. And Allah is the Lord of mighty grace

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The likeness of those who were charged with the Torah, then they observed it not, is as the likeness of the ass carrying books. Evil is the likeness of the people who reject the messages of Allah. And Allah guides not the iniquitous people

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: O you who are Jews, if you think that you are the favourites of Allah to the exclusion of other people, then invoke death, if you are truthful

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But they will never invoke it because of what their hands have sent before. And Allah is Knower of the wrongdoers

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: The death from which you flee, that will surely overtake you; then you will be sent back to the Knower of the unseen and the seen, so He will inform you of that which you did

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe when the call is sounded for prayer on Friday, hasten to the remembrance of Allah and leave off traffic. That is better for you, if you know

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But when the prayer is ended, disperse abroad in the land and seek of Allah’s grace, and remember Allah much, that you may be successful

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when they see merchandise or sport, they break away to it, and leave thee standing. Say: What is with Allah is better than sport and merchandise. And Allah is the Best of Providers

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When the hypocrites come to thee, they say: We bear witness that thou art indeed Allah’s Messenger. And Allah knows thou art indeed His Messenger. And Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are surely liars

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They take shelter under their oaths, thus turning (men) from Allah’s way. Surely evil is that which they do

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is because they believed, then disbelieved; thus their hearts are sealed, so they understand not

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when thou seest them, their persons please thee; and if they speak, thou listenest to their speech. They are like pieces of wood, clad with garments. They think every cry to be against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them! How they are turned back

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when it is said to them: Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you, they turn away their heads and thou seest them hindering (others), and they are big with pride

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is alike to them whether thou ask forgiveness for them or ask not forgiveness for them -- Allah will never forgive them. Surely Allah guides not the transgressing people

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They it is who say: Spend not on those who are with the Messenger of Allah that they may disperse. And Allah’s are the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites understand not

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They say: If we return to Madinah, the mightier will surely drive out the meaner therefrom. And might belongs to Allah and His Messenger and the believers, but the hypocrites know not

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, let not your wealth nor your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah; and whoever does that, these are the losers

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And spend our of that which We have given you before death comes to one of you, and he says: My Lord, why didst Thou not respire me to a near term, so that I should have given alms and been of the doers of good deeds

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But Allah respites not a soul, when its term comes. And Allah is Aware of what you do

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah. His is the kingdom, and His the praise; and He is Possessor of power over all things

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who created you, but one of you is a disbeliever and one of you is a believer. And Allah is Seer of what you do

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He created the heavens and the earth with truth, and He shaped you, then made goodly your shapes; and to Him is the resort

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He knows what is in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what you hide and what you manifest. And Allah is Knower of what is in the hearts

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Has there not come to you the story of those who disbelieved before, then tasted the evil consequences of their conduct, and they had a painful chastisement

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is because there came to them their messengers with clear arguments, but they said: Shall mortals guide us? So they disbelieved and turned away, and Allah is above all need. And Allah is Self-Sufficient; Praised

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who disbelieve think that they will not be raised. Say: Aye, by my Lord! you will certainly be raised; then you will certainly be informed of what you did. And that is easy to Allah

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and the light which we have revealed. And Allah is Aware of what you do

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when He will gather you for the day of Gathering, that is the day of the Manifestation of losses. And whoever believes in Allah and does good, he will remove from him his evil and cause him to enter Gardens wherein rivers flow, to abide therein for ever. That is the great achievement

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve and reject Our messages, they are the companions of the Fire, abiding therein; and evil is the resort

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: No calamity befalls but by Allah’s permission. And whoever believes in Allah, He guides his heart. And Allah is Knower of all things

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away, the duty of Our Messenger is only to deliver (the message) clearly

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah, there is no God but He. And on Allah let the believers rely

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, surely of your wives and your children there are enemies to you, so beware of them. And if you pardon and forbear and forgive, surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Your wealth and your children are only a trial, and Allah -- with Him is a great reward

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So keep your duty to Allah as much as you can, and hear and obey and spend; it is better for your souls. And whoever is saved from the greediness of his soul, these it is that are the successful

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If you set apart for Allah a goodly portion, He will double it for you and forgive you. And Allah is the multiplier (of rewards), Forbearing

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty, the Wise

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, when you divorce women, divorce them for their prescribed period, and calculate the period; and keep your duty to Allah, your Lord. Turn them not out of their houses -- nor should they themselves go forth -- unless they commit an open indecency. And these are the limits of Allah. And whoever goes beyond the limits of Allah, he indeed wrongs his own soul. Thou knowest not that Allah may after that bring about an event

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when they have reached their prescribed time, retain them with kindness or dismiss them with kindness, and call to witness two just ones from among you, and give upright testimony for Allah. With that is admonished he who believes in Allah and the Latter day. And whoever keeps his duty to Allah, He ordains a way out for him

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And gives him sustenance from whence he imagines not. And whoever trusts in Allah, He is sufficient for him. Surely Allah attains His purpose. Allah indeed has appointed a measure for everything

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those of your women who despair of menstruation, if you have a doubt, their prescribed time is three months, and of those, too, who have not had their courses. And the pregnant women, their prescribed time is that they lay down their burden. And whoever keeps his duty to Allah, He makes his affair easy for him

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That is the command of Allah, which He has revealed to you. And whoever keeps his duty to Allah, He will remove from him his evils and give him a big reward

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Lodge them where you live according to your means, and injure them not to straiten them. And if they are pregnant, spend on them until they lay down their burden. Then if they suckle for you, give them their recompense, and enjoin one another to do good; and if you disagree, another will suckle for him

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Let him who has abundance spend out of his abundance, and whoever has his means of subsistence straitened to him, let him spend out of that which Allah has given him. Allah lays not on any soul a burden beyond that which He has given it. Allah brings about ease after difficulty

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And how many a town which rebelled against the commandment of its Lord and His messengers, so We called it to severe account and We chastised it with a stern chastisement

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So it tasted the evil consequences of its conduct, and the end of its affair was perdition

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah has prepared for them severe chastisement, so keep your duty to Allah, O men of understanding, who believe. Allah has indeed sent down to you a Reminder -

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A Messenger who recites to you the clear messages of Allah so that he may bring forth those who believe and do good deeds from darkness into light. And whoever believes in Allah and does good deeds, He will cause him to enter Gardens wherein rivers flow, to abide therein for ever. Allah has indeed given him a goodly sustenance

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah is He who created seven heavens, and of the earth the like thereof. The command descends among them, that you may know that Allah is Possessor of power over all things, and that Allah encompasses all things in (His) knowledge

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, why dost thou forbid (thyself) that which Allah has made lawful for thee? Seekest thou to please thy wives? And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah indeed has sanctioned for you the expiation of your oaths; and Allah is your Patron, and He is the Knowing, the Wise

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when the Prophet confided an information to one of his wives -- but when she informed (others) of it, and Allah informed him of it, he made known part of it and passed over part. So when he told her of it, she said: Who informed thee of this? He said: The Knowing, the One Aware, informed me

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: If you both turn to Allah, then indeed your hearts are inclined (to this); and if you back up one another against him, then surely Allah is his Patron, and Gabriel and the righteous believers, and the angels after that are the aiders

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Maybe, his Lord, if he divorce you, will give him in your place wives better than you, submissive, faithful, obedient, penitent, adorers, fasters, widows, and virgins

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, save yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is men and stones; over it are angels, stern and strong. They do not disobey Allah in that which He commands them, but do as they are commanded

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who disbelieve, make no excuses this day. You are rewarded only as you did

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O you who believe, turn to Allah with sincere repentance. It may be your Lord will remove from you your evil and cause you enter Gardens wherein flow rivers, on the day on which Allah will not abase the Prophet and those who believe with him. Their light will gleam before them and on their right hands -- they will say: Our Lord, make perfect for us our light, and grant us protection; surely Thou art Possessor of power over all things

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and remain firm against them, and their abode is hell; and evil is the resort

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Allah sets forth an example for those who disbelieve -- the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were both under two of Our righteous servants, but they acted treacherously towards them, so they availed them naught against Allah, and it was said: Enter the Fire with those who enter

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah sets forth an example for those who believe -- the wife of Pharaoh, when she said: My Lord, build for me a house with Thee in the Garden and deliver me from Pharaoh and his work, and deliver me from the iniquitous people

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Mary, the daughter of Amran, who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into him Our inspiration and she accepted, the truth of the words of her Lord and His Books, and she was of the obedient ones

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Blessed is He in Whose hand is the Kingdom, and He is Possessor of power over all things

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who created death and life that He might try you -- which of you is best in deeds. And He is the Mighty, the Forgiving

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who created the seven heavens alike. Thou seest no incongruity in the creation of the Beneficent. Then look again: Canst thou see any disorder

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then turn the eye again and again -- thy look will return to thee confused, while it is fatigued

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly We have adorned this lower heaven with lamps and We make them means of conjectures for the devils, and We have prepared for them the chastisement of burning

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord is the chastisement of hell, and evil is the resort

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When they are cast therein, they will hear a loud moaning of it as it heaves

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Almost bursting for fury. Whenever a group is cast into it, its keepers ask them: Did not a warner come to you

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They say: Yea, indeed a warner came to us, but we denied and said: Allah has revealed nothing; you are only in great error

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: Had we but listened or pondered, we should not have been among the inmates of the burning Fire

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thus they will confess their sins; so far (from good) are the inmates of the burning Fire

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Those who fear their Lord in secret, for them is surely forgiveness and a great reward

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And conceal your word or manifest it, truly He is Knower of that which is in the hearts

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Does He not know Who created? And He is the Knower of subtilties, the Aware

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He it is Who made the earth subservient to you, so go about in the spacious sides thereof, and eat of His sustenance. And to Him is the rising (after death)

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven will not make the earth to swallow you up? Then lo! it will shake

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or do you feel secure that He Who is in the Heaven will not send on you a violent wind? Then shall you know how (truthful) was My warning

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And certainly those before them denied, then how (terrible) was My disapproval

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Do they not see the birds above them spreading and contracting (their wings)? Naught upholds them save the Beneficent. Surely He is Seer of all things

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or who is it that will be a host for you to help you against the Beneficent? The disbelievers are in naught but delusion

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or who is it that will give you sustenance, if He should withhold His sustenance? Nay, they persist in disdain and aversion

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is, then, he who goes prone upon his face better guided or he who walks upright on a straight path

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: He it is Who brought you into being and made for you ears and eyes and hearts. Little thanks it is you give

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: He it is Who multiplies you in the earth and to Him you will be gathered

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: When will this threat be (executed), if you are truthful

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: The knowledge is with Allah only, and I am only a plain warner

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But when they see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve will be grieved, and it will be said: This is that which you used to call for

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Have you considered if Allah should destroy me and those with me -- rather He will have mercy on us -- yet who will protect the disbelievers from a painful chastisement

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: He is the Beneficent -- we believe in Him and on Him do we rely. So you will come to know who it is that is in clear error

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: Have you considered if your water should subside, who is it then that will bring you flowing water

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (By) the inkstand and the pen and that which they write

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By the grace of thy Lord thou art not mad

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thine is a reward never to be cut off

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely thou hast sublime morals

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So thou wilt see, and they (too) will see

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which of you is mad

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely thy Lord knows best who is erring from His way, and He knows best those who go aright

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So obey not the rejectors

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They wish that thou shouldst be pliant, so they (too) would be pliant

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And obey not any mean swearer

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Defamer, going about with slander

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Hinderer of good, outstepping the limits, sinful

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Ignoble, besides all that, notoriously mischievous -

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Because he possess wealth and sons

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: When Our messages are recited to him, he says: Stories of those of yore

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We shall brand him on the snout

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We shall try them as We tried the owners of the garden, when they swore to pluck its fruits in the morning

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And would not set aside a portion (for the poor)

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But a visitation from thy Lord came on it, while they slept

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So it became as black, barren land -

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then they called out one to another in the morning

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Saying: Go early to your tilth, if you would pluck (the fruit)

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So they went, while they said one to another in low tones

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: No poor man shall enter it to-day to you -

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in the morning they went, having the power to prevent

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But when they saw it, they said: Surely we are in error

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, we are made to suffer privation

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The best of them said: Said I not to you, Why do you not glorify (Allah)

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: They said: Glory be to our Lord! surely we were unjust

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then some of them advanced against others, blaming each other

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Said they: O woe to us! Surely we were inordinate -

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Maybe, our Lord will give us instead one better than it -- surely to our Lord we make petition

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Such is the chastisement. And certainly the chastisement of the Hereafter is greater, did they but know

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the dutiful have with their Lord Gardens of bliss

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Shall We then make those who submit as the guilty

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is the matter with you? How do you judge

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or have you a book wherein you rea

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That you shall surely have therein what you choose

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or have you covenants from us on oath, extending to the day of Resurrection, that yours is surely what you judge

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Ask them which of them will vouch for that

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or have they associate-gods? Then let them bring their associates, if they are truthful

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when thee is a severe affliction, and they are called upon to prostrate themselves, but they are not able -

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Their looks cast down, abasement will cover them. And they were indeed called upon to prostrate themselves, while yet they were safe

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So leave Me alone with him who rejects this announcement. We shall overtake them by degrees, from whence they know not

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I bear with them, surely My plan is firm

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or dost thou ask from them a reward, so that they are burdened with debt

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or is the unseen with them so that they write (it) down

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So wait patiently for the judgment of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the fish, when he cried while he was in distress

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Had not favour from his Lord reached him, he would certainly have been cast down on naked ground, while he was blamed

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then his Lord chose him, and He made him of the righteous

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who disbelieve would almost smite thee with their eyes when they hear the Reminder, and they say: Surely he is mad

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is naught but a Reminder for the nations

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The sure Truth

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is the sure Truth

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And what would make thee realize what the sure Truth is

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thamud and ‘Ad called the calamity a lie

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the severe punishment

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as for ‘Ad, they were destroyed by a roaring, violent wind

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which He made to prevail against them for seven nights and eight days continuously, so that thou mightest have seen the people therein prostrate as if they were trunks of hollow palm-trees

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So canst thou see a remnant of them

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Pharaoh and those before him and the overthrown cities wrought evil

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so he punished them with a vehement punishment

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We carried you in the ship, when the water rose high

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That We might make it a reminder for you, and that the retaining ear might retain it

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So when the trumpet is blown with a single blast

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the earth and the mountains are borne away and crushed with one crash -

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On that day will the Event come to pass

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the heaven will be cleft asunder; so that day it will be frail

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the angels will be on its sides. And above them eight will bear that day thy Lord’s Throne of Power

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On that day you will be exposed to view -- no secret of yours will remain hidden

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then as for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say: Lo! Read my book

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely I knew that I should meet my account

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So he will be in a life of bliss

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In a lofty Garden

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Its fruits are near

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Eat and drink pleasantly for that which you sent on before in bygone days

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as for him who is given his book in his left hand -- he will say: O would that my book had not been given to me

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And I had not known what my account was

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O would that (death) had made an end (of me)

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My wealth has not availed me

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My authority has gone from me

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Seize him, then fetter him

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then cast him into the burning Fire

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then insert him in a chain the length of which is seventy cubits

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely he believed not in Allah, the Great

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor did he urge the feeding of the poor

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Therefore he has not here this day a true friend

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor any food except refuse

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Which none but the wrongdoers eat

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But nay! I swear by that which you see

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And that which you see not

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely, it is the word of an honoured Messenger

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is not the word of a poet. Little is it that you believe

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nor the word of a soothsayer. Little is it that you mind

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if he had fabricated against Us certain sayings

45.Maulana Muhammad Ali: We would certainly have seized him by the right hand

46.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then cut off his heart’s vein

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And not one of you could have withheld Us from him

48.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely it is a Reminder for the dutiful

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We certainly know that some of you are rejectors

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And it is indeed a (source of) grief to the disbelievers

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And surely it is the certain Truth

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So glorify the name of thy Lord, the Incomparably Great

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A questioner asks about the chastisement to befal

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The disbelievers -- there is none to avert it -

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: From Allah, Lord of the ways of Ascent

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To Him ascend the angels and the Spirit in a day the measure of which is fifty thousand years

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So be patient with a goodly patience

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely they see it far off

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We see it nigh

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when the heaven is as molten brass

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the mountains are as wool

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And no friend will ask of friend

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Though) they are made to see them. The guilty one would fain redeem himself from the chastisement of that day by his children

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And his wife and his brother

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And his kin that gave him shelter

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And all that are in the earth -- then deliver him -

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By no means! Surely it is a flaming Fire

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Plucking out the extremities -

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: It shall claim him who retreats and turns his back

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And hoards then withholds

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely man is created impatient -

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Fretful when evil afflicts him

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And niggardly when good befalls him -

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except those who pray

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Who are constant at their prayer

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And in whose wealth there is a known righ

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For the beggar and the destitute

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who accept the truth of the day of Judgment

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who are fearful of the chastisement of their Lord -

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely the chastisement of their Lord is (a thing) not to be felt secure from -

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who restrain their sexual passions

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except in the presence of their mates or those whom their right hands possess -- for such surely are not to be blamed

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But he who seeks to go beyond this, these are the transgressors

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who are faithful to their trusts and their covenant

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who are upright in their testimonies

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And those who keep a guard on their prayer

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: These are in Gardens, honoured

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But what is the matter with those who disbelieve, that they hasten on to thee

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the right hand and on the left, in sundry parties

38.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Does every man of them desire to be admitted to the Garden of bliss

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By no means! Surely We have created them for what they know

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But nay! I swear by the Lord of the Eastern lands and the Western lands! that We are certainly Powerfu

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To bring in their place (others) better than them, and We shall not be overcome

42.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So leave them alone to plunge in vain talk and to sport, until they come face to face with that day of theirs which they are promised -

43.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The day when they come forth from the graves in haste, as hastening on to a goal

44.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Their eyes cast down, disgrace covering them. Such is the day which they are promised

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We sent Noah to his people, saying: Warn thy people before there come to them a painful chastisement

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: O my people, surely I am a plain warner to you

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That you should serve Allah and keep your duty to Him and obey me -

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He will forgive you some of your sins and grant you respite to an appointed term. Surely the term of Allah, when it comes, is not postponed. Did you but know

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He said: My Lord, I have called my people night and day

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But my call has only made them flee the more

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And whenever I call to them Thou mayest forgive them, they thrust their fingers in their ears and cover themselves with their garments, and persist and are big with pride

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then surely I have called to them aloud

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then spoken to them in public and spoken to them in private

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So I have said: Ask forgiveness of your Lord; surely He is ever Forgiving

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He will send down upon you rain, pouring in abundance

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And help you with wealth and sons, and make for you gardens, and make for you rivers

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is the matter with you that you hope not for greatness from Allah

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And indeed He has created you by various stages

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: See you not how Allah has created the seven heavens alike

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And made the moon therein a light, and made the sun a lamp

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has caused you to grow out of the earth as a growth

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then He returns you to it, then will He bring you forth a (new) bringing forth

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Allah has made the earth a wide expanse for you

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That you may go along therein in spacious paths

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Noah said: My Lord, surely they disobey me and follow him whose wealth and children have increased him in naught but loss

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they have planned a mighty plan

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they say: Forsake not your gods; nor forsake Wadd, nor Suwa’, nor Yaghuth and Ya’uq and Nasr

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And indeed they have led many astray. And increase Thou the wrongdoers in naught but perdition

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Because of their wrongs they were drowned, then made to enter Fire, so they found no helpers besides Allah

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And Noah said: My Lord, leave not of the disbelievers any dweller on the land

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: For if Thou leave them, they will lead astray Thy servants, and will not beget any but immortal, ungrateful ones

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and him who enters my house believing, and the believing men and the believing women. And increase not the wrongdoers in aught but destruction

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: It has been revealed to me that a party of the jinn listened, so they said: Surely we have heard a wonderful Qur’an

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Guiding to the right way -- so we believe in it. And we shall not set up any one with our Lord

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And He -- exalted be the majesty of our Lord! -- has not taken a consort, nor a son

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the foolish among us used to forge extravagant lies against Allah

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we thought that men and jinn did not utter a lie against Allah

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And persons from among men used to seek refuge with persons from among the jinn, so they increased them in evil doing

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they thought, as you think that Allah would not raise anyone

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we sought to reach heaven, but we found it filled with strong guards and flames

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we used to sit in some of the sitting-places thereof to steal a hearing. But he who tries to listen now finds a flame lying in wait for him

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we know not whether evil is meant for those on earth or whether their Lord means to direct them aright

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And some of us are good and others of us are below that -- we are sects following different ways

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And we know that we cannot escape Allah in the earth, nor can we escape Him by flight

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. So whoever believes in his Lord, he fears neither loss nor injustice

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And some of us are those who submit, and some of us are deviators. So whoever submits, these aim at the right way

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And as to deviators, they are fuel of hell

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And if they keep to the (right) way, We would certainly give them to drink of abundant water

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So that We may try them thereby. And whoever turns away from the reminder of his Lord, He will make him enter into an afflicting chastisement

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the mosques are Allah’s, so call not upon any one with Allah

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And when the Servant of Allah stood up praying to Him, they well-nigh crowded him (to death)

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I only call upon my Lord, and associate naught with Him

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I control not evil nor good for you

22.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: None can protect me against Allah, nor can I find any refuge besides Him

23.Maulana Muhammad Ali: (Mine is naught) but to deliver (the command) of Allah and His messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, surely for him is the Fire of hell, to abide therein for ages

24.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Till when they see that which they are promised, they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in numbers

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Say: I know not whether that which you are promised is nigh or if my Lord will appoint for it a distant term

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Knower of the unseen, so He makes His secrets known to non

27.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except a messenger whom He chooses. For surely He makes a guard to go before him and after him

28.Maulana Muhammad Ali: That He may know that they have truly delivered the messages of their Lord; and He encompasses what is with them, and He keeps account of all things

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: O thou covering thyself up

2.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Rise to pray by night except a little

3.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Half of it, or lessen it a little

4.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Or add to it, and recite the Qur’an in a leisurely manner

5.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We shall charge thee with a weighty word

6.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The rising by night is surely the firmest way to tread and most effective in speech

7.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Truly thou hast by day prolonged occupation

8.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And remember the name of thy Lord and devote thyself to Him with (complete) devotion

9.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The Lord of the East and the West -- there is no God but He -- so take Him for Protector

10.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And bear patiently what they say and forsake them with a becoming withdrawal

11.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And leave Me and the deniers, possessors of plenty, and respite them a little

12.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely with Us are heavy fetters and a flaming Fire

13.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And food that chokes and a painful chastisement

14.Maulana Muhammad Ali: On the day when the earth and the mountains quake and the mountains become (as) heaps of sand let loose

15.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely We have sent to you a Messenger, a witness against you, as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh

16.Maulana Muhammad Ali: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a violent grip

17.Maulana Muhammad Ali: How, then, if you disbelieve, will you guard yourselves on the day which will make children grey-headed

18.Maulana Muhammad Ali: The heaven being rent asunder thereby. His promise is ever fulfilled

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this is a Reminder; so let him who will, take a way to his Lord

20.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Thy Lord knows indeed that thou passest in prayer nearly two-thirds of the night, and (sometimes) half of it, and (sometimes) a third of it, as do a party of those with thee. And Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that (all of) you are not able to do it, so He has turned to you (mercifully); so read of the Qur’an that which is easy for you. He knows that there are sick among you, and others who travel in the land seeking of Allah’s bounty, and others who fight in Allah’s way. So read as much of it as is easy (for you), and keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate and offer to Allah a goodly fight. And whatever of good you send on beforehand for yourselves, you will find it with Allah -- that is best and greatest in reward. And ask forgiveness of Allah. Surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Over it are nineteen

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And We have made none but angels wardens of the Fire, and We have not made their number but as a trial for those who disbelieve, that those who have been given the Book may be certain and those who believe may increase in faith, and those who have been given the Book and the believers may not doubt; and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the disbelievers may say: What does Allah mean by this parable? Thus Allah leaves in error whom He pleases, and guides whom He pleases. And none knows the hosts of thy Lord but He. And this is naught but a Reminder to mortals

32.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, by the moon

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the night when it departs

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And the dawn when it shines! -

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely it is one of the gravest (misfortunes)

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: A warning to mortals

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: To him among you who will go forward or will remain behind

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Except the people of the right hand

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: In Gardens, they ask one another

41.Maulana Muhammad Ali: About the guilty

49.Maulana Muhammad Ali: What is then the matter with them, that they turn away from the Reminder

50.Maulana Muhammad Ali: As if they were frightened asses

51.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Fleeing from a lion

52.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, every one of them desires that he should be given pages spread out -

53.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By no means! But they fear not the hereafter

54.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nay, it is surely a Reminder

55.Maulana Muhammad Ali: So whoever pleases may mind it

56.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And they will not mind unless Allah please. He is Worthy that duty should be kept to Him and Worthy to forgive

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

21.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And neglect the hereafter

33.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then he went to his people in haughtiness

34.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Nearer to thee and nearer

35.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Again, nearer to thee and nearer (is woe)

36.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Does man think that he will be left aimless

37.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Was he not a small life-germ in sperm emitted

39.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Then He made of him two kinds, the male and the female

40.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Is not He powerful to give life to the dead

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely there came over man a time when he was nothing that could be mentioned

25.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And glorify the name of thy Lord morning and evening

26.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And during part of the night adore Him, and glorify Him throughout a long night

29.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Surely this is a Reminder; so whoever will, let him take a way to his Lord

30.Maulana Muhammad Ali: And you will not, unless Allah pleases. Surely Allah is ever Knowing, Wise -

31.Maulana Muhammad Ali: He admits whom He pleases to His mercy; and the wrongdoers -- He has prepared for them a painful chastisement

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: By those sent forth to spread goodness

19.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Woe on that day to the rejectors

47.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Woe on that day to the rejectors

1.Maulana Muhammad Ali: Of what do they ask one another
